post_text: What could a recurring dream that I suddenly find hidden rooms in my house, that I had never been before or that I had forgotten existed? They make me excited and I want to explore them, they suddenly make ￼￼the house significantly￼ larger than it normally is. I’ve had this dream many times, in houses that were actually mine that I lived in at the time or had lived previously, or in houses that in the dream were mine but ￼that I have never been before￼￼￼￼ in waking life.
comment_text: I get those, too. I think of them as locations within my psyche. Not just houses, sometimes there are areas/regions, which change from time to time, but which I recognize as modifications of places I've been before.

post_text: What could a recurring dream that I suddenly find hidden rooms in my house, that I had never been before or that I had forgotten existed? They make me excited and I want to explore them, they suddenly make ￼￼the house significantly￼ larger than it normally is. comment_text:
Yeah, they're quite common themes. Agree with Rick re relating to the psyche, or maybe sometimes the unconscious unconscious specifically. When I have these dreams the buildings often have an awe inspiring quality, huge, beautiful buildings.

Carl Jung described a dream of his with this same basic theme. In his, he went down multiple levels, and each level the furniture got more and more antique, eventually coming across a couple of skulls laying on the dusty ground of the lowest level. He understood it as relating to the collective unconscious.

I've also had dreams of climbing circular buildings in spiral stair cases, I think also relates to the psyche itself. Jung described the way the psyche spirals, or circumambulate a centre.

post_text:
A common theme in my dreams is driving, and has been for years.

I used to have recurring nightmares about driving through mixmasters that were confusing and more like roller coaster tracks than roads, but haven’t had those for a long time.

A very common recurring theme of late is driving large vans, semi trucks, or RVs over very precarious twisty mountain roads in which I’m constantly about to topple off the road. I’ve never driven an RV or very big truck though. The large vehicle driving over precarious roads started maybe a year ago.

Last night I dreamt I was driving my own minivan (which I love and is not hard to drive, it’s my mobile bike garage and changing room) but there was someone else I was traveling with but we were driving in his vehicle, and then I would go get mine (not sure how that was even possible) and bring it to the current location, while on a multi day road trip. He had tried driving it but was very bothered by how cumbersome it seemed to drive and preferred his smaller and more manageable car. When I drove my minivan after driving his car some I also thought it seemed pretty bulky and difficult to maneuver and park.

I’m going through a lot lately and my dreams have become very vivid since I stopped smoking weed six weeks ago after being a multiple times a day smoker for many years. Cannabis suppresses dreams, but I still would have fairly vivid dreams, they’re just super vivid now.
comment_text:
In my experience, vehicles I associate generally with 'my current path in life'.

I've had similar dreams about various large vehicles, buses, lorries shedding part of their load into the road, and of cars blowing up, and vehicles reaching an unpassable/
narrow section ahead of a sharp turn, then stopping. For me, I think* it related to my plan to go part time at work, shed some of my workload.

When I recognise a general theme shared across dreams, I then look for the smaller details that are different across dreams. In one of mine involving a bus my boss randomly cropped up in it, which is wy I think they related to my work life, and plan to go part time. I was also getting the bus to work at the time.

I tend to believe that every little detail in dreams is significant, so I'd suggest picking out some of the smallest odd little details and try and find an interpretation that explains both the general theme, as well as the details, too.

Vivid dreams after stopping smoking weed is really common, they tend to fade or stop being recalled some weeks later. People do say they suppress dreams, and also the fact they inhibit short term memory and probably make us sleep deeper may also mean recalling dreams in lighter, broken sleep more likely.

post_text:
Dream
2/21/22

Right before bed I was writing about my goals and activities. The dream involved me, Elliot, and Dave Chappell flying a helicopter. We were on some sort of mission, and I was becoming skilled at managing the horizontal and vertical aspects of flight. I had accumulated about five hours of flight time, and Dave alluded to a combat kill as well. At one point Dave was going to fly, and he tossed the keys up on the roof by accident. He recovered them without incident. The baby was in the back, secured in a car seat. Our last flight was in a city, and Dave expressed some urgency. I was very cautious and flew very gingerly because there were many power lines around and I didn’t want to become entangled and crash.

Context- I have just started a new job in my field after earning my masters in September. I’m also doing a sleep plan as part of a burnout recovery regimen.

The feeling tone of the dream was adventurous. I was encouraged. Then at the end with the power lines I was worried.
comment_text: I think it's a wonderfully positive dream. I wouldn't worry about the "power lines" atm, these will become clear with time. As the good doctor says, there are hierarchies everywhere. You are very prudent to be cautious, but you didn't appear to be anxious.

post_text: Hey guys, I'm wondering if you started having intense, highly symbolic dreams the minute you started taking an interest in dreams and listening to Jordan speak about them? I've always dreamed a lot, but I haven't been dreaming for a while. However, since listening to his biblical series they've come on loud and strong. Perhaps I'm just noticing them more? or it could be coincidental as I've been anxious too with the end of the year change etc.. Anyway I've just written my last three night's worth of dreams down and I'm going to make more of an effort with journalling my dreams. Does anyone here journal reguarly since watching JP talk about dreams? And do you find you dream more now you are conciously exploring them??
comment_text:
Exactly that. I hadn't recalled a dream for well over a decade prior. JP himself said the same thing, that he started to recall his dreams after reading Jung, and his dreams.

I think it is simply the result of directing your interest and attention. Like when you want to buy some thing, and then you start seeing it everywhere. Your unconscious filters in that which you put your interest and attention on.

post_text:
Hello, I would like to ask again about a dream interpretation that I found unnerving. My dreams are fragmented, but I´ll do my best do describe it.

I was walking through medieval cellars that were continually getting tighter, in one instance I even had to squeeze through. on the floors, there laid a number of turtles, some on their back, some about to fall, and some just lying normally. Their heads were scaly, some reminiscent of a dragon.

When I got out of the cellar I found myself on a town square. It was evening, lights dim with some shadows flying around. Only one shadow was dense and round. It wore a blue and white jacket with a masquerade mask. I provocatively yelled at it "Hey death!" It noticed me and started slowly and ominously chasing me.

Suddenly, a girl clad in a celebratory village dress. She said that "It´s starting" and took me inside of a room that was connected with the town square. A great iron gate with bars was closed behind me. More girls who had the same dress were inside. Clergymen started a prayer, yet I did not know the words. I felt ashamed, anxious, and the shadow was staring at me hauntingly. Then a dance started, I did not know the moves, I was being pushed around, I even pushed off a glass that broke. Everyone was dancing on the glass shards and clothes that looked like mine that weren't there before. The Clergymen were watching me disapprovingly. The women did not care, they were happy that I was trying to dance with them.

After the dance, I started picking up the shards and cut myself accidentally. My blood was not dense, and it was watery. After the cut, my father called me and asked me how I was.

Then it ended and I woke up cold and anxious.

I am really confused about this dream. Lately, I had dreams about swimming pools, oceans, and journeys that led nowhere and I had to go back.

I would appreciate it if anyone looked into this.
comment_text: Is there anyone you can talk to? Investigate how you felt.? You woke feeling fear but what about the rest of it? You are the only one that can interpret by teasing out what reminders to your life are trying to get your attention. It helps if someone impartial can help you through this. Good luck, it sounds important.

comment_text:
I think you said it yourself, the dark, ominous "shadow" chasing you was your Shadow, in the Jungian sense - all the things which you reject and repress in yourself.

Jung would say the turtle is a common symbol of the Self, a turtle on it's back or about to fall might represent a less than ideal state of the Self, one in need of/lacking help. He has also described the turtle as representing the transcendent function, that which unites the opposites.

Jung has also said reptile-like scales - and the dragon - are associated with the sympathetic nervous system. Incidentally, the sypathetic nervous system is what constricts blood vessels, allowing them to move through smaller spaces under pressure, as you were in this dream. I wonder whether your blood taking on a watery quality is somehow also related. You said you woke up cold. vasoconstrictio
n of the blood vessels is what keeps you warm when cold.

Ordinarily, blood is associated with emotion, in Jungian interpretations
.

To me, this dream seems like it might be about integration of the personal Shadow, in order to aid the development of the Self, but given your point about watery blood, crawling along constricted routes, and waking up cold, I wonder whether this dream is simply a response to your physical state at the time of the dream.

comment_text:
This is one of those dreams that sound amazing for Jungian interpretation - so full of symbols. There is a very classic interpretation by Jung (one of his own dreams if I remember correctly) where he interpreted a house in a dream as an image if the mind. The basement is the subconscious. Deep beneath the house is the collective unconscious, where dragons and monsters dwell. These are the complexes of the collective unconscious, the things that you need to face in order to mature as a human being. Tod Venn mentions the dragons and Shadow above. The village and traditional clothing also sounds as relating to the collective subconscious. I think Peterson would say that this relates to drives that are collective to us as humans, and sometimes older that Homo Sapiens.

There is a conflict here between the feminine (the women) and a religious and/or patriarchal authority (clergy, your father). There appears to be a situation that is out of your control; the dancing on broken glass, closed gates, you are pushed around and don't know the moves. Maybe some kind of ecstatic feeling of being out of control. Maybe you need to learn to let go? There is also a conflict here; on the one hand you are trying to dance, on the other hand the clergy and your father are disapproving of you. You may want to contemplate this in relation to your relationship to your father. This may either refer to your actual father or be a symbol of a hierarchical way of thinking, especially as relating to religion and spirituality (considering the clergy).

The part about the blood is also interesting, and I would advise you to contemplate it rather that try to give you an answer. My spontaneous associations are that blood is thicker than water, and also the passage in the Gospels where a Roman sticks a spear into the side of the crucified Christ, and both blood and water comes out (a scene which is closely related to baptism and the Mass), but these are my associations, not yours.

post_text:
Hi guys, I haven't had a nightmare in some time. I can't even remember the last time. This was one of those ones you wake up shaking from and SO glad it was only a dream.
I was somehow involved in a murder. An acquaintance of ours (a big man) had beaten another man to death and a few of my friends and I had sort of egged him on over text message. The whole dream was the police surrounding us all, mostly old school friends, a toxic ex best friend of mine and a toxic ex boyfriend. Also my beloved grandma who has passed, had been involved!
We were all surrounded by the police and about to be interrogated. I knew that if they saw my text messages or diary entries (I had a few journals lying around in a bag and in my hand etc), I was screwed. I was considering deleteting the messages or journal entries but didn't want to act like I was covering anything up.
I was trying desperately to talk discreetly to my friends (with the police around us) to make sure we were on the same page about what we were going to say.
I knew I was facing jail. Maybe 1-6 months. Or maybe none at all, but I was just hoping and praying I wouldn't go to jail.
My main focus was my kids and them thinking I was the worst mum in the world for going to jail. I've already done a few things to disappoint them and I knew this one would just take the cake...
Thoughts? Thanks if you got this far :)
comment_text:
Jung spoke about how the 'strong man', or thug, is the archetypal representation of the first stage of the development of the female's Animus.

The natural tendency for us to repress aspects of our behaviour interests me, and is obviously a function of the unconscious, like not allowing ourselves to be aggressive and let off steam, which can cause us to eventually explode like a pressure cooker etc. I wonder whether the violent behavior of the masculine symbol was so intolerable to you it made you act violently too. I wonder whether this is about the way you judge against the naturally repressed aspects of your own personality which have value, which the unconscious projects onto the masculine symbol here.

Given the thug, this dream may relate to the initial stage of Animus integration, and given that you were involved in the killing of him, may speak to how you judge against and repress what he represented, in yourself. The killing may also imply a transition from the first stage, to the second stage of the development of your Animus. In the second stage the Animus, the symbolically masculine aspect of the female's personality is associated with forward planning, among other things, as you were in this dream.

Here is a very brief post that references Jungs point about the forms the Animus takes on, including the initial stage taking the form of a strong man/thug. It's form changes over time. Next it might appear as an intellectual, professor or similar.

Jungs last book Man & His Symbols speaks about the job of the female in integrating her Animus, and the difficulty in doing so, its reward, and the evolving forms it takes on in females dreams.

ition-of-animus

post_text:
Hello everyone (that is such a JP thing to say lol), so I've been taking this drug called Lyrica for my chronic nerve pain and it is renonwed for causing wild and wonderful dreams. The funny thing is my mother is on it too.
We have this morning ritual where we wake up and text each other all about the most fantastical dreams we've just had. They honestly go on and on and are fascinating. A pretty nice thing to do over our morning coffee.
I also just bought a dream journal ealier this year because I had planned to start delving into my dreams more and looking for patterns and meanings, etc.
However, I'm wondering if a drug-induced dream is a realistic representation of my life and what I'm going through... and whether I should only really be looking at the dreams when I'm in a more natural state?
What do you think? If only Carl Jung were here to ask lol
comment_text: Drug altered dreams, imo, can give you useful insights. However, I would be careful in self analyzing any dream, particularly dreams affected by chemical use. I'm not sure what your dreams are like, but sometimes a purple dog is just a purple dog, not a metaphor for anything else

post_text:
13/6/21

Broken Escalator, Indian Store

I am walking around a dilapidated city. It is an urban area. There are bridges here and there, I walk around - supposedly using a map. Not too sure. I end up having navigated myself at a store which contains carpets and other antique looking things. It seems to be an Indian store that sells carpets and furnishings. I go to the end of the store, where the receptionist walks me through, she presents with her hands from the back of the store the view of the whole store into the front. Above me there is a broken escalator which captures my attention, I then look up and notice to my surprise that there are people up there but there is no way to enter the second level of this furnishing store. I then leave the store and walk into a shop that is selling religious photos of Krishna and Radha used for decorating altars.
comment_text:
There's a lot of layers in this dream. I'll just tell you what I think the symbols reference.
Dilapidated: not taken care of, unhealthy, worn out. (Buildings typically reference the self).
Carpeting: something that covers something, like possibly feelings, emotions.
Antiques: something from the past.
Broken escalator going up: a means to get to a 'higher' level isn't working.
The other people on the higher floor represent different aspects of your personality, character. In other words, something is holding you back, and likely something from the past.
* When I say, "you", I mean that in general terms, not the OP directly.

post_text:
Recently I've been experiencing a weird phenomenon. I have very vivid dreams once every two or three nights, that are either reiterations of old, repeating dreams I used to have a long, long time ago, or are set in one of the past stages of my life.

The content of the dreams itself is not what is weird to me, but what I'm confused by is that several times a week I have a dream that is completely and perfectly set in one of the past stages of my life. I had two dreams that were entirely set in my childhood home, with all the people appearing in the dream being consistent with that time of my life, and a perfectly consistent story too. Then I'd have one set at school, then at highschool, then at one of appartments I used to live in with an ex girlfriend. Some of them are copies of repeating dreams I used to have, some of the scenarios seem new. Almost each time I have them, I wake up completely confused, kind of panicked, still mentally in the time period I dreamed about, and I need a minute to remember that I now live in a completely different place, I have a wife, a kid, a job etc.

Of course I realize that dreaming about the past is nothing unusual, but I never experienced such sudden onset and frequency of dreams that almost teleport me to the past. As I said, what's unusual about the dreams is that they kind of encapsulate the time period they're set in - so, for example, my wife doesn't appear in a dream that happens during my college days, back when we did not know each other (which wouldn't be an unusual cross-over in many of my "regular" past-set dreams).

I feel like some long inactive neural connections in my brain started firing off suddenly, and I don't know what's the reason, and therefore I'm not sure if it's a good or a bad thing. I have no idea why this is happening right now. I'd expect this kind of thing to be triggered by some stressful events, or some subconscious anxiety, but honestly even though I carry more responsibility than ever before in my life, I've also never been so "happy" and "on track" in my life.

Did anyone else experience something like this? Googling this phenomenon did not yield any interesting results.
comment_text:
Not experienced anything quite like this, nor heard of anything like it either that I can recall, oddly.

It might be worthwhile, having noted the general narrative/
timeline theme, to focus on some details across the set of dreams you're relating together to see if you can narrow down on what it is they're driving at more specifically, which might explain something about 'why' the series.

post_text:
Recently I've been experiencing a weird phenomenon. I have very vivid dreams once every two or three nights, that are either reiterations of old, repeating dreams I used to have a long, long time ago, or are set in one of the past stages of my life.

The content of the dreams itself is not what is weird to me, but what I'm confused by is that several times a week I have a dream that is completely and perfectly set in one of the past stages of my life. I had two dreams that were entirely set in my childhood home, with all the people appearing in the dream being consistent with that time of my life, and a perfectly consistent story too. Then I'd have one set at school, then at highschool, then at one of appartments I used to live in with an ex girlfriend. Some of them are copies of repeating dreams I used to have, some of the scenarios seem new. Almost each time I have them, I wake up completely confused, kind of panicked, still mentally in the time period I dreamed about, and I need a minute to remember that I now live in a completely different place, I have a wife, a kid, a job etc.

Of course I realize that dreaming about the past is nothing unusual, but I never experienced such sudden onset and frequency of dreams that almost teleport me to the past. As I said, what's unusual about the dreams is that they kind of encapsulate the time period they're set in - so, for example, my wife doesn't appear in a dream that happens during my college days, back when we did not know each other (which wouldn't be an unusual cross-over in many of my "regular" past-set dreams).

I feel like some long inactive neural connections in my brain started firing off suddenly, and I don't know what's the reason, and therefore I'm not sure if it's a good or a bad thing. I have no idea why this is happening right now. I'd expect this kind of thing to be triggered by some stressful events, or some subconscious anxiety, but honestly even though I carry more responsibility than ever before in my life, I've also never been so "happy" and "on track" in my life.

Did anyone else experience something like this? Googling this phenomenon did not yield any interesting results.

post_text: In my dream, I am in the attic of a palatial building that is public, but somehow also mine. A small staircase leads upwards. To the left is the interior of a baroque church. Closer to me on my left, thus also to the left of the way into the church, lay three water scoops; two in polished wood, two in silver. To the right is a way up in the attic. The first thing one sees there is three child sized coffins, one of which contains my fiancé’s infant brother. To my left, in front of the small upwards staircase, is much grander staircase leading downwards into a magnificent light room with grand windows and staircases leader further down into the palace. In its center stands and tall marble statue of the goddess Venus.

The goddess Venus
I don’t know what your dream is about, however there are some things that seem to stand out.

Then I heard another voice calling from heaven, “Come away from her, my people. Do not take part in her sins, or you will be punished with her.
Since Venus is at the centre of the palace in your dream it may be well to,make mention of her.

Venus
Goddess of love, beauty, desire, sex, fertility, prosperity and victory.

A 2nd- or 3rd-century bronze figurine of Venus, in the collection of the Museum of Fine Arts of Lyon[4]
Origins[edit]
Venus has been described as perhaps "the most original creation of the Roman pantheon",[5]: 146 and "an ill-defined and assimilative" native goddess, combined "with a strange and exotic Aphrodite".[b] Her cults may represent the religiously legitimate charm and seduction of the divine by mortals, in contrast to the formal, contractual relations between most members of Rome's official pantheon and the state, and the unofficial, illicit manipulation of divine forces through magic.[5]: 13–64 [7] The ambivalence of her persuasive functions has been perceived in the relationship of the root *wenos- with its Latin derivative venenum ('poison'; from *wenes-no 'love drink' or 'addicting'),[8
] in the sense of "a charm, magic philtre".[9]

In myth, Venus-Aphrodite
was born, already in adult form, from the sea foam (Greek αφρός, aphros) produced by the severed genitals of Caelus-Uranus.[
10] Roman theology presents Venus as the yielding, watery female principle, essential to the generation and balance of life. Her male counterparts in the Roman pantheon, Vulcan and Mars, are active and fiery. Venus absorbs and tempers the male essence, uniting the opposites of male and female in mutual affection. She is essentially assimilative and benign, and embraces several otherwise quite disparate functions. She can give military victory, sexual success, good fortune and prosperity. In one context, she is a goddess of prostitutes; in another, she turns the hearts of men and women from sexual vice to virtue.[c]

Prospective brides offered Venus a gift "before the wedding"; the nature of the gift, and its timing, are unknown. The wedding ceremony itself, and the state of lawful marriage, belonged to Juno - whose mythology allows her only a single marriage, and no divorce from her habitually errant spouse, Jupiter - but Venus and Juno are also likely "bookends" for the ceremony; Venus prepares the bride for "conubial bliss" and expectations of fertility within lawful marriage. Some Roman sources say that girls who come of age offer their toys to Venus; it is unclear where the offering is made, and others say this gift is to the Lares.[12] In dice-games played with knucklebones, a popular pastime among Romans of all classes, the luckiest, best possible roll was known as "Venus".[13]

A SYMBOL OF PURIFICATION

The process of heating silver to burn off the dross and other imperfections is a metaphor used throughout Scripture. God’s Word itself is described in value beyond silver: “The promises of the LORD are pure, like silver refined in a furnace and purified seven times” (Ps 12:6). The purification process was sometimes used as a symbol for the way God tests and refines people: “You have tested us, O God. You have refined us in the same way silver is refined” (Ps 66:10; see also Isa 48:10). A silversmith would have to attentively watch the silver, getting it to just the right heat, in order to purify the metal. God also watches us as he put us through fiery trials, never leaving us for an instant and only allowing the situation to progress to the point where it is helpful for our sanctification.

This sounds stupid but it really disturbed me.

I dreamt I was in a cinema and everyone had gone home and I knew I shouldn't be there. Then there were cameras coming out of the walls (bursting out). Then I was being chased by something round the cinema.

The whole scene jumped, I was at home watching television. Some programme was on with a toy Teddy bear, the bear started shaking and the fur was ripping and some sort of monster was braki through. I couldn't get the television off, the remote wasn't working.

I woke up shaking with my heart hammering. I know it sounds silly but it really disturbed me.

Thoughts?

comment_text:
The empty cinema part and knowing you shouldn't be in there is terrifying enough to me in and of itself...

If this was me I'd say it had something to do with the power of watching to destroy. Camille Paglia talks about Cinema as the 'aggressive Western Eye'. This power is 'Apollonian', she says, like the power of Medusa to turns things to stone through nothing but gaze.

This is from her book, 'Sexual Personae':

"Arrow, eye, gun, cinema: the blazing lightbeam of the movie projector is our modern path of Apollonian transcendance. Cinema is the culmination of the obsessive, mechanistic male drive in western culture. The movie projector is an Apollonian straightshooter
, demonstrating the link between aggression and art. Every pictorial framing is a ritual limitation, a barred precinct. The rectangular movie screen is clearly patterned on the post-Renaissanc
e framed painting. But all conceptualizati
on is a framing."

Your toy teddy bear is undergoing a change the monster within his breaking through this once loveable toy.
The tv scene has taught you somehow there is a way to bring things to life except instead of bringing the best out of the lifeless toy the transformation of the toy teddy somehow brings out the monster ?
Perhaps this intrigued you this transformation of the toy teddy it’s your teddy you should be able to control it right?
Looking back at the cinema you understand the same idea that if the tv at home has the power to bring toys to life then how much more power does a larger than life cinema screen have to bring you to life to transform you into much more that you are?
You go to the cinema with the idea of using its mechanism that is its projector and film tapes to film yourself and then project yourself onto the big screen. By filming yourself and projecting yourself onto the cinema screen you attempt to bring out the inner you to bring you to life that is what the cinema screen is designed to do.
However just like the toy bear that is harmless and comforting a monstrous change takes place you find that you are now being chased around this cinema you know you shouldn’t be doing this transformation stuff but you can’t resist. Now that you have released your inner self and bought it to life via the mechanism of the cinema you find that it has released a monster just like the toy bear? It chased you why? Because you have miscalculated that you think you are in control but by circumnavigatin
g natural methods of growth and try to release the inner and more powerful you like the bear seem to turn on yourself and it is no longer your friend no longer a comfort but in breathing life into something that’s not ready it turns on you.
In summary it seems like you are dabbling with the inner self in ways that are not healthy for you, yes you discovered how to bring things to life but even doctor Frankenstein could do that.
The way you go about indulging these transformations
are merely mechanical there is no time for healthy integration no time to slowly grow into maturity just a quick fix and a flirt with nature that turns against you.
Ok here is the correct method of transformation.

Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God’s will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.
Romans 12:2
Notice the mind first needs to be renewed but by your creator not you!
God made you to a pattern in his image he made you in a way that you are meant ti be transformed under his hand not yours not a monster that chases you. That transformation is performed miraculously by the Holy Spirit and the end result will be a beautiful spiritual person not a monster.
Having been transformed you will also receive the power of god that y are craving but that godly power to do good be be content with your life.

post_text:
This sounds stupid but it really disturbed me.

I dreamt I was in a cinema and everyone had gone home and I knew I shouldn't be there. Then there were cameras coming out of the walls (bursting out). Then I was being chased by something round the cinema.

The whole scene jumped, I was at home watching television. Some programme was on with a toy Teddy bear, the bear started shaking and the fur was ripping and some sort of monster was braki through. I couldn't get the television off, the remote wasn't working.

I woke up shaking with my heart hammering. I know it sounds silly but it really disturbed me.

Thoughts?
comment_text:
Looking into childhood can be tough, it can be hard to have to see where our monsters come from and even harder when we realize the monster is still chasing us even now.

Why are we being chased? Who is watching when we think we are alone? What is on the other side of the wall?

If you are ready to stop trying to change your past and instead tell-a-vision then let’s do this. Your going to shake and feel like your hair is standing on end but your going to see the monster.

I know you think the thing is “stupid” and who knows maybe it is but you can’t change it tell you look at it for what it is.

post_text:
Ideas Welcome:
Raptors were after us. I was in a big old fashioned hotel of sorts; more like people lived there in many rooms. Raptors are in the hotel and we're trying to find places to hide. (There's a kid with me and I forget who else.) I trying to hide in different places but never find one satisfactory. I try stuffing myself, slat by slat between the wooden slats under the bed and the mattress, but this actually feels very exposed and like the wood might snap, attracting dinosaur. I wanted to be wrapped up in several several blankets and have boxes and things stacked in front of me in a closet, or hide my face amongst stuffed animals like an E.T., but all this moving is making noise and there isn’t adequate stuff to cover me. I'm making noise and time is running out. For all I know I'm attracting the things which are certainly killing people in this huge boarding house/hotel.

I cross the hall and chance finding a hiding spot in another room, when I decide on a real solution and slip outside the window and I'm standing on winging bricks that wrap around the building like in a Hitchcock movie. I remember I've dreamed the same dream before and the raptors can scale and climb all over the outside of the building, too. But I don't see any. Finally I decide, screw this place, and run across the lawn toward traffic.

Now my lovely friend is there with me and now a raptor is chasing us both. It seems obvious that the raptor is going to catch us, but she yells out that we've beat it before, like everything will be fine, and indeed we make it into traffic.

I'm hoping it will be hit. We make it into a parked food truck, where men are working. The fear of raptor-pursuit is greatly reduced. I tell them to take me anywhere but there. Rebecca, on the other hand, confidently tells them to drop her right back off by the front of the lawn and confidently struts back toward the hotel. This is right after I say the words out loud "take me anywhere but there".

Years ago I'd dream about dinosaurs and the end of the world a lot. I don't know about raptors. There used to be a lot of holding still In the presence of T-Rex.
🎀🎄🎄🎄🎄🎀🎄🎄🎄🎄🎀🎄🎄🎄🎄🎀

I woke up to a blizzard blowing in through the back door then Los Lobos singing La Bamba started playing on my phone.
comment_text:
The combination of hiding from dinosaurs, specifically raptors, and the E.T. stuffed toy suggests the experience is out of Jurassic Park (both also Steven Spielberg films popular during the 1990's).

Maybe you've associated something about the time you watched these films with the desire to go on an adventure that is often terrifying.

I know I used to have very intense zombie dreams that felt both exciting and terrifying. I watched the zombie films and tv shows when I had a chronic sleep disorder and was unemployed and they were the one real adventure i felt I had in my life. I get the sense my own zombie dreams/
nightmares were a sign I wasn't living the adventure my life was supposed to be, and so enacted it in my dreams instead.

comment_text:
Impressions:

Hotel- place where people sleep temporarily but don’t stay

Raptor- instincts, drives, urges that you regard as predatory and frightening- Shadow

You try hiding in bed but it doesn’t work- afraid of savage/
predatory urges that take place in bed

You trying to hide among blankets and stuffed animals- childish patterns and comforts don’t help with uncomfortable feelings like this

Climbing outside of building- “leaving home” because of the urges/feelings

Friend is courageous and upbeat- the unconscious encouraging you to crowdsource this problem? Or maybe an element of your personality is particularly well-suited to this problem and needs more “funding”

Traffic- cars often signify ones life path- stalled car is feeling stuck, someone else driving is feeling out of control, etc trying to lose the raptors in traffic is like hoping the normal ebb and flow of life will help distract from the problem

Men on a food truck- one urge- eating- protecting from another urge, or from negative feelings. Troubled relationship with food as a coping mechanism?

Friend- “take me back there.” Part of you knows good and well that confronting the raptors is the right move, and another part wants to flee from that encounter

Any of that resonate?

post_text:
Had a dream where my friend bought a haunted house. The ghost was one of those that would slam doors and try to hurt people.
In the dream, I found myself staring down this ghost while it was in a doorway. I was standing in the doorway and I seemed to be annoying the spirit.
It kept making faces and moving erratically but I wasn’t scared of it.
After a second of this it pushed me out of the way and slammed the door.
This isn’t the first dream I have had that is like this.
I have had others over the past two weeks where I’ve faced a foe and stared it down.
comment_text: Well, I'm not too sure about your interpretation as I'm not well versed in this type of dream. I would take this dream as a sign of your awareness and power growing. You are not cowering in fear from these things, you are facing these things down and possibly even mocking them by staring them down. Maybe you have a spiritual guide that is calling on you to face your fears and you are answering the call. I would say your powers are growing and you are becoming more aware somehow and you are beginning to notice it and act upon it by accepting the challenge rather than shrinking away from it.

post_text:
Hey here is a interesting dream for you guys to interpret! So things are about to get vulnerable for me, but that’s okay!

I had a dream that I found out my ex husbands mistress moved two hours to my hometown where I now live and started professionally dancing in the pub here (she’s not a dancer in real life) anyways, I was at the pub with my friends and saw her and got so heated. I went up to her and said she needs to get out of this town and stop showing her face here because if she doesn’t leave, I’m going to tell everyone exactly who she is and exactly what she did to my family and my kids. She responded really rudely saying I forgave a friend for something similar.. and I said “My friend did not sleep with a married man who had adopted children and help to break up a family.” I then went and told friend what she said and friend went and dumped a whole beer on her head.

Here’s what I think. My marriage ended in 2017.. I’ve been on a road of healing ever since and since I firmly believe (with some psychology background under my belt now and knowing what I know about him) that my ex is a narcissist, I always try to see this girl as feeling sorry for her and what she must be going through, and feeling free from this man and hoping she gets free too. Maybe there are some other “feelings” I have not been accepting, because the ones in this dream were extremely hostile.
comment_text:
I think, for what it's worth, that if you consciously understand that she is both guilty and a victim of your husband at the same time, perhaps in the subconscious you are both legitimately angry at her and a little angry at yourself, both for being a victim of a narcissist and in a sense for not forgiving her.

Just to clarify, I don't mean you should forgive her or think you really did forgive someone else for the same thing. I'm just taking a punt at what YOU might feel underneath, and if it's off base, no worries, I'm just wrong.

I suspect that because it's a complicated issue, because there's a conflict between her guilt and victimhood, it's just difficult to know whether you should a. be angry with her for her guilt or b. forgive her because she's also another of your ex-husband's victims. I don't know either, but just to reassure you, those conflicting emotions are all normal and valid. IF you have any anger towards yourself, whether for being his victim, for not doing enough to keep the family together (that's a bullshit lie if you ever feel that), for not forgiving her (yet or IF you ever decide to), that anger is also valid in context of how difficult the situation is but also misplaced.

Because you have been mistreated, partly by her, it makes perfect sense that you can't just forgive her casually, just because she's also a victim. It makes sense that you might feel like she's following you and blaming you or acting entitled to forgiveness automatically, because the confusion and hurt follow you.

I would also suggest that you are a forgiving person, if you have a subconscious awareness of forgiving people for certain things, but it isn't as simple as that when you're the victim, particularly of betrayal *(the worst of all sins, if you will).

You couldn't help and don't bare any responsibility for the fact that he was a dishonest, selfish bastard who couldn't keep his pants on or that she fell for things and didn't reject a married man. You weren't not enough. He wasn't enough to meet you where you were and prioritise family, love, and personal sacrifice for long-term gain.

How much of this is dream interpretation and how much is just stuff you may need to hear, I don't know. Many blessings.

comment_text:
The 2 hours.
Thoughts only..the 2 hours seem like the 2 women in your dream? One hour is a time, a time is descriptive of a certain time in each woman’s life. The dream now speaks of the time “away” from your ex highlighting what each woman is going through after married life.
The 2 hours being connected are most likely the same woman 2 hours of time on the same clock so to speak.
By looking at how each woman handles the situation we see opposites we see conflict as they finally both meet at the same home town in the same pub which is to say both women are in each other’s lives and now they intersect giving you greater understanding about yourself.
You being the first woman, the wife do what most of us would do after a marriage break up, you go home to your hometown where it’s safe and secure. From there you slowly take time out to relax and slowly start to rebuild your social life with friends at the pub.
The other woman being the mistress that’s what she feels like not truly married to the husband because you are the true wife but now you are not married the mistress is revealed to you. That is the other woman within you. That woman also needs attention.
Notice she follows you to your home town that’s because she has to because it’s her home town as well. She unlike you is a professional dancer, instead of taking things slowly applying social patience she is out to drum up business for herself. While you are at a loss she’s getting paid for it. While you are sort of suffering she is marching forward.
The pub is the apex where you finally meet the other woman, she’s not a mistress in real life she is the other part of you that has become the mistress because you were the wife and she was neglected. Now you are no longer the wife she is set free to find a husband for herself.
Here is your conflict because it’s at the pub where the 2 hours meet and you begin to realise and start to feel for this mistress. You have suffered by your husband but she has suffered also by being relegated to mistress.
The hour of your experience has given you empathy for others and you can understand how she might be feeling having been locked out of the relationship. You now emphasise with her.
At first you are shocked that this woman has followed you to your home town that is the other part of you is free and starting to be exposed to you now but now you begin to understand she has nowhere else to go. Her behaviour being a bit rowdy now begins to find acceptance with you. You really feel sorry for her.
It’s a great story where after time you manage to forgive yourself while at the same time as being angry towards the ex you understand that the other woman was suffering while you were married. While you were married she suffered now that you are not married you are suffering. I see the gradual integration of the 2 women coming together. Now the both of you reconcile your differences being able to fit together and be more accepting of each other. Healing and growth have occurred.

post_text:
I had a dream that spoke of reincarnation.
I was a fish, I was lost in the sewers, and I was guided by another fish, I believe. I could hear its voice. It led me trough the dirty water, towards the ocean. As we progressed the water got clearer and clearer. I wanted to go back to the human world. I wanted to be human again, to taste human food again and live the joys of being human.
Once we managed to emerge in the ocean, it was great. We swam near the surface.
The other fish told me: "now, if you want to go back, fishermen will arrive soon. Just let yourself be captured, it will be quick and you will be reborn in no time."
I felt uneasy. The idea of dying was not so great, after all. I tried to get as far away from the fishermen as possible. I was afraid, because I realized even if I were to die, who can guarantee i will be reborn human, and not a puma, bear or another unfortunate animal?

And then I woke up.
What do you think? Could this be a dream about how it really works, or could it have a less literal meaning?

Thank you!
comment_text:
Wow. Very interesting and powerful dream.

I doubt that we can tell you how to interpret it 'correctly', but the one suggestion that I would have is that you might want to start consciously (and subconsciously!
) forming a relationship with a fish as your totem animal or spirit guide.

There are various ways to do that; including making attempts during a light meditative trance to go back into the ocean and talk to the same fish guide.

Or it it's easier for you to work with anthropomorphic
symbolism, you can perhaps try to cultivate a relationship with a sea goddess, perhaps in the archetypal form of a mermaid.

One thing I would not do is just let this slide, or write it off as a one-time oddity.

This is very much a GIFT from your inner spiritual powers, and I would make the most of it.

However, I would not go down the road of fearing reincarnation. There is some good evidence for it.

Cultures and religions that believe in reincarnation traditionally DO believe that humans can reincarnate as other animals -\-\ but only if they are relatively unawakened, and that is what they need on their soul's evolutionary journey.

It's best to regard all that -\-\ karma, dharma, and reincarnation -\-\ as something that is on your side, and working in your favor.

One other thing is that you might want to read up on Carl Jung if you're not familiar with his work; and maybe join a Jungian group online. They also work with dream interpretations
, so then you can get a wider range of feedback.

Blessings on your path ~

I was a fish, I was lost in the sewers, and I was guided by another fish, I believe. I could hear its voice. It led me trough the dirty water, towards the ocean. As we progressed the water got clearer and clearer. I wanted to go back to the human world. I wanted to be human again, to taste human food again and live the joys of being human.
Once we managed to emerge in the ocean, it was great. We swam near the surface.

Thank you!
comment_text:
Very interesting. You have such archetypal dreams.

It does seem very clearly about death and reincarnation itself.

I guess slightly less literal possibilities could include a death & rebirth of some aspect within the context of your current life.

Or, perhaps it might relate to the the Age of Pisces we're currently all living through, which is nearing it's end as we head towards the Age of Aquarius. This could also have associations with religious symbolism relating to Jesus and the symbol of the fish.

I was listening to Alan Watts yesterday, and he mentioned in passing his opinion that Jesus may very well have been a real person who had experiences of what Alan said "we call cosmic consciousness",
and that Jesus had claimed that he was God incarnate. In Jungian terms this experience would be a psyche - or ego death. Your dream reminded me of this, and there is an aspect of your dream which I'd say is quite unusual in that your identity had shifted, that you were not "you", but a fish. So there are common themes of a revealed surprising nature of identity, death, rebirth, and the fish through both the biblical story and your dream.

Interesting that you had not died and become a fish, at least within this dream, but were already a fish and were contemplating dying and being reborn as a human again, knowing that you were once human before.

The waters clearing as you got further and further away from the human domain is also interesting. Swimming near the surface might be related to your then state of consciousness as you dreamed.

post_text:
My unconscious appears to be very active. I lost my grandmother on Tuesday night and it’s been a seismic shift. Ive had two dreams so far.

Tuesday night:

Dream
11/24/21

I had a dream where I pulled my car over to the side of the road and I was called upon by Elon Musk to help him build a fish trap. We were rummaging through an old times workshop for parts and scraps. I was excited. He didn’t seem to think it was going well.

Wednesday night:

11/25/21

Dream

Had a dream where I received the stigmata in a small middle eastern town to “prove” that I was hardcore on Easter. My hands were wounded and my right wrist was broken. Then I went to a friends house and as I walked around I discovered that I had bled all over his furniture. I was apologetic as I had to explain to him what happened.
comment_text:
If these were my dreams, I'd guess that dream number one is about delving into your past. Elon probably represents your ability to create new things and innovative. You're excited because you hope that this will lead to the tool you need to get what you want out of life. I'm wondering why you'd want to build a fish trap, instead of a fishing rod. Maybe you want a quick and passive solution, but Elon suspects that this is going to take more time and patience, like fishing with a rod.

For the second dream, I'd say you're planning for a Christ-like resurrection after this tragedy. Part of you wants to feel all the suffering to prove you are worthy of rebirth but you're having doubts because openly suffering will have negative consequences on the people close to you.

Take what you will from that. Perhaps you can think of how the symbolism relates specifically to your relationship with your grandmother, and come up with different interpretations
.

post_text: So It’s happened a few times where I’m sitting awake at night super uneasy feeling like somethings there in the dark. If I close my eyes, I can always picture whatever it is that’s there. In the past I’ve been able to successfully articulate, depict, and resolve these images. I’m stuck on this one though. It’s a teenage girl around 19 years old in a white dress with long black stringy hair. She honest to God looks like the girl off the grudge. With thicker and wet hair. I haven’t seen the grudge just found the horrific image of her while I was trying to research what it means and why it’s so haunting for me. She always just stands there or maybe reaches out her hands towards me. Also, someone very close to me had an almost identical dream of the same thing, except my friend was mostly awake when it happened and it was floating towards them aggressively. The friend has lucid dreams while they are between being asleep and conscious. Anyways I’m pretty stumped and any suggestions are welcome.
comment_text: When this happens to me, i try to welcome them with love and ask them what they need/want. I also offer to help them cross to the other side if they choose to. I have actually made friends this way, and they stick around for various reasons. If they don't act out of love towards you, surround yourself with light and inform them that they can do no harm to you.

Every person I know who has had intense sleep paralysis describes it as being approached or attacked by a terrifying female presence while they're half asleep. Sometimes the "presence" will sit on their chest and glare at them, and they are usually deeply afraid when it gets bad. No idea what it means, but it's curious that the descriptions are often so similar.

comment_text: I've noticed if you let a thought catch hold of you it will fully immerse you. Two times in my life I felt a "Presence" in my room at night. I knew nothing was there and I immediately noticed how powerful imagination is.. similar to those moments your imaging yourself in an intense situation and your biology changes with it as if it's real. The first time I was a little confused but I realized it was my imagination, the second time some years later I did it on purpose and sure enough, as soon as my attention began to drift toward the idea of an observer or presence being present, the more I entertained it the stronger and more real it was. Here's something, classify what she is. Is she a demon, a ghost, or what have you. After that realize that if this thing is here so is it's opposite. Equal or more powerful than this dark force there's also a light force, a protectorate. Tell yourself the protectorate is far stronger, and if this girl attempted to do you any harm she'd be wiped out. If you can't manage to get your attention off this presence the next best thing is to frame it. Since it's the imagination, you can use the imagination to also help you. Anyway good luck!

post_text:
I'm no stranger to dreams of being attacked by some shadowy figure or at least the threat of some shadowy figure in my house for a while now. Mum gets those too apparently.
I'm no stranger to my parents and family turning into things I have to 'kill' in dreams. (I usually know its not 100% real life in dreams all the time)
I get a bit of sleep paralysis here and there too or whatever you call seeing one part of your room become part of a dream.

And so.
Onto the dream.
I'm drifting in and out of dream paralysis and all of a sudden I'm about to be attacked, in my bed by a shadowy figure who turns out to be my mum. She's got a knife and swings at my left shoulder, leaving it kind of wedged in there (not very deep but I didnt know straight away) I do the usual 'kill the attacker' routine which is usually just me throwing them onto the ground angrily and repeatedly to get them to stop being a cunt to me. Except this time I'm not only angry and frustrated but I actually felt a bit threatened there since this is the first time I've ACTUALLY been stabbed and attacked in the place I always fall back to as a safe and won't ever reject or leave me place: my bed.
So I get up and she's got another knife ready. I shover her to the floor and tell her to stop but she's about to get up again. I pick up a smaller version of this weird hexagonal iron hook (like an S shape you use to hang things) and an iron hexagonal straight bar and start whacking her.
It's pretty intense, she's huddled on the floor and before long I stop and shout at her to just stop. She doesn't tho, I don't think she can see me or hear me (and yet apparently she's still capable of killing me) so I have to kill her. I stab her in the heart (no blood comes out it aint like that) and then she says I love you in the most genuine and sincere way I've ever heard and I automatically say it back (she never heard her mum say ily so she tries to give me what she didnt have but idk it never hit like how it hit in that dream, and I usually say it back begrudgingly in real life) but then that moment is ripped from me when she goes crazy mode and says "... only if you call me 'something'bunny"
So yeah I'm quite concerned as to what this all means.
I'm asian for reference and Oedipal mothers, infantilization gaslighting, emotional neglect, low self worth and responsibility avoidance amongst a plethora of others are culturally accepted.
At one level or other I feel like anyone else in a similar situation know this to be true but have never explored their past critically enough to be able to know what an Oedipal mother is.

I'll do my best and be brave I suppose but its often the case that thats not good enough because I have nothing to show for it. Don't get me wrong it hasnt all been bad amd there have been great steps ib the right direction but I know FOR A FACT that I'm acting out a malevolent tragedy and well solving that is TOP PRIORITY as far as I'm concerned.

And this is the sort of thing, people always say "Oh you should talk to people. No man is an island. Everyone needs to be heard and have their feelings validated. If you need help ask, don't bottle it up, just ask" so here I am asking but is it socially appropriate? Hell no.
Is it going to change anything? Probably not. 😂
comment_text: The dream sounds a bit like someone who is struggling with a mother complex. You literally dreamt of the struggle and fight with it. And you literally dreamt that your mother complex is your shadow. It seems you need to analyze how your mother is/has effected your psychology, to see what is causing this struggle to ensue within yourself. Therein lies the answer.

post_text: Dream 11/7/21-\-\looking for insights: I'm in the kitchen of an apartment I shared with my younger brother Bob (now in prison) in Dubuque, Iowa, many years ago but there are no walls or ceilings; it is overlayed by a sunny savannah...grass and some trees. I'm getting some things together to camp out and go to bed in the "kitchen." I've gathered up grasses, a pillow, and am looking for a blanket of some kind. As I work, a lion cub emerges from some trees to the south, approaches me, and licks my left hand. I find myself alert to the likelihood that the mother lion is nearby. I scan the horizon and, sure enough, a VERY large mother lion saunters from some trees to the west through the remnants of the apartment's living room. She doesn't seem to key in on me as a threat. I freeze, hoping she and the cub will just move on. Slowly I hunker down into the bedding I've gathered up in the kitchen area. The lioness approaches me and sniffs my belly. I slowly curl into a ball on the bedding, sensing that I'm in a life or death situation. The lioness yawns and lays right over the top of me. I instantly find myself feeling warm, nested, and comfortable-\-\safe for now. I let myself relax, thinking she'll guard me while I sleep but am also wondering if I'll be safe when we all wake in the morning because I wonder if she'll be hungry then and that she's just holding me to be eaten in the morning.
comment_text: In my opinion, this is you coming to a different state of healing. You’re taking on your own fears, and at the same time fearing that state of mind. The fact that the lion trusted you to lay down or their cub I hope instills the fact that sure healing and conquering your fears. Put that in itself can be a scary place. As if the lion will eat you the next morning. Keep the hope alive, keep strong.

comment_text:
Just some thoughts.
Your dream talks about you and your younger brother Bob. Is it possible that the cub that approaches you is represents your brother? Bob was in a prison, an enclosed prison, could it be that in some way you are also in a prison trapped by your old memories?Bob may have broken the law but you are affected by that since a different type of prison is created for you? In your prison “there are no walls or ceilings”
Perhaps you need rest for your soul but you need to work to gather the material “grasses to rest on and a pillow to rest your head then a blanket to keep the cold away,
The picture here is that you are working at it to provide yourself with what you need to get by without your brother?
As you toil the little cub “emerges” he approaches you and “licks your left hand”
This licking of the hand is a way of showing affection to you but more importantly he is showing you acceptance as a family member. You need him now and he emerges. The social bond is also setting up a family bond in case of any potential threat that may arise. The acceptance from your brother the cub also extends to his and your mother.
The mother enters by “saunters through the remnants of the living room” the depressing memories of the past will be put to rest now as she makes her entrance with strength and majesty, she’s not afraid and will now replace the hurt with a new strength and social order? As part of her family you will be loved and protected and recognised as her cub. when she comes along she sniffs your belly as a mother accepts and nudges you and finally lays over you in an act of love and full acceptance and protection and in doing so you are reunited with your brother again.

post_text:
Last night I had a dream that scared me a lot.

In the dream, I was at home in my living room. Interior of the room was so bright that I remember looking at the curtains and the walls but only when I woke up I could understand that I was at home. You could barely see anything.

I don't know when it started and how long it lasted, but a voice, a shout came from the unknown. Then a disembodied, disfigured white spirit appeared. He kept claiming that he was a holy being, a prophet, or a God. He spoke very well. The things he said were very nice and peaceful but it felt so bad for some reason, I just wanted to get away from him. It was so scary.

After a while, this time I heard a voice inside my own head. The voice told me that "he" was the true God, the presence in my hall was a demon, a fraudster, and was trying to deceive me with sweet words. Indeed, when I heard this, I immediately believed the voice because it was incredibly satisfying and in line with my feelings.

I am not a religious person, I have neither believed nor feared paranormal beings in my life. Why could I have had such a dream? Do you think I'm deceiving myself somehow and that's how my brain expresses it?
comment_text:
Maybe a power struggle inside yourself from the unconcious? And also i want to ask you what was it that was so scary for u? Why did u want to get away in the first place.
Do u feel that u have two things in life that are taking up a lot of space these days? Like one deciever inside of u that mby down talk urself or holds u back or down somehow and the other thing maybe fear of authority or something from the outside of yourself?
Just some thoughts 🤷🏻‍♀️

The worst deceivers in this world always mask their evil in a nice-looking package, while the real truth conveys a very particular feeling, the same feeling you held when you heard the voice of God in your head. Do your best to remember this feeling, because you're going to need it, for our world is full of deceivers and liars in positions of power of all kinds.

comment_text:
This so so interesting to me. I am a Christian, I hope it doesn’t offend if I share from that angle.

I had paranormal dreams from age 16 on. However in my early 20’s they got increasingly worse, the entities got closer to me and began touching me, getting right in my face, pulling me off the bed, they stayed for longer. I always got them to leave by training myself to say the name of Jesus in my dream. These have been the ONLY dreams I’ve been able to train myself to make choices in. Finally I had enough of being afraid to fall asleep and posted a status asking if anyone could help. My pastor friend asked to see me and go for a walk. We worked through some personal stuff that day and I never looked back. Part of what she asked is I get rid of any witchcraft related items in my home that I may have accidentally accumulated. I haven’t had a single sleep paralysis since then.

It seems to me that your dream is a very real testimony of good vs. evil. We are wired to know good when it comes, your intuition knew what was good and true. I think that’s the best take away (without getting into ‘religion’ ) trust your intuition and inner voice.

post_text:
Here's one:

I was given a medallion necklace. I was free to wander around in a comfortable area, but instead chose to go downstairs to a dimly lit level. I then turned around, headed backwards behind the stairs, and picked up a shiny figurine of an angel. I placed this figurine in my medallion and turned around. The Devil stood before me. He then knelt before me and kissed my medallion. I struggled with what to do and decided to go back upstairs. The rest of my dream was spent sulking about unsatisfied on the upper level.

Is this some sort of guidance, do you suppose?

Cheers.

comment_text:
Your dream suggests that by accepting the necklace you are somehow enslaving yourself ?
“A shiny figurine of an angel”

In Colossians 2:18, Paul warns his readers, "Do not let anyone who delights in false humility and the worship of angels disqualify you for the prize" (NIV emphasis mine). Of course, that it is in the genitive case means that we can take in two ways. Either it refers to worship directed to angels or worship done by angels. Is there any reason to prefer one or the other here
*bible hermanetics

The wearing of the medallion necklace at first seems harmless but then the shiny figurine is placed within the medallion, this suggests serious worship of angels which the apostle Paul warns us not to do.
Satan who is an angel himself loves to try and trick us into worshiping him.

Why not worship God instead?

post_text:
Hey, I want to inquire about the dream I had last night. I would usually try to depict the meanings myself but this one was so strange and interesting that I figured extra help would be greatly appreciated. I don't recall much of it but if anyone here is capable of piecing some conclusion together, it will be fantastic!
I found myself in a hospital room. I don't know how I got there or why I was there, the room was pleasantly sunny. I wasn't scared but rather calm and fully okay with the situation, almost contempt. I was visited by a man my age whom I don't know in real life, he seemed to be sort of a partner to be. When he left I was visited by yet another man, my ex partner. I don't recall if there was any conversation but the spirits were high and there was also no sense of distress to the situation, it was like meeting an old friend that you still hold a lot of affection for because you simply like the person. Then he also left.
Now off to the part I'm most intrigued about. When I was left alone the feeling of a quiet contentment persisted. I found myself holding up a small mirror and looked into it. To my absolute surprise, my face above the eye line was split open. The opening starting from around the space between my eyebrows. I recall the skin hanging to the right side (in the mirror). I was surprised but nowhere near in a state in which I would be if this happened to me in real life. Trust me, I like my face the way it is. In the dream the feeling was that of curiosity. I looked inside my head and there to the right I found two pieces of some type of long, beige, spongy material. I was under the impression that I had undergone a brain surgery and the pieces were there to hold the hemisphere in place. What's worth noticing is that I felt the operation happened years earlier and wasn't the reason I was now in the hospital room. Another thing I very strongly recall is that my left (in the mirror) side of the brain was hurting me, it was inflamed. I had to wake up at that point as I don't recall anything past that.
Now, it would be worth adding that some time ago I had a very powerful experience that shifted my perception in such a drastic way I was able to immediately stop drinking alcohol after a decade of killing myself with it. It was the main but not the only positive change that followed my experience. I feel like myself again after a lifetime of living in a state of dissociation.
I know that mirrors don't appear in dreams too often but they are particularly symbolic so I'm hoping you could help me with figuring this one out. Thank you!
comment_text:
Just a few thoughts..
I was recently in hospital and still recovering.
“I found myself”
It seems you have been on some sort of journey where perhaps you may have been a little lost in life? But now it’s here in the hospital room where you receive the care and recover. The recovery consisting of revelation about yourself.
You say you don’t know how you got there or why you are there? I had a dream once where I was all but dead and buried underground in a maze of warrens etc.
Then an ambulance turns up with 3 hospital attendants, 2 bearing a stretcher and one leading the way. They sort of made their way to where I was buried in the Warren, rescued me, carried me out on the stretcher , placed me in the ambulance and took me to hospital. For me the hospital staff were angels of god who came to rescue me from my life situation. For me the hospital I was taken too was church where I was well cared for and recovered.
Sometimes we don’t understand what happens , how we are cared for but it happens.

In your dream you also find yourself in hospital, a place to be cared for a place to recover. We notice your situation is “pleasant” you are at ease and relaxed, also “sunny” suggesting your outlook on life is good and the atmosphere of the sun is healing. You are not scared, “calm and fully ok with the situation and almost content” so in fact your hospital what’re ever it represents to you is a great place for you in your life right now.
I’ll get back after..

These 2 visits may represent a reconciliation between past and present bringing together the healing you require?
Also you speak of the left and right hemisphere in your brain again we see this balancing going on for you between left and right past and present. The hemisphere you speak of is the horizon or the equator between the earthly and celestial, another set of opposites as with the present and the past partners.
So we have a past and present and earthly and heavenly?
Need more time I’ll get back later..

post_text:
Hey, I want to inquire about the dream I had last night. I would usually try to depict the meanings myself but this one was so strange and interesting that I figured extra help would be greatly appreciated. I don't recall much of it but if anyone here is capable of piecing some conclusion together, it will be fantastic!
I found myself in a hospital room. I don't know how I got there or why I was there, the room was pleasantly sunny. I wasn't scared but rather calm and fully okay with the situation, almost contempt. I was visited by a man my age whom I don't know in real life, he seemed to be sort of a partner to be. When he left I was visited by yet another man, my ex partner. I don't recall if there was any conversation but the spirits were high and there was also no sense of distress to the situation, it was like meeting an old friend that you still hold a lot of affection for because you simply like the person. Then he also left.
Now off to the part I'm most intrigued about. When I was left alone the feeling of a quiet contentment persisted. I found myself holding up a small mirror and looked into it. To my absolute surprise, my face above the eye line was split open. The opening starting from around the space between my eyebrows. I recall the skin hanging to the right side (in the mirror). I was surprised but nowhere near in a state in which I would be if this happened to me in real life. Trust me, I like my face the way it is. In the dream the feeling was that of curiosity. I looked inside my head and there to the right I found two pieces of some type of long, beige, spongy material. I was under the impression that I had undergone a brain surgery and the pieces were there to hold the hemisphere in place. What's worth noticing is that I felt the operation happened years earlier and wasn't the reason I was now in the hospital room. Another thing I very strongly recall is that my left (in the mirror) side of the brain was hurting me, it was inflamed. I had to wake up at that point as I don't recall anything past that.
Now, it would be worth adding that some time ago I had a very powerful experience that shifted my perception in such a drastic way I was able to immediately stop drinking alcohol after a decade of killing myself with it. It was the main but not the only positive change that followed my experience. I feel like myself again after a lifetime of living in a state of dissociation.
I know that mirrors don't appear in dreams too often but they are particularly symbolic so I'm hoping you could help me with figuring this one out. Thank you!

post_text: I had a very disturbing dream where some people were torturing a Bison. The animal had its legs tied together and was hanging by its legs so it couldn't defend itself. The primary abuser was a young woman who seemed to be trying to be exceptionally cruel to impress the men, like to show how tough she was. I was witnessing the scene but not in it. I felt shocked and horrified at what I was seeing. Then it was like I was reading about this in a book and I skipped forward in the book to try to get past the torture scene, but landed right at the part where the young woman killed the Bison. She killed it with some metal device that punched a hole in its skull and scrambled its brains.
comment_text:
Some words on the bison 🦬 as a symbol from Erich Neumann, one of Carl Jung's most accomplished students.

"The individual bison, for example, is a spiritual psychic symbol; he is in a sense the "father of the bison," the idea of the bison, the "bison as such," and this is why he is an object of ritual. The subjugation and killing, the conciliation and fertilization of the animal, which are enacted in the psychic sphere between the human group and the image which symbolically represents the animal group, have a reality-transfo
rming-that is, magical-signifi
cance, because this image-symbol encompasses the numinous heart and center of the animal living in the world, whose symbolic figuration constitutes an authentic manifestation of the numinous animal."

https://
carljungdepthpsy
chologysite.blo
g/2020/03/17/
erich-neumann-on
-art-and-time/

Given this, it seems the bison is an archetypal symbol, and therefore perhaps the dream likely relates to a stage of psycho-spiritua
l development. If so, quite what it is saying I wouldn't want to guess. Whether it somehow marks a positive state of progression of the psyche, or some undesirable situation, I don't know. Though I suspect it may not necessarily represent something negative, even if the experience of the dream itself were not pleasant. The symbolism seems ancient, it almost certainly relates to deeper than day-to-day matters, likely a present stage of your development.

At first glance it’s almost a scene where the Animal is corralled in ready for slaughter. We see the leg ropes we see the metallic device which in a slaughter house is what’s known as a bolt gun. But in your dream there seems to be a different picture, similar but different?
The Bison is being abused by a group of people primarily by a young woman. But in this case the dream goes one step further in that the girl is taking advantage of this situation to simply prove to the “group” that she is as tough as they are but at the expense if the Bison.
