post_text:
I had a dream I was trying to cross a river of sorts, except as I went one way, all of a sudden a crocodile appeared. Panicked, I went in the other direction only to find more crocodiles circling. Fuck this shit I’m out, I thought to myself, so I yeeted myself onto this yellow-green log (it was high ground compared to where the crocs were) but out of nowhere the log turned into the biggest croc of them all and had red eyes. I remember thinking and feeling like there was nothing I could do at that point.

Now I don’t know much but I do know a crocodile is a threat and indicates danger at the lowest resolution. What sort of threat or danger or what it means to be surrounded with the only escape being the biggest threat of them all I can’t say for sure but I do know it’s got something to do with what I choose to do when I feel threatened in real life and perhaps I need to do things different.
comment_text:
Is the ideal way actually a threat, or is the threat actually the ideal way, nonetheless? It reminds me a little of the Joseph Campbell / Jordan Peterson point of 'the gold you seek is to be found in the place you least want to look'.

The crossing the river motif has an ancient transcendent symbolism. Apparently in the East it is a common near death experience, like the tunnel of light in the West.

In the dream the croc has two sides, two natures, oppositely related, the ideal way and the dangerous way.

If it represents an aspect of you, the creature is also ancient, primal and comes up from below the waters depths, perhaps the unconscious, I see this as potentially all relating to the way of making the contents of the deep unconscious, conscious. A wise path with real dangers, perhaps no path is without dangers.

Meh, just thoughts

post_text:
I had a dream last night that seemed very symbolic of something although not entirely sure what. Any comments/thoughts/ideas about any aspect of this dream would be greatly appreciated:

"I'm planting potatoes. It seems to be nighttime. I feel lightheaded so I sit down then lay down on the ground. There are other people around. A short older man sees that I need help but thinks I need help getting back up whereas I just need to lay there for a minute so I don't faint. He squeezes me around the chest to try to support me. At first I pretend to accept his help to be nice and start to sit up, but the squeezing makes me feel more lightheaded and I panic thinking I will faint and yell "Let go! Let go! Let go!" Or something like that. The man releases his grip immediately but it doesn't seem fast enough.
I am still planting potatoes but now it is day time and I'm just with my mom. I am in the process of planting the potatoes at the ends of a row of garden beds. It occurs to me that I hadn't asked my mom if this is okay and they are her garden beds. I ask her and she says it's fine and I can plant them wherever there is room. She asks me how many pounds of potatoes I had grown last year. I said I didn't know because I hadn't weighed them because I remembered I hadn't harvested them all at once but little by little as I thought they were ready. In the dream this seems to be the third year in a row I have planted potatoes."
comment_text:
I think you've been doing something for a long time, probably longer than 3 years, that is helping you and others plant for harvest. Sometimes you need help, but oftentimes you just need company and rest. Most people are well-meaning, but if they're unhelpful, if you teach them how they can be more helpful, they'll be more helpful once they get it. Also, sometimes it seems to be nighttime, when it's just that you're weary and not with the right company and rest. When you get the right company and rest, it feels more like daytime, because we have more energy, whether it is or isn't literally. I'd say make sure your mom knows you appreciate her too.

A saying comes to mind, "Don't grow weary in doing well, because in due time, you will reap a harvest." Never underestimate planting, no matter how long that season lasts. Keep doing as well as you know in every worthwhile endeavour, and it is actually impossible for that not to pay off. In due time is frustrating, but the patience you learn and later the timing of the reward will be impeccable.

She asks me how many pounds of potatoes I had grown last year. I said I didn't know because I hadn't weighed them because I remembered I hadn't harvested them all at once but little by little as I thought they were ready. In the dream this seems to be the third year in a row I have planted potatoes."
comment_text:
The biggest things that have helped me interpreted dreams is to break them down into the individual components of the dream and what they symbolically represent to you. For example:

1) What does a potato represent to you?
2) What does it mean to you to be dizzy?
3) What does the old man trying to help represent?
4) Is there anyone in your life currently trying to "help" but it just seems to make it worse?
5) What does weighing the potatoes mean?
6) Do you feel like you were neglectful for not weighing them or is your mother overly concerned?
7) What does growing potatoes for 3 years represent?

These are some good places to start. Just remember that there is something going on in your life that mirrors what you saw in your dream. I'd be happy to help more if you want to DM me.

post_text:
I visited my birth home, where I spent the first 6 years of my life. It changed drastically. Now a lady lived there. She was cordial but a bit surprised by my visit. I was looking for something. I don't recall what.
At some point she has guests. They are men from a masonic group. They exchange their secret handshake with me and my sister before I can take notice it happened. I tell them I'm not part of this cult and I head out of the house into the courtyard.
A decorated monolith stands there, hiding an artifact inside. I manage to obtain it, by sacrificing the body of my friend, who in the dream is a creature akin to a golem.
The artifact resembles two connected vials of red liquid. Now that I have it I can fuel my spaceship and travel back to the planet I came from.

I know it seems random, but can you please help me decipher what it could mean?

Thank you!
comment_text:
What would be the title of this dream?
What was lost by leaving that home at 6 years?
What are associations for that lady? Age, feeling, physical attributes, reminds you of?
What do you recall about men (number of them, age, ...).
Who is the friend now to you? Why was he golem?
Why the sacrifice? What was the artifact - key?
Monolith comes from movies/real life? Made of stone? Carved maybe?
Since when do you feel foreign/alien and maybe overwhelmed to leave everything behind?
This planet of origin - what is missing here but present there?

post_text:
I go to bed last night thinking “I don’t really remember a lot of my childhood, just fragments... I wonder if this is normal for everyone? Or are my brains childhood ‘files just corrupted’? This is the result I’m guessing of that. (The gas mask I can guarantee is from a doctor who episode, but the rest.🤷‍♂️)

I wake up to my alarm in my apartment bedroom, an empty all white room save for a lamp and a bed with white sheets, but no visible alarm. I know the time, it’s important, because it’s very late, near midnight. Fear grips me! Midnight... it comes at midnight! I rush out of bed to the door as the light begins zooming in on the handle as the rest of the room begins to go black. I know if I don’t reach the handle before the light does I’ll be locked in with the darkness and Him, but I make it.. barely.
I still have to get out of the apartment, FAST, so I rush to get dressed. All the shirts are work shirts, ‘I can’t just wear one of these’ I think to myself. I find an old Judas Priest concert shirt. ‘I’ve not seen this shirt in forever!’ and throw it on. Then I realized I have jeans on with jean shorts overtop of them, time grows short fear raises and decide ‘whatever, my trench coat can conceal that’.
I step back into the blank white living room of the apartment to leave and he’s there! The little boy, dressed like any 8 year old might be in the 80’s, but wearing a distorted gas mask. He stands and stares at me as the tension rises, I think ‘the demon is here, I have to-‘ and as if reading my mind he replied, ‘ I’m just a little boy...’ then leaps at me from 25 feet across the room. We struggle, his mask shifts and I can see his sharp teeth , salivating as I struggle I feel myself failing then... I wake up.

Have I demonized my own childhood? (It wasn’t that bad) Or is this just a metaphor for my thoughts on my childhood memories being corrupted? 😳
comment_text:
If you had significant memories from your childhood that need to be processed you would remember them. A lack of emotionally charged memories from your youth suggest you had a pretty healthy childhood. JBP has mentioned that the reason we have memories is to try to help us learn the lesson that we didnt fully grasp at the time. Once old memories have been relived, unpacked, and emotions felt the memory starts to fade.

I would say this dream is probably more about where your current consciousness is and not so much about memories that you cant remember.

Do you ever just have the most random dream?

Last night I had a dream that Will Smith was my boss as I was working at a shopping mall, and I needed him to teach me something and he kept playing video games at his desk instead of training me. I sat down on a chair and the front desk lady got mad about it and told me I should just quit if he’s going to be like that. 🤣

I’m not sure there is a deeper meaning but it’s funny because I have no idea where it came from!
comment_text:
Is it possible that will smith is answering your question but you haven’t understood what he’s saying?

https://
www.giantbomb.co
m/articles/
will-smiths-top-
11-games-of-202
0/1100-6081/
You have an office in a shopping mall, it’s obviously a business, however you need to know something?
You guys in the dream have been successfully promoting your entertainment Busines but thinks have changed to affect your business now you need to know something? How to adapt to change?
The office girl at the front desk obviously you is getting frustrated since she’s used to doing things a certain way but now that’s changed.
The man st the desk out back is creative he’ll figure out a solution you will get the idea and then finally convey it to the girl at the front desk.
Here’s what I think (which is always going to be wrong) the entertainment industry capitalises on people going out to the movies then after a certain time it is released as a home movie. That time sequence has been getting less and less before it is quickly released in shorter periods of time. This part of revenue making is the after revenue from the movie attendance. Now things are changing again since people due to lock downs are at home more than ever there is a skew now towards home video games happening that make up for the lack of human contact and first hand socialisation this is becoming a serious form of entertainment where home video tracks people at home because they can’t get that interaction at home.
Will smith is teaching you, he is playing with the idea of this new form of entertainment which is not only entertainment but replaced human contact therefore it is worth considering. Somewhere in your life this is what you need to know! When you figure it all out explain it to the lady at the front desk and keep going.
Probably way off the mark but reading the link above makes for interesting thought?

post_text:
Let me start by saying I have been in this group for a long time and you all seem so much more intelligent than myself in this area of dream interpretation. I’m seeking advice on repetitive dreams.

It’s a very common thing: I am always dreaming that my boyfriend is cheating on me. Twice a week at least, and he is usually behaving way out of character in these dreams. air: flirtatious, doesn’t care about my feelings, comes across arrogant which is not him at all.

Background: I was divorced in 2017 due to finding out my husband had two affairs (that I know of, but there were likely more) my now ex-husband has been diagnosed with dissociative identity disorder and I went through six months of therapy after our separation left myself and my two kids abandoned (though he is not their biological father)

A year went by and I met my current boyfriend. We dated for a year and then we moved in together, and I quit my job because I moved two hours away to live with him in our hometown. Shortly after I got pregnant and I was seeking work throughout the first 3 months but now I am showing and it is unlikely I will ever get hired just to leave soon, so I have enrolled in University to get my B of A in Psych and then I want to go for my Masters. School starts February.

I am on a waiting list to see a therapist that was recommended to me by my last therapist.

If I had to summarize, I might say that these dreams are likely happening so frequently because I am feeling vulnerable. Allowing a man into our lives again, not working while he makes all the money (makes me feel incompetent, but there is not much I can do about it right now, mind you he does not and will not ever pay my personal bills but he does pay the household bills aside from groceries which I always try to pay for but the odd time he sends me $ for them and it is auto deposited..) going to school is a big step and also makes me feel vulnerable because I will not be able to jump into a career type job again for quite sometime. Being pregnant is also a vulnerable time for a woman in general with body changes and hormone fluctuations, and it’s all happening at once while his life seems to be always ‘light and airy’ so to speak. I think I am feeling inferior, and it is bringing up a lot of triggering emotions from my last relationship, because in my dreams my current partners persona is often mirroring my ex-husband’s persona.

Any advice on how to fix this, and get the dreams to stop?
comment_text:
I see you have done a lot of thinking on this and it seems to me you have more of a grasp on your thoughts and emotions than you are giving yourself credit for. I think due to your ex-husband repeatedly cheating on you, you have developed some deep fear of abandonment and perhaps even to a traumatic level.

As far as advice goes, talk more about this. Talk with your boyfriend, your family, your friends, and a therapist. Talk to anyone you trust. Confronting these emotions is important to bringing them out of your subconscious and out of your dreams. This will be a challenging and long process. The people you trust in your life are there to support you, including your boyfriend even though the dreams may be unpleasant for him as well. Hopefully he is there to listen to you during this time.

Remember, despite your emotions and fears being very real, your boyfriend is not your ex! Take care.

comment_text: Recurring dreams happen to all of us. Agree with Simon that you seem to have a good grasp of insights into your own creations. Dreams are often you talking to you all about you, so what part of you is using your boyfriend as a symbol for some other part of you? There's no slick, easy answer to any dream - it takes time and work. And it looks like you're doing good work. Once you work out the feelngs in the dream, when you hit your Ah Ha! moment, this dream will stop - your graduation card. Don't give up on this one. Best.....

post_text:
Good luck with this one.

Maybe it might relate to a conversation I had before bed on alerted states of consciousness and the fundamental 'patterns' of reality perceived in them, expressible only by form of symbols, like with number & math.. or maybe not. God knows...

The dream..

The sense of place has a strange feel to it despite the mundane descriptions. I'm in a city, I experience being aboard something like a stationary train or tram, I'm lacking a requirement to travel back on the train, I think I wish to buy a piece of cake before my return journey for some reason, but I'm trying to fish out my payment card and ID card and making other passengers wait, I see my bags on the floor unzipped, my belongings bulging out of them in an unorganized fashion as I fish around on my person for my cards, I feel the passengers impatience with me.

Then I'm standing in something approximating a shopping mall, apparently attempting a different route of travel, standing in front of a phone with old fashioned handset in my hand like those of old phone boxes. I lift up the handset a couple of times, the unusual looking digital screen flickers slightly but fails to spring to life, I lift it a third time and the phone and display then connects successfully. I speak in a slightly shakey voice, stating that I wish to attain something, perhaps this cake I'm after by relaying my card details, to then travel back by alternative means, perhaps by car, and the natural sounding voice I recognize as artificial intelligence identifies by the sound of my voice that I am somehow unfit, as though drunk and intending to drive, only not that, and manages to deduce I'm breaching some rule in what I am asking, recognizing I must be traveling back by a method I'm unfit to do in this circumstance, based upon my request.

I'm then elsewhere walking on some dim grey street, having traveled another different route, I see a person walking in front of me, I recognize them as a second instance of an identical person I've just seen at the opposite end of the road I'm walking down, beyond them I see an oddly distinct looking vehicle drive around the corner of a road, at that moment another identical vehicle drives around the same corner in the opposite direction.

Then I find myself at a different scene, looking at a damaged, blackened decrepit shell of a helicopter leaning towards the edge of a small muddy pit of water beside it. I pan my head right and there is a small glass cubicle, like the glass cockpit of a crane or digger, with a man sat inside it. Beside him is a cake, he asks me what size slice I'd like, I gesture with my finger and thumb the thickness, but my hand is shakey, I worry this looks suspect somehow, I hold my hand with my other hand to steady it, struggling to indicate a sufficient thickness of slice. He serves me a slice of cake within two slices of bread, like a sandwich with some salad in it also. A bit odd, I thought. I took a bite, I sense the cool temperature of the salad.

I ask the person that served me the cake 'what month were you born in?' as if to inquire his relatedness to me, as one might enquire to infer anothers zodiac sign. He says 'I was born in such-and-such a year', (I forget the actual year) clearly failing to understand the concept of a month, answering like a somewhat poorly programmed artificial intelligence humanoid. Then I'm in a car with this person and also my dad, setting off somewhere. My dad begins speaking, addressing this misunderstanding, he says "this is sometimes the case when people suffering with dementia..." - and I tell him to drop the subject, knowing this person is some form of artificial intelligence humanoid that may be irritated, or alerted to something being amiss.

So... yeah.

My thoughts:

The 2 identical persons/people and 2 identical cars both traveling in opposite directions was perhaps the most intriguing bit for me. And the 2 interactions with AI like beings. I note that the earlier AI being was exceptionally astute, and the second, perhaps not. The AI beings seem like they may represent a part of my own subconscious intelligence / psyche. This dream only features men, no women, unusual for me.
When I asked the guy what month he was born in and he referred to a year, not a month, perhaps this suggests some relation to the sun not the moon.. consciousness not unconsciousness, masculine not feminine..? What i seek is to be found via my conscious attitude towards life?
I actually think this might have a deep meaning. I think it's saying I'm going about my path in life in the wrong way, somehow, like trying to cheat or break the rules by which my aim and journey should be undertaken.
comment_text:
1st part of your dream.

The “cake”you desire seems to place you at odds with all that is normal and regulatory in your life?

it looks like you are not fitting in as well as you should?
Let’s look..
Despite your description of the city being mundane, another word for normal but boring, there is really nothing out of place except You feel “strange” in the city, strange in a normal place?

strange
1.unusual or surprising; difficult to understand or explain.
2. .
not previously visited, seen, or encountered; unfamiliar or alien.
"she was lost in a strange country"

“I experience being on a stationary tram or train”
Trams and trains are meant for commuting in city’s this is normal and people are wanting to commute, they have jobs they have reasons to commute back and forth.
Your tram is stationary and “you lack requirement to travel back?
Because you think you don’t have a reason to commute you are stopped / stationary because you are not properly prepared to travel eg your ID and financials the other passengers in your tram are becoming “impatient” with you?
“I’m trying to fish out my payment card and ID card making other passengers wait?
Other passengers on your tram are wanting to take the same trip back and forth in and out of the city but you seem half hearted you are not properly prepared, you have everything you need but your mind is on the “peice of cake”
The passengers have a good reason to travel back and forth each day but a good reason eludes you and this city is strange to your present mindset your’re not into it? The passengers respect your place in the tram but when it begins to affect them they become impatient since they know the importance of their daily routine they are now starting to fret.
“I’m trying to fish out my payment card and my ID card? 2 cards, one that supports you and one that proves your identity. You have them but they are not readily accessible? Both ore disorganised. You need to look for your financials it is there but you lose time trying to find it. Same with your identity card it’s all there but again you loose time trying to find your identity card.
“I see my belongings in my bags on the floor unzipped your belongings bulging out of them in an unorganised way.
Unzipped is also a slang term that sort of means to reveal all.
This description is how you live. Living out of your bags as compared to someone living in a permanent residence who has a proper place to store all there belongings. This style of living is as you say “unorganised”

1st part of dream continued ..
The cake!
“I’m lacking a requirement” you can’t see a good reason to take the same journey the other passengers are committed to?
This causes you to think about the “cake”
“I think I wish to buy a piece of cake before my return journey for some reason” rather than concentrating on taking this journey you seem to be more hanging out for some cake?

It seems like this cake will embolden you, empower you to make the same journey as the you think you can’t make the trip unless you first take the cake?

post_text: I had this weird but interesting dream a while ago, there was this national geographic crew on an ice floe in the middle of the sea, the sky was purple I think, I'm not sure if I was with them or I was watching the TV and it occupied my full field of vision, anyways they were there to study a group of pinguins and a whale, they cut to the pinguins acting in funny and silly ways and the narrator starts to explain how they use the stars in the sky to orient themselves when they travel, then it cuts to a mighty whale and the narrator explains how it orients itself through the polar star, that's about it, then I woke up.
comment_text: Hmm - I wonder if you can tie that between the unconscious, particularly the "life of the unconscious" that may seem silly - the penguins almost as fool characters, but they are actually intelligent and guided by the "stars" linking to astrological concepts and patterns for guidance. I'm not talking bloody horrorscopes but rather deeper astrology.

post_text:
I often have strange dreams, but I rarely remember specific details and plot lines (just the overall "feel" or tone of it), so when I do, I pay attention.
I dreamt that I was about to be arrested and convicted for unintentionally killing 21 people. I may have been getting ready to turn myself in, or maybe I just knew I was going to be taken in. I was talking to my mother about it, and it seems no one else was present at the time of this vivid and clearly remembered part. I was saying "I killed 21 people. 21 People! Even if it was an accident, don't you think I should pay?!?! I should go in for negligence or SOMETHING!" And my mother was just looking at me like she was worked up but didn't know what to say. I got the feeling that she was thinking I shouldn't be punished, that I should find a way out of it, and I was making my case that my mistake should be punished. I awoke feeling appalled and guilty, but strong and determined and posessed by truth as well.

What you got? What can be made of this? For the record, I am not a doctor or anything like that, and nor is my mother. My mother is generally an aggressively righteous woman, who is quick to threaten someone who is acting immorally, maliciously, or unjustly. I myself am much less confrontational, but any wrongs I commit tend to eat me alive.
comment_text: Are you by chance 21 years old? Maybe its guilt about how you feel you used or misused your life? What about gambling? Your feelings toward the game blackjack. Guilt about wasting money? 21 is the drinking age. Do you feel guilt over having misused alcohol?

comment_text:
Great dream and testimony, well done.
21 as others have mentioned does seem significant.
I see 21 as a name or description of you. Concerning the use of a number in reference to a name I quickly think of James Bond 007
Or the series “get smart” I think their numbers were 99 and 86. Some times the lady 86 would refer to 99 as Max. But when it was more serious she changed to his number, 99 same as James Bond, he was called James by his female counterparts but 007 referred to his special self.
In a similar way your dream is referring to you as 21. To you 21 is significant and also represents a time of growing in your life.
Now that you’re 30 you look back at yourself as 21 and realise that time could have been better and needed to be changed, in real life you do set out to change from 21 to 30. Your dream conveys this to you as stopping that life and bringing it all to an end “I dreamt that I was about to be arrested and convicted” Normally after growing through to adult hood we would move on to the next stage of our life but in your case 21 needs to go before you can move on. For this to happen you need to be arrested that is in some way taken in to custody.. pulled up in some way and then having been pulled up then convicted about 21 and what it means to you. Once you’ve been “convicted” in your heart you can get on with it to a new start in life. You sort of know you need to do something because you say to yourself “I may have been getting ready to turn myself in” so there is thought and preparation involved about what you see as 21. You don’t really want to kill 21 because that’s who you are and neither does your mother. However you realise that you need to kill 21 because now you have a conviction in your heart that 21 needs to go so that you don’t need to be in this position at 30. You say you were in a position of “unintentionall
y” killing 21 people. Perhaps you were happy to continue your life as 21 until you were arrested and convicted in your heart that 21 needs to die/go.
This is very similar to the language of God, because that’s exactly what the holy spiritual does he arrests us that is stop us from continuing on in a harmful way then having stopped us then works in our heart to convict us that we are wrong, look..
Acts 3:37
When the people heard this, they were cut to the heart and said to Peter and the other apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”

Here we see that people have been convicted in there heart and are now ready to make big changes in their life.

The death of 21 is also significant in that when our old life dies it is really only the outer shell that peels away allowing the precious seed inside to grow. Look..
John 12:24
Very truly I tell you, unless a kernel of wheat falls to the ground and dies, it remains only a single seed. But if it dies, it produces many seeds.

Interesting because we see that if we continue living our life as the outer shell it is alone and cannot truly reproduce. But when the old life dies then the true seed the new life begins. This new life will reproduce spiritually and other.
So 21 years is a time in your life, a moment a time of preparation. It’s a normal and natural to shed the outer shell at around that time. But since your life may have been abnormal you needed desperately to be convicted in your heart for the natural process to take place.

“I was talking to my mother about it” your mother might be your mother or a church or an inner thought dialogue but because she is your mother she simply accepted you as you are however there is a higher calling on our lives that we are all meant to attain to and sometimes even though parents loved us they don’t understand that the old life must go to attain the new life.

Your conviction is the real deal. Not only do you realise you need to put 21 away but you are sorrowful about 21 and because of that true sorrow the new seed of life will start to grow. It’s a spiritual thing that responds to genuine sorrow.

post_text:
I often have strange dreams, but I rarely remember specific details and plot lines (just the overall "feel" or tone of it), so when I do, I pay attention.
I dreamt that I was about to be arrested and convicted for unintentionally killing 21 people. I may have been getting ready to turn myself in, or maybe I just knew I was going to be taken in. I was talking to my mother about it, and it seems no one else was present at the time of this vivid and clearly remembered part. I was saying "I killed 21 people. 21 People! Even if it was an accident, don't you think I should pay?!?! I should go in for negligence or SOMETHING!" And my mother was just looking at me like she was worked up but didn't know what to say. I got the feeling that she was thinking I shouldn't be punished, that I should find a way out of it, and I was making my case that my mistake should be punished. I awoke feeling appalled and guilty, but strong and determined and posessed by truth as well.

What you got? What can be made of this? For the record, I am not a doctor or anything like that, and nor is my mother. My mother is generally an aggressively righteous woman, who is quick to threaten someone who is acting immorally, maliciously, or unjustly. I myself am much less confrontational, but any wrongs I commit tend to eat me alive.

post_text:
This one got me thinking.

I work from home currently, started early and at the end of the day, slightly before I should have finished work, I feel asleep for a short while. Bad skills, I know.

A recall fragment of the end of a dream, standing in my childhood kitchen, with my mum, maybe also my older sister, them claiming that I basically owe someone parts of a clock that I've yet to give back. I said I didn't know anything about a clock, or having parts of someone else's clock, I felt they were frustrated at me, and since they wouldn't elaborate what parts, of what clock, or whose, it also lightly irritated me, too. Then I woke up.

Now at a guess I'd say this was a prompt to wake up, and I then did, and it's meaning may perhaps likely refer to owing / stealing time from my employer, or perhaps even myself, and being mindful of time passing and needing to wake the hell up.

Aside from the mundane meaning, which I'm pretty confident about, I just thought it was interesting that even though there was verbal language and speaking, and a clear reference to a clock, and that the dream itself had a narrative structure that played out over time, that the reference to time passing was still symbolic - that I owed someone parts of a clock.

This makes me think that either, my interpretation, which seems like a safe bet, is somehow wrong, or that dreams/the unconscious has a completely different idea of time. I know that Jung as well as physicists like Einstein theorized that time is a construct of the mind, and that the unconscious operates outside of time and space.

It struck me as really curious that this dream which had a narrative structure, expressed across a period of time, included verbal language, and referred to a clock, yet still expressed what I assume to be a reference to time passing in such a oddly symbolic way. Like, why not just refer to time passing/wasting time?

On a related note, I read someone else's dream in another group recently which amused and interested me.. she dreamt of a cat laying on the floor, she was brushing it with a broom, and she said to the cat "don't worry, I can stop time".

So it seems like the unconscious can and does sometimes refer - in verbal language - to the flow of time passing. So, why was my dream so obscure in it's symbolism, or was this perhaps not its meaning?

Anyone else have references to time in their dreams, or any thoughts on the symbolism of owing parts of a clock I need to give back to someone?
comment_text:
Owing someone parts of a clock does sound like a reference to feeling like you owe them time.

I had a dream once where I flew across the length of an attic. When I got to the end, instead of flying through the wall and outside, I was back at the beginning again.
As I tried to fly out this kept happening. Then I noticed the objects in the attic were changing and I was going back in time. I flew out the top of the roof to get out and enjoyed a dream in the 1800's.

Another reference to time was a dream I had where a train was moving so fast it began to appear in slow motion. There was a grandfathers clock and an interesting man in the train standing next to the clock. Everything was slowed down but gravity was still changed by the speed.

One more.
A child on a swing moved oit fo the wall and back into the wall like the pendulum of a clock. To me it represented going between the waking consciousness and dream time.

post_text: I had a dream last night. I was leading a large group of men to a door. Everyone is wearing dark suits with white ties. I knock three times. An older man with a beard opens the door and lets me in. We sit down opposite each other at a quadratic black table. The floor is like a chess board. Behind it, and the host, is a black staircase that goes up, and towards the left. Between us, to his right, sits a little girl in a white dress. Her task is to ask me questions to prove my innocence, before I am let in.
comment_text: I do believe this is made up, because it sounds to good to be true 😂😂😂 that is the old wise man, that is the anima, the stairs most likely is you coming out of the darkness

post_text:
One of a number of dreams from last night..

I was at a beach, and there was an odd looking vehicle a bit like a tractor with its large back wheels, except this vehicle had no visible wheels at the front, and even larger rear wheels.

I was aware that it was once above the sea level, on the sandy banks of the beach, but time had passed and I then witnessed it submerged just below the surface of the sea. I saw some people disappear below the water level and apparently get into the cabin, when it then rapidly, with unusual speed power and ease, reversed out of where it was submerged sunken in the sand offshore, back up onto the high sandy banks of the beach.

Then this event was set back in time, ready to replay again, only with myself as an active participant in it, needing to prepare to do what I'd seen the people do - get into the cabin, and get the vehicle back out the sea onto the steep, sandy banks of the beach.

There were a couple of odd scenes that were never seen or featured when I witnessed the first overview of events initially, I had a one half of a plastic clip like that found on a backpack or luggage (pictured), partly broken, which was presumably attached to the vehicle at one end, that I connected to the other half of the clip presumably attached to the sandy bank, one of the actual plastic clips was broken but I connected it to the other half precariously. I recall mentioning how seemingly ridiculous this feeble link was for the job at hand. Then, equally absurdly, I was handling some thin string which again might've been attached to the clip, which I was threading onto something fixed on the bank on the beach.

Then was a sense of time urgency, and I along with a few others were standing atop the steep sandy banks of the beach, preparing to head to the sunken vehicle, submerge ourselves in the cold ocean and enter the cabin before getting the vehicle out from beneath the sea, where it was stuck deep into the sand, submerged. We were putting on wetsuits. I asked another "do I need to take my top off?" before putting on the wetsuit, "yes". Putting my arm into the sleeve of the suit I noticed just how thick the material was, several inches thick, enough to keep me from being shocked from the cold ocean temperature, so thick I might not even notice the temperature change at all.

I had this dream after I'd already woken once, my sleeping pattern has been terrible this last year. Dreams I recall tend to occur in this time of light, broken sleep, somewhere between sleep and wake. While I can't relate this dream to anything very personal, it seems it might relate to that state of emerging from a dream state itself, preparing to wake, a thin string connecting the waking state to the dream state, represented beneath the surface of the sea. While lightly sleeping, partly lucid, I remember I was able to recall another dream I've had previously a few times though not last night, and thought it interesting that I was able to access this easily forgotten dream. That dream was one mostly characterized by a sense of place, an idyllic small building housing various pottery and crafts out in the sunny countryside.
comment_text:
If I had this dream I would interpret it as this -
⁠
The beach being a place of opportunity (the ocean is like the horizon of opportunity where dreams emerge). The scene shows of a vehicle (means to opportunity) repeatedly gets submerged in the sea (stuck in the dreams) but others are there to navigate it out. The wheels on the back suggest going backwards to get it out. As if the natural process would be to be submerged in dreams and the effort would be to go backwards to get out (go back into the past)?
⁠
You see this and it seems to happen repeatedly. But this time you are acting it out too.
⁠
It seems impossible; the connection to pull the "means" (vehicle) from the ocean (of dreams) is broken(the luggage clip broken) and feeble (the string is thin), but you have the support of others who seem to have done this before and they show you what to wear so that the whole process isn't shocking. (the wetsuit).
⁠
You also mention another dream of a small building with sunny countryside with pottery and crafts. Which seems relaxing and nice. Perhaps something that could be obtained if you initiate the efforts to get the means going by utilizing group support.

comment_text:
The Tractor.:
Maybe your conscience?
It has no front wheels therefore it’s designed not to steer to the left or the right just forward and reverse and keep you on tracks d give you great traction.
The 2 functions may simply be right wrong?
The large wheels enable traction for daily life when applied daily.
At the first the Tractor is anchored on solid ground by the sea (sub conscience) the tractor was originally above sea level where the conscience is supposed to be to help us out with our daily living to make good decisions on a daily basis.
But over time time we notice the tractor has become submerged.
What caused the tractor to get submerged?
If the tractor is the conscience then it has a daily function to help us get through each day providing traction for our daily work? Then at night it rests as we sleep and the sub conscience takes over. This cycle is performed on a daily basis just like the sea. The sea also has a daily rhythm, the tide goes out the tide comes in each day.
If the tractor is your conscience but not been in operation because of other activities then it will slowly cease to function.
The tractor is anchored to the bank with a quick release clip so as to enable it to be unhitched with ease each day to drive into the sea and face the day?
Then when the tide goes out again you simply reverse yourself back up onto the bank and rest until tomorrow till the new day begins and start all over again?
But why is your tractor submerged?
Again, if the tractor is your conscience it may well be you have neglected to come out and face some of your new days thus leaving your tractor anchored in the one place on the beach?
It’s possible that the forces of nature of life itself have altered the mean level of the normal level of your tidal activity thereby flooding your tractor when not in use? When the tractor is in daily use we can be aware of the rising tide each day and make the appropriate adjustments of how far back you need to park it so that it doesn’t submerge when you awake ready for a new day? Having been neglected for some time (time passed) perhaps living in the past the tide has simply crept up on you because as you say yourself you’ve been “sleeping a lot lately)
This sleeping may be a distraction causing you to miss the daily tides?
The tractor needs to be above sea level not under it. You need it to sort through your daily life and of a night when the tide goes out your sub conscience will continue to assist you as you sleep? You can’t have the tractor submerged.
This has happened before but you’ve seen what other people have done when this happens, they (perhaps your maintenance crew simply go in and perhaps give your tractor an overhaul so it can get started again. This may be seen as a wake up call to wake you up a bit? Once the machine has been serviced and running again it’s time for you to reverse it back to saftey up on the new tidal mark on the bank and as a safety precaution you might anchor it off until tomorrow comes when it is nice and rested waiting for the new and rising tide of the new day?
This must be repeated daily. Once you miss a few tides you are then in danger of being submerged again.

comment_text:
The plastic clip:
This is a quick release mechanism designed to be secured and unsecured with ease. The original old tractors had their implements bolted on and it was hard going to change them so they just left them on rendering the use of the tractor to only one job. Then came the 3 point Linkage set up, then what is called the quick hitch set up which allowed the operator to change the function of the tractor very quickly making it a more versatile peice of equipment all because of the quick hitch system. So to we see your quick hitch system in the plastic clip?
I’m still trying to figure this out but even as you yourself have noticed that the plastic clip and piece of string is far too feeble to hold back the big tractor? I’m just wondering about the crafts and pottery, what they represent to you? This idyllic project seems to have the effect of at least trying to anchor your tractor from moving sometimes? Your distraction may be seen as in the string as your attachment to your crafts using it to anchor your conscience to save it from entering the new day and making the decisions needed to get through the day in other words it gives the conscience a break, a rest. Even though the tractor is very powerful and provides all the traction we need to get through each day it still needs to be used, it cannot be neglected.
The plastic clip and piece of string may be your connection to your very relaxing crafts and pottery and as we realise is not strong enough to stop the tractor from becoming submerged should the rising tide come in higher than the average? It does provide great traction for life only when it is in operation each day?
It’s possible your dream is showing you about balance by showing you how easy it is to disengage from one part of your life so that you don’t suffer loss in another part of your life??? If this is so then your dream is asking you to keep and eye on the daily tides and be prepared for them each day when they come in. Also not to over indulge in the idyllic sunny countryside when you get too much relaxation and fall asleep???
Eves comments on the wetsuit to keep you from getting too much of a shock when you decide to “ dive in” and retrieve your tractor are great.
I hope I’m in the ball park with this?

post_text:
Here's some notes from a lengthy dream from 23rd June I thought I'd share with 26,800 people on facebook, it features my mum, dad, a sister, a spiritual master of Eastern origin and a British hip hop group from North Yorkshire. Whatever.

First, a scene involving a pedal bike, in working order though slightly haphazard condition, the chain nearly came off but didn't, oil was needed, vegetable oil was suggested.

Next, my dad was fiddling with a newly rewired, large electrical box he'd constructed. I made a statement of it being 'the most complex for a simple operation', my dad replied that it was all good except 'occasionally doesn't work' at all. This I think was set in my childhood home, which has a workshop/studio room. Either my dad or myself commented on a cover of a plug socket being rather dirty, but on closer inspection the clear plastic cover which was semi translucent wasn't because it was dirty, but because it was the type of plastic which was glow in the dark when charged up by placing it near light first. For a good deal of time I was wandering around trying to find a light bulb to hold this piece of plastic near to see it glow, I never was able to find one. As I did, the small workshop room became a vast room the size of a large field with many people spread around the far perimeters engaged in a variety of very different activities.

Next scene, I'm at a table, outside somewhere else, with my mum and several others sat around it. My mouth feels uncomfortable and I retrieve a selection of small brown beads threaded onto on strings from my mouth. My mum makes jewelry in real life, though unlike these beads, I say 'i haven't even seen these ones before'.

A sour faced woman appeared and takes her place where I was sitting, I make a joking comment to the effect of it being okay for me to have stolen her place. She sits down, I stand beside the table. I look off to the side and see through the hedge a set of decorative stone stairs which look like an ancient oriental entrance to a temple. Then an oriental spiritual master of some sort with a dead pan expression arrives at the table and sits at the head.

Then, outside again, in some different place, a town in England.. I look at a wall leading along the side of an alley which led to an opening to a street below, it has a sign pinned on part of it with some words I forget now. As I look at it it was like a sped up timelapse occurred and the sign weathered away, deteriorated, became illegible and disappeared. The passageway beside that wall then got covered over by buildings, I sensed the route/passage had been moved to the right somewhat, like I'd witnessed the development of a town layout change over time.

I then find myself stood nearby beside my sister, still atop the slight hill in a town, I was standing in a slightly puffed up imposing way, again aware of beads in my mouth, fetching a few more up. Some people walked by, I recognised the voice of a rapper who I listened to years ago, he was rhyming aloud, I felt my mood change from my fake imposing demeanor to a happy interested one, the rapper walked on around the corner, and one of his crew, a tall guy said I should call him and get in touch.

So yeah. Thoughts? Lulz.

I tend to think the wiring, and the small room that became a big room, as well as the passageway that moved location to the right might represent changes in my psyche. And the translucent plastic plug cover that was glow in the dark might represent something mystical or consciousness related. As for the rapper, god knows, I've not listened to hip hop for ages now.
comment_text: There are a lot of details to consider here! I want to ponder a while, but my initial reaction is that there seems to be a transition from faulty "constructed" tech elements (bicycle, electrical box) to more decorative and artistic (beads, rap rhyme). I really get a connection between the beads in mouth and the rhyming rap...but can't quite articulate why right now other than that both are more expressive than "practical".

post_text:
I was in a hospital.
A female colleague of mine from real life was a nurse there. She was treating a patient who was very ill. When she saw me she immediately left him behind and took me down a corridor. I questioned if it was OK to interrupt his treatment. She said he would not be ok if left to his own devices. I told her to go back and save him before speaking to me. I could wait, but she refused. She continued to drag me towards a dark place. I wanted to go back and speak to that patient, and find out why he was left behind like that. My colleague stopped me, visibly worried. She said "you donr want to find out such things. Better not". She then proceeded to prepare a syringe, which she stuck in my neck. I panicked. Was she treating me, applying anesthesia or... Killing me? The third scenario was implied. While I was drifting away she said I would have to wait 7 days, afterwards she promises I would get better. And I woke up

What could it mean?
comment_text: Could it be your animus destroying your male impulses? Do you have controlling women in your home or workplace or leftover emotions from a controlling mother maybe stifling your masculinity? If true it should be dealt with and after a recovery time you'll surpass this challenge.

Last night I dreamed that me and a 3 others were sent to a jungle to kill a boa that had been killing the locals of a village. It was me, our guide, a woman, and a hunter. We found a cave to camp in as a home base for our operation and went searching for it.
We searched for days but found nothing. The woman’s car had a camera on her trunk. One day as she was backing up, her car couldn’t move. All she saw in the back camera were two large glowing orbs.
She came back to us with this information. The guide then proclaimed loudly “IT IS THE BOA!”
Then he shapeshifted into the snake and tried to kill us.
This is the end of the dream.

She looks down at my books, noticing a black and white photo and a headline concerning esotericism and the arts. She smiles slightly and as she starts the lesson, she asks me if I can name a 19th century writer heavily inspired by the occult

post_text:
*Administrators, please delete this post if it violates any group rules.

I have been a fan of Jordan Peterson almost since he began his journey. I have found in his work a genuine desire to change the lives of those who listen to him for the better, so that we can all reach the potential that we have within us. It is for this reason I was so outraged by the superficiality and childishness in which a comic writer compared his speech to the character Red Skull. I thought that it is really unfair that in this "cultural battle", in which we are immersed, there is no more graphic work that contributes to balancing the political correctness that we are experiencing. So I took rule 7 from Jordan's new book and put it into practice: Work as hard as you can on one thing and see what happens. This illustration is the result of that thought, hoping that more artists will join the idea of filling social networks with material with more content than what we are witnessing at the moment.

monocromo
18 June 2021 at 20:17 ·

¿Ya limpiaste tu cuarto? Caricatura 3D de Jordan Peterson. Dr Jordan B Peterson
comment_text: I think Jordan's work has been challenging from day one. Not because he wanted to be that way, but because it speaks some truths that many people are unwilling to face. They have called him misogynistic, homophobic, transphobic, fascist, communist, etc. and this Red Skull quote is just another attempt to discredit him. I'll say just do it and make of him what makes you feel, anything counts!

post_text:
I dreamed once that I saw three planets and three tribes, I saw that these planets were beautiful and had all forms of life. On each planet, there were a tribe of people. Not all of them human. All of them were nomads, each traveling the planet they existed on. The first tribe wore brown leather clothing. This tribe’s king whilst leading his tribe lifted a scepter of gold in the air and proclaimed “I AM ONE KING, BUT TO ALL!” The planet they were on had a bright blue tint and the stars shown brightly.

The second tribe were a tribe of alien, yet humanoid people. The Queen of this tribe lifted a spear into the air and proclaimed “I AM ONE QUEEN, BUT TO ALL!” This planet was the same as the other, only because it was night time.

The third tribe were a tribe of creatures. Each person was a different shape and a different creature. One of the creatures, one of the few standing on two legs, lifted a scepter and proclaimed “I AM ONE KING, BUT TO ALL!” The planet here had a purple hue and the stars were pink.

In each scenario, the dream focused more on the beauty of the world around me than the actual creatures and humans themselves. Though small details were still a bit visible.

The dream then focused on a man, he was wizened and old. Long hair and a grown beard, brown hair color. He was walking around a stone table that had the locations of these planets upon it. The man was pacing and looked at a small spot north west to the table. The area was blocked off by a small stone fence. A face appeared as a spirit and it was beautiful. It had a crown upon its head, a crown of great beauty and magnitude.

It proclaimed to the wizened man “You are one king to all.” The crown disappeared from the head of the spirit unto the head of the man. The man nodded in understanding and this was when the dream ended.

Altough children have primary sexual features as different genitalia, they don't have secondary ones that able you to differentiate unless by different clothing and haircuts and maybe behavior, but not by physical appearance, hence the colour purple.

The wise man to me represents your future self. Notice that there's a stone fence blocking your way symbolizing the obstacles you need to overcome to get where you want to be. Only then you can become king to all! They're all kings and queens in their respective planets. So you must also be the king in your own, and to all, which means that not only you can be in full control of your life but as it is your life, your universe, your perspective of your own loved ones you are the king to all!

3rd planet could also represent your child self

Pretty sure someone will come up with something better than this as it was a very weird and interesting dream. U sure you weren't just stoned? 😂

post_text:
I dreamed once that I saw three planets and three tribes, I saw that these planets were beautiful and had all forms of life. On each planet, there were a tribe of people. Not all of them human. All of them were nomads, each traveling the planet they existed on. The first tribe wore brown leather clothing. This tribe’s king whilst leading his tribe lifted a scepter of gold in the air and proclaimed “I AM ONE KING, BUT TO ALL!” The planet they were on had a bright blue tint and the stars shown brightly.

The second tribe were a tribe of alien, yet humanoid people. The Queen of this tribe lifted a spear into the air and proclaimed “I AM ONE QUEEN, BUT TO ALL!” This planet was the same as the other, only because it was night time.

The third tribe were a tribe of creatures. Each person was a different shape and a different creature. One of the creatures, one of the few standing on two legs, lifted a scepter and proclaimed “I AM ONE KING, BUT TO ALL!” The planet here had a purple hue and the stars were pink.

In each scenario, the dream focused more on the beauty of the world around me than the actual creatures and humans themselves. Though small details were still a bit visible.

The dream then focused on a man, he was wizened and old. Long hair and a grown beard, brown hair color. He was walking around a stone table that had the locations of these planets upon it. The man was pacing and looked at a small spot north west to the table. The area was blocked off by a small stone fence. A face appeared as a spirit and it was beautiful. It had a crown upon its head, a crown of great beauty and magnitude.

It proclaimed to the wizened man “You are one king to all.” The crown disappeared from the head of the spirit unto the head of the man. The man nodded in understanding and this was when the dream ended.

post_text: Just looking for suggestions...I've had many dreams over the past few years where things in them, particularly animals, are black and white. The rest of the dreams are in color, but this peculiarity seems to be recurring. I have never been able to figure out what they might mean - fish, dogs, birds, insects, and in one case, an ex-girlfriend, all with black and white fur/scales/feathers/hair. I'm at a loss. Any ideas?
comment_text:
Your dream depends largely on your life situation at the time. Think what is going on in your real life then look at your dream, meditate on it. Study the meaning of the words and the characters in your dream then it will open up to you.
Eg: in your real life your girlfriend leaves you feeling stung every time you meet up?
Your dream might show you a friendly scorpion you are feeding everyday that sometimes stings you as you get close to it?
It’s up to you to study your dream Eg scorpions sting with their tail as they are close to you and looking right at you. You look at the face but as you do you get stung by the tail. Eg the face is friendly but the tail comes out of nowhere when you least expect it?
In this case you might conclude that your scorpion friend while having a friendly face allows her to get up close but her nature is to sting you? So when you see an animal you study the habits and nature of that animal which in turn will relate to that person.
Another Eg: a lioness looking after 2 Cubs and the lion bringing back prey to feed them. This is a picture of a family in their prime, strong young majestic fully functioning husband wife and children etc etc
Black and white, as compared to colour might mean no variation the situation is black and white there are very few other possibilities just black and white. Maybe animals that you see in black and white are showing you that although they have free will their lives are simple compared to ours who have all the free will to do whatever we like so our life is has lots of colour compared to the straight forward life of someone or animals shown in black and white.
You really need to study your dream use a dictionary to explain the meaning of the words combined with your own circumstances right at that time in your life once you get a glimpse then you will easily work it out.

post_text: Just looking for suggestions...I've had many dreams over the past few years where things in them, particularly animals, are black and white. The rest of the dreams are in color, but this peculiarity seems to be recurring. I have never been able to figure out what they might mean - fish, dogs, birds, insects, and in one case, an ex-girlfriend, all with black and white fur/scales/feathers/hair. I'm at a loss. Any ideas?
comment_text: You're not giving any specific context or details about your life or dreams so here we go. To me it's the expression of feelings and emotions. Emotions mostly. So as human beings we have the blessing or curse (depending on the situation) of reflection. Animals just feel. And act upon the emotion without any kind of reflection. They can be depressed, afraid, happy, sad, excited, playfull, aroused or anything else and they just act upon it no questions asked. And its always in the moment. There's no train of thought or association to what is triggering the emotion. Its a black and white situation. Human beings on the other hand act as a whole. Your life is a complex thing. And we as humans feel loads of things at the same time, sometimes we even feel conflicted. And the difference is that we know why most of the time, and even if we don't we have the obsession about finding out. There's a plurality in us because our lifes even though are divided by moments, there's continuity to it. It's kind of hard to explain. For example a dog can be afraid and act upon it but he doesn't know why. You might be afraid for tons of reasons and you need to know why. There could be plenty of reasonable motives and you gotta narrow it down to one or several at the same time, so you can act upon it. Sure if you abuse an animal it'll traumatize it for life so there's continuity to its lifes also but not on our level. Our lifes and existence is much more complex. That's what i think the dream represents.

post_text:
Last night I went to sleep extremely angry and resentful towards myself (as I often do) due to the constant feeling that I don't do enough in terms of work, studies (I'm close to failing my university altogether) and family issues. I dreamt of being at my old summer house my family sold years ago. I saw my friends through the window, fooling around and having fund like we used to, though I felt indifferent to them. What I remember the most was the constant urge to punch the walls until my knuckles bled. I just felt pure anger and needed to let it out, but I kept throwing punches with my blood-covered fists and it did not help at all.
I remember all of my dreams very clearly since I was prescribed SNRIs, but this one left me especially confused. What could I make out of it?
comment_text:
Generally the house represents the psyche.
So if you dream of yourself inside a house that seems to be yours, you might start your exploration assuming that.
There seems to be some impotent range against your own psyche going on…as though you’re not super stoked about where you are in your personal development.

I don’t know how you currently feel about your old friends…or how your subconscious is interpreting your old relationships…t
hey may not be the same.

You have to remember you’ve got a giant and sophisticated super computer (right brain, subconscious, etc) running in conjunction with what you refer to as your own identity/mind/
psyche. And if it’s not happy with what you’re doing, you’ll pay for it via anxiety, depression, self sabotage, etc.

My recommendation:
do some of those self authoring program things from JBP. And perhaps the personality trait stuff. You need to learn more about who you are, what you want, etc…because that other part of your brain that’s causing your anxiety knows the answers to that stuff…and until you make those thing “conscious” to you, you’re going to suffer and your life will flounder.

You need to “know thyself” and then act in concert with yourself…you need to become integrated in your pursuits so you’re motivated to finish university or whatever it is rhat your path is supposed to be.

Also, being possessed by anger isn’t a good way to go through life. You want your anger to be integrated and on your side. You want it “behind you” and with you. You want to use it. Don’t let it use you.

comment_text:
I would suggest you re-read what you just wrote. Di you think this is healthy. Ask why you are procrastinating
with your studies. Ask yourself why you resent your friends having fun. Why did it make you so angry. The answers are always within. We can tell you our own opinions, but really, deep down you know the answer.

post_text:
Last night I went to sleep extremely angry and resentful towards myself (as I often do) due to the constant feeling that I don't do enough in terms of work, studies (I'm close to failing my university altogether) and family issues. I dreamt of being at my old summer house my family sold years ago. I saw my friends through the window, fooling around and having fund like we used to, though I felt indifferent to them. What I remember the most was the constant urge to punch the walls until my knuckles bled. I just felt pure anger and needed to let it out, but I kept throwing punches with my blood-covered fists and it did not help at all.
I remember all of my dreams very clearly since I was prescribed SNRIs, but this one left me especially confused. What could I make out of it?
comment_text:
I get you especially on family issues, particularly at certain times of my life. In terms of studies and work, try to remember that outside of issues like debt that need your attention practically, unless you have a deep desire for a subject you're studying (I'm suspecting you don't if it's a major struggle, though I could be wrong), you have nobody to please but yourself. I don't know if I'm assuming too much, but don't study for someone else's approval or for some external idea of intelligence or success. Study a subject you want to learn more about, or else just develop a career your own way starting with how qualified you already are today, no matter how insignificant that feels.

You are enough already. There isn't a certain amount of work you have to do or academic accomplishment you have to achieve, for the approval of, let's say, either God or the most good and the highest possible potential of being. *There's nobody worth comparing yourself to except of course who you were yesterday with a view to being the best you that you can be tomorrow, not with who someone else is already OR who someone else wants you to be or some general idea of what it means to be productive and purposeful.

post_text:
Hello everybody. I wanted to share a dream that my best friend had about me. In her dream, we were together on the balcony of a high-rise apartment. It was night, there was no one on the street and in front of us was a building like the one we were in. As we talked, I said, Ok, let's do it, and I pulled out a gun, pointed it at the building in front of us, and fired. It was dark so I couldn't see anything when I shoot. After that she couldn't believe I did it, and we went home. We later found out that there was a person in the building and he was dead from my shooting. People were very angry and began to demand justice. But here is the interesting part of the dream. The person who I had killed was myself.

I must say that I have been through a difficult time due to a tough breakup, and my best friend knows about it. I have searched for some explanation about this dream and the closest I have found is the need to kill a part of myself to move on with my life, but if anyone here has other thoughts, I would love to hear them.
comment_text:
I would say that she believes that you must kill the past self to move on, but in doing so you will become shunned by society.

This could be reflective of how you may believe you have a responsibility to remain heartbroken for some time still, or your friend has an insecurity relating to dating someone who has come out of a stressful relationship.

Of course this requires your friends circumstances and inner world to properly prescribe.

post_text:
Hello everybody. I wanted to share a dream that my best friend had about me. In her dream, we were together on the balcony of a high-rise apartment. It was night, there was no one on the street and in front of us was a building like the one we were in. As we talked, I said, Ok, let's do it, and I pulled out a gun, pointed it at the building in front of us, and fired. It was dark so I couldn't see anything when I shoot. After that she couldn't believe I did it, and we went home. We later found out that there was a person in the building and he was dead from my shooting. People were very angry and began to demand justice. But here is the interesting part of the dream. The person who I had killed was myself.

I must say that I have been through a difficult time due to a tough breakup, and my best friend knows about it. I have searched for some explanation about this dream and the closest I have found is the need to kill a part of myself to move on with my life, but if anyone here has other thoughts, I would love to hear them.

The 2 buildings are the 2 different relationships. Your best friend has built up a relationship with you in the one building whilst she from her balcony looks out with you to see you in another relationship in the other building “like the one you are in”
There is some sort of dynamic going on here. You and your friend are “best friends” giving you and her a special place that perhaps your ex relationship did not have?
Notice it’s you and your best friend “we were together”
again the suggestion is that you and you friend’s relationship is stronger than that of you and your ex’s relationship.
As we keep looking we almost see the 2 of you conspiring to end the relationship with your ex?
Notice it’s “as we talked” it’s the 2 of you talking together On how to end your relationship with the other person.
Again the result of your talk is that we see you agree with each other what has been discussed “ok, let’s do it”
Because the dream is hers it seems like she wants you to end your relationship with the other person? The 2 of you have devised a plan on how to end the relationship “and I pulled out a gun” the significance of the gun means your solution will be final, that is your plan. Notice that you “point” the gun at the building, that is the relationship.
When you fire the gun it’s actually dark so you can’t really see the damage you cause and yet you realise that it it you that has been shot?

The darkness here may represent what you are doing unconsciously see biblical scripture..
1 Thessalonians 5:7
You are all sons of the light and sons of the day. We do not belong to the night or to the darkness. So then, let us not be like others, who are asleep, but let us be alert and self-controlled
. For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk, get drunk at night.
Notice the dark and the night represent that you are not alert and don’t really know what you are doing?

“I couldn’t see anything when i shoot”
Here it is, the dark is you doing this in the night under the wrong circumstances, also by firing into the building in the dark means the way you are going about ending the relationship will surely end it but doing it in the dark means that you really don’t know how to do it?
What you have done in your friends dream is end it by taking yourself out of the relationship which the 2 of you coming from her have both decided upon. Your friend wants you to end the relationship but she also wants it to come from you? Subconsciously she wants you to shoot/kill the part of you that is in the relationship with the other woman. Please do not mistake kill literally in the dream it means to take you out and totally away from your ex. This is what your best friend is wanting.
Notice she only asks you to shoot at the relationship however the consequences of that shooting means that you are the one who is wounded? This “she couldn’t believe I did it” is almost suggesting that now that you’ve done what she wanted there is no real promise of anything more because she doesn’t allow herself to “believe”
“And we went home” again the idea her seems that after you end the relationship you go home together but she “couldn’t believe” meaning if she can’t believe the she can’t give more?
Later you find the person in the building/ relationship who has suffered is not your ex but you! You are the one that is dead left with out feelings and at a loss. Your friend wanted you to shoot the relationship but in doing so it is you who is the one who is now damaged and I’m not sure how your friend feels about that? Remember she couldn’t have the capacity to believe in you. Perhaps your best friend is suffering low self esteem?
“People were very angry? Well you would be angry? Your ex would be angry?
Surely once they realise that your best friend conspired to end the relationship that people now want justice. Now we speak of the day now you are starting to think clearly and alert?
The justice here is not you so much being shot but the conspiring in the night in the dark to hurt your ex and damage you?

post_text:
Hello everyone.

I've dreamed of encountering a nasty wasp in my home. To my avail, I unsuccessfully attempted to get it out of my room. I was quite scared of getting stung but I didn't. I felt as if I've done as much as a man can do in that situation in the dream.

I had a feeling the wasp didn't belong there and it was hovering over me as a risk of unwanted outcome, but at the same time I felt I could live with it, as if I have the tools and willpower to withstand living with a wasp, no matter how unsettling or uncomfortable it may be.

Oh and I should also add, I even tried to kill it, but it didn't even flinch after I tossed a book frontpage-first directly onto him.

I also remember my SO appearing in the same dream at times, and it felt supportive and relaxing to have her around.

Any insights?
comment_text:
There's this biblical concept that comes to mind, but picture this a bit like Jordan Peterson if you will, like it doesn't matter what you think of God or the Bible, if this concept makes sense.

So this guy Paul is being persecuted by the Jews for teaching something outside of their authorised, traditional religion, and he calls living with persecution a "thorn in his flesh," which I suppose is like saying they're a pain in the neck.

He says no matter how much he prays this "thorn in his flesh" doesn't go away, i.e. he keeps getting persecuted. Some people speculate that it was a personal problem, a sin/temptation he couldn't overcome. Nothing indicates that to me, as he mentions the persecutors directly, but in a way whether it's external opposition or internal temptation, the same lesson can be learned.

Paul concludes that God's grace is sufficient for him, not necessarily meaning that it's good or God agrees with him struggling, but even in the event of the struggle never going away, the comfort of the kindness of "all of the good potential of being" in his life or of your significant other, for example, is sufficient to more than compensate for some troubles that don't leave us for some reason.

So I don't know whether there are some particular people or obstacles in the path towards your ideal goals and state of being or even if you do have a personal struggle you want to overcome that nothing has worked against so far, but 1. the grace of God or all of the good potential of being and your significant other may be sufficient for you to *live with that pain in the neck AND 2. I still hold out hope for you that even as you grow in peace, perhaps it's still possible that you do kill it or it flies out.

Maybe leave all of your windows open ;) Leave all options of fresh inspiration and progress open.
