Also Peterson has talked a lot about dreams and what they might be trying to communicate.
To give you an idea right away, it was a nightmare BUT I was the villain.
Most times when I have a nightmare I am running away from evil, or in some other way trying to escape evil. This time I was evil running away from heroes.
The dream:
I'm driving a car in a world I am familiar with, it's a video game world, more specifically the Grand Theft Auto world. (I’ve never really played the game by the way, IF I played it, my time was spent driving around legally, not even speeding. So it’s safe to say I haven’t really played it)
I realize the cops are chasing me, no small amount of cops, cars and policemen on foot. I'm an evil man (woman in real life btw which is interesting as well), a criminal. I drive fast and recklessly and I’m running through several doors, up and down stairs….
Soon I've gotten rid of the cops, they're not after me anymore. I'm in an empty house that’s still being built, it’s basically still just an iron structure (similar to the one in The Dark Knight when Batman and Joker battle)…
I'm not alone, Aragorn (Lord of the Rings) is there fighting me and he has a sword, I also have a sword. We are hanging on iron pillars and fencing. I get a hold of his sword and I kick him off the building, I watch him fall while I hang there.
When he hits the ground I look up at the building, there I see millions of faces / heads on the building - like manikin heads.
I instantly know it’s me, my face, but instead of it being my own real life face, I'm the Joker (Joker 2020 version) with a disgusting grin on its face. (I loved the Joker 2020 movie btw).
I wake up and I do not want to fall asleep again, I escaped, I won, but I'm evil.
I have the same feeling as when I have a nightmare where something evil is chasing me. Usually when I have a nightmare I wake up right before someone catches me, or something bad is just about to happen. But now I "won" and THEN I woke up.
I found it incredibly interesting to dream that I was the "bad guy". I've never experienced this before.
I am actually very excited about this and really want to know what it might mean. Obviously the explanation lies in details of my life which I will have to dig into to realise exactly what this means, BUT what I wanted to do was to post this here and get a more general discussion going about what it means when you dream that you’re the “bad guy”.
comment_text:
Hmm - with it being a battle with Aragorn vs you the "bad guy" I'm wondering if it's reflecting an inward structural/
foundational battle (taking place on the under construction building) of thoughts (swords as the element of air - the intellect) between the "lower-case e" ego and the "true King" in hiding (Aragorn) that is more or less the battle between self interest and being altruistic or something?

I'm guessing ego wins bringing you an "evil" sense of happiness - almost like good for you bad for everyone else type situation?

Perhaps seeing that the smiles are on mannikin heads maybe it's not a true happiness that it brings?

post_text:
Let me write this down before the memory is gone. I fought a dragon to save my father [eyebrows raise in armchairs all over the world].

It was no noble movie dragon, but a black fetid and slimy wyrm. I knew things weren't right when through my window I saw the CN Tower had been erected in Montreal (Canadian dreams, eh?) and my first thought was 'the bomb is about to drop'. But as I fled the house, there it was, stuck on the roof like a fly on shit. I knew I wasn't safe in the open, so I tried to scare it away by shouting and throwing rocks. This only got its attention. The beast took to the air and swooped down at me. I was holding only a knife in my left hand, and as I barred the entry to my (late) father's house I tried to slash at the massive head pushing its way through the door. Luckily the skin was soft, not scaly, but still I could not do more than make it angry.

When it finally forced its way in, what followed was a blur. For a few moments I tried to face it head on, taking advantage of the narrow hallway that slowed its penetration into my sanctum, but it was only a matter of time before it reached my father's room. I cannot recount all the details, you know how dreams go, but in a final desperate act I ducked into the bathroom and hid behind the door. As the dragon pushed his head into the tiny room I took advantage of the angle to thrust the knife under its chin and tore along the throat spilling so much black blood and offal that it threatened to drown me in dragon slag. I immediately awoke feeling like a goddamn hero, and here we are, back in at least some kind of normalcy.

I felt a deep biological undertone to the dream, the dragon pushing its way through the bowels of the house like excrement. A seasoned psychoanalyst would no doubt try to make this about latent homosexuality, and perhaps archetypically speaking it is so, but please save me the sermon this engenders, unless it's for the lulz. In my estimation this was a confrontation with the death of my father, and there is a certain similarity between defecation and the passage of dark memories through the noodlature of the brain and into the light where they can be faced. It was equally a struggle to take on my father's mantle and become the father.

Please, chip in with your two cents. I'm interested to hear the reactions. Mostly I'm just writing this to brag that I'm a hero in the most classical sense, at least archetypically speaking. I also thought community might get a kick out of it.

post_text:
Are there any Christians, or anyone knowledgeable about Christianity that can help me figure something out? How did it work after Jesus? Did he replace the God that was there in heaven before? Or was it something else?

Asking because I'm reading the part of Jung's 'Four Archetypes' where it talks about representations of the Father spirit. It says the spirit is mostly represented as a wise old man, but sometimes appears as a 'boy or youth'.

I was thinking that more youthful or boyish forms would mean an emphasis upon the desire to protect, care, adore, and show compassion for the father spirit, compared to more ontegenised forms. Christianity seemed to me an example of that, with Jesus.
comment_text:
Great question,
So in my opinion Jung hit the nail on the head for a lot of things but missed the mark by neglecting the full embodiment of scripture.

God is one but three and three in one.

God the Father, God the Spirit & God the Son. But the same God. Jesus (the Son) is the physical manifestation of the Father.

What Jung missed is he reduced parts of their character to archetypes and left out who they are, personality and being.

Again this is only my opinion on Jung and what I understand from studying the Bible.

comment_text:
There's the idea of the Holy trinity in the catholic Church.
The Christian doctrine of the Trinity (Latin: Trinitas, lit. 'triad', from Latin: trinus. holds that God is one God, but three coeternal and consubstantial persons: the Father, the Son (Jesus Christ), and the Holy Spirit. The three persons are distinct, yet are one "substance, essence or nature" (homoousios) In this context, a "nature" is what one is, whereas a "person" is who one is.

@ Cam Schwarz The trinity is really true; you cannot divide the father, the son, and the holy spirit as separate entities; they are always connected (related) to one another. These are the words used to describe the truth and to understand the truth.
With regards to your question about Jesus replacing God (the father), think of the universe as the kingdom and God (the father) as its king; and its prince is Jesus (the son). You can have Jesus in existence only when the father becomes (transforms) the son; and when the son takes up the throne, he then becomes the father; just like the phoenix.
To summarize, the truth is replacing the truth and only the truth can replace the truth, always.

Your question is difficult to answer. If we ask Jesus his take on reality we see a prodical son the naughty and irresponsible, and the opposing brother the good one, treated as equals and loved unconditionally
by the father... so He likens Gods love as a parent loves a child.

In the gospel of Thomas and also of Mary he zooms in on both male and female aspects of observation in relation to Marys question on how shes able to see Him in a vision when he had been put to death. And he explains to her how the mind and collective unconscious works and how she is able to see him.

Thats mindf number 1.

Then you get to our interpretation of Christianity. We apply as corrupt fear filled people the misplaced salvation of man as an excuse to justify his murder. But Jesus whas put to death after a puppet trial for opposing the Sanhedrin and describing the temple as corrupt and obscene. The hard truth is that man is afraid and therefore corrupt.

That brings us to mindf 2. Have we eradicated true Christianity in order to replace the truth with a more palatable view of our own archetypes? I would say that the precept you submitted with the question alligns well with that and that you are probably correct.

But I dont think psychology describes Jesus. I think Jesus was far more ahead than mans view of psychology will ever be. Man or God, I think Jesus was a lot smarter than CG Jung. Dont Get me wrong, Ive studied Jung quite a bit and I owe my spiritual maturity to him... and it led me to valid enough insight to rethink Jesus completely.

I think Senex (Wise old man) appears in a form of a boy because it's the complement of the Puer (Aeternus), the Child archetype. It's its exact opposite. Enantiodromia can play a role in this. But the boy is always a precursor to the Senex.

post_text:
I had some dreams last night, one of which was particularly interesting. I was going to the bathroom, and as I sit on the toilet (which I don't think has so much to say here - I think it's just that that is the angle from which I most commonly see the bathroom :P)
, I notice that there's a young girl (maybe 16 or so) standing in front of the shower in the other corner of the bathroom. She is wearing an old white dress, somewhat like what you see below. Having her stand there is making me uneasy, funnily enough. She doesn't look scary or anything, though. There is some sense that I can choose to acknowledge her presence or not - as if her presence is only a suggestion.
I choose to do so, and I ask her who she is. She simply lifts her arm and points her finger at me. At this point I immediately think to ask if she is my Anima, and so I do. She says no, however, but for some reason I don't quite believe her. She might be telling the truth, though - i couldn't say.

I think I went on to ask her some other questions as well, but I don't really remember any more. One of them might have been 'what are you doing here', to which I recall no answer. I'm not sure how you might even have answered that question though, seeing as it would make sense for her to be there, if she is really a part of me, just the same way it makes sense for me to be there.

Can anybody shed any light on any of this? :)
comment_text: Well ofcourse its you .... a side of you .... toilet as prived room maybe, white dress 16 old fashion - purity thats why doesnt mean no harm .... and "anima" could be some especific academic word that means something throughly though to you, but maybe at 16 you werent using those words yet for some concepts ....

I did NOT know what to do, I couldn't determine if it was better it live or die now, but it wasn't my place. I shut the door on it. I asked the 12 year old girl, who cheerily informed me her mother put that puppy in the stove. I could see her at the sink in the kitchen, like a greek matriarch, she was smiling and busy with the guests and family.

I am fkd up about the puppy. I have a stomach ache.
comment_text:
The puppy, an animal, might represent a instinctual/
emotional/
feeling primal aspect, as animals are often said to. The wood stove a masculine symbol, the sink a feminine symbol. It may say something about your anima.

The wedding/royal wedding/
conjunction of opposites is the goal of bringing together the oppositely related, masculine/
feminine psychological aspects, from the Jungian perspective.

Perhaps you're neglecting/
repressing your feeling function, and/or perhaps the dreams emotional force on you was to enliven the emotional response in you. Just a wild guess.

Have no idea only thoughts..
You are concerned about marriage?

The mother is obviously in charge of preparation for a wedding. This matriarch woman is the head of the family and she is the one in control of the wedding prep.
She is prepared but you are not prepared.
She is in the kitchen doing her part for her guests while you are stewing away in the fire.
She is strong and experienced you are young and nervous (I don’t know)
She finds herself in the kitchen which is the correct place to prepare but you find yourself in the wood oven as providing fuel for the wedding preparation fuel for the wedding food and guests.
You are completely out if your league here she’s got it all covered.
She’s not cooking you she’s in fact using you for fuel for the cooking. Without you there will be no fire, no wedding.
No food, no preparation.
It’s more abou her than you.
The puppy is not dead but severely burned.
the puppy has blue eyes it’s sort of innocent but young and innocent. And turns to YOU. You don’t know what to do? The puppy wants you to understand that he is getting burnt to a crisp herE and feeling THE HEAT of the whole thing.
Unfortunately you shut the door on it, it’s not your place to say anything about the whole arrangement at all. The wedding prep belongs to the mother and is more important than the feelings of this little pup, it’s not your place to speak up during the preparations because it’s the mother/ mother in laws place to speak up not yours.
You still don’t know what to do, you can’t determine wether to kill this all off or go through with it. But youre still inquisitive you want to know who is making you feel nervous about all this who is putting you under pressure who is in charge of all this? Why of course it’sthe matriarch just ask her daughter your soon to be wife? She’s of course happy about everything but you’re not?
Now you know who arranged the wedding prep and perhaps the wedding matchmaking?
She’s done her job well, what did you expect?
You are the puppy and your fiancé is probably the 12 year old girl?
Notice the girl is cheerily informing you? She’s definitely happy with the way her mother is preparing everything, why would you think otherwise?
In the mothers eyes you two adults are still little babies not knowing much at all. {I don’t know what to do) you ask the young girl but you’re not going to get our answer there because she obviously agrees with her mother.
The mother is at the sink!
You are in the fire!
Think about it😂

post_text:
Ok I’ve never posted before because.... well I can never remember my dreams. In fact this is a problematic post because I can’t really remember last nights nightmare in much detail but it must’ve been significant because my wife said I was crying in my sleep and it woke her up. All I remember was various different men passing through the room I was in. That is all I can remember.

How can I be better at remembering dreams? I’m not exactly known for tears. Why was I crying in my sleep? Should I be worried?

Thanks in advance.
comment_text: I would not worry unless your feelings during the day are also negatively affected and the nightmare repeats itself. I tend to interpret groups of people as fractions of my personality. If the group is a chaotic bunch arguing wildly with each other, i consider myself not properly aligned and ordered towards a certain problem i face or my current life as a hole. Could be similar to the different man that pass your consciousness but quickly disappear, leaving you alienated by those foreigners.

post_text:
Ok I’ve never posted before because.... well I can never remember my dreams. In fact this is a problematic post because I can’t really remember last nights nightmare in much detail but it must’ve been significant because my wife said I was crying in my sleep and it woke her up. All I remember was various different men passing through the room I was in. That is all I can remember.

How can I be better at remembering dreams? I’m not exactly known for tears. Why was I crying in my sleep? Should I be worried?

Thanks in advance.
comment_text:
I think the more you turn your interest and attention toward your dreams, the more dreams come into your field of awareness/
conscious mind.

Waking slowly, without turning your mind to anything in particular in the outward world, and perhaps towards the inwardly directed question 'did I dream', might help.

I believe some vitamins are known to boost memory of dreams, too.

Naps of a couple of hours often bring dreams into awareness on waking. An absolutely terrible sleep pattern is the best, I find, but I wouldn't recommend it.

I wouldn't worry about the dream, since that would rely on a particular confidence in it's interpretation,
there's little chance of pinning one down just on that detail alone. The fact that it did come into conscious awareness, and was emotional is just nature doing it's thing, making the unconscious conscious. Whatever it means, I'd consider it a healthy expression of something needing to come up and be expressed.

There is a passage from Jung that comes to mind, as an example of how the seemingly negative can be positive in dreams, "from the symbolic tone of death, arises the symbolic tone of rebirth."

It could, despite appearances, equally be a behaviour leading to something positive, not only negative.

post_text:
A dream of an elephant, a symbol of the Self..

In not entirely sure of the order of events...

I was in a dim indoor setting, with Indian decor. An Indian woman in traditional clothing was beside me. She held a candle and placed it on a table nearby. She handed me a candle, but I think I struggled a little to place it where I intended, on the table, she may have then handed me another, repeating this part... I moved into a side corridor, and a moment later, I was looking down from above at a small seeming elephant. There was another creature, almost as large, the elephant was over the top of it. The other creature was strange, it was white and appeared to have several legs, which were like large white upturned claws, like a huge claw-legged spider type creature on its back. The elephant stood over it, and crouched down with the other creature beneath it, as though it were gathering it, hugging it, enclosing it, bound within it's four legs. I saw a couple of the white claws that had found a gap between the elephants legs, and were extending reaching out and around the elephants back, the rest of the white clawed creature was obscured underneath the elephants body, with the elephants 4 legs confining the creature between them. Though the claws of the creature looked dangerous, it didn't harm the elephant. As the elephant then walked away, a few small illuminated spots of neon colour glowed briefly on the elephants body, as though the elephant had attained some special quality by doing so. I was then at ground level looking toward the now large elephant walking towards me, slightly worried for a moment, then not, I realised the elephant wasn't a threat to me.

post_text:
Alright here’s a super strange one! Overall I only have wild, violent dreams and stopped dreaming for years until I read Alchemy: an introduction to the symbolism and psychology. I often feel I’m half awake and just following the journey and don’t wake up anxious or stressed, usually just super weirded out.

I was in a huge house with a bunch of friends, some of whom I recognized. It was pretty obvious that we were there to party and it seemed like a cabin in the woods. At one point, we talk about going onto the roof and the staircase is a spiral going up at least 10 floors on the outside. One of the women seems to speed up it like sonic the hedgehog in front of me.

On the roof, it’s obvious we are in a mountain town and it’s lit with string lights and super pretty. An old man comes up from what seems to be a ladder on the side of the building on the other side from us and he motions to us saying something like, hey is this yours? He seems like a grounds keeper or building manager. We walk over and there’s a few benches with towels and unwrapped (but really neatly laid) condoms on them. I said something like “no, that must have been the people here before us?” And I had this grossed out feeling.

He acts a bit funny about it, seems to be mad at us and then leaves. We keep talking and then he appears again right in front of us coming over onto the roof but this time he seems like he’s turned into an alien with a squid-like face. One of the guy leans down towards him and all of a sudden I become the alien and I shoot my tentacles at his mouth, punch a hole I. The back of his head and rip his mouth off to where there’s just a gaping black hole where it used to be but no blood.

Lol thoughts?
comment_text:
The spiral staircases is a reasonably common motif, one I've had a few times. I take the house a representing the psyche, the circular path up it's stairs as the psyches circumambulatio
n of self development, or effort to individuation. The man who appears at the top, who accessed the top not from inside/stairs, but outside/
ladder, and on the opposite side to you, I assume is a symbol of an as yet unintegrated stage of your Animus, and the condoms an invitation to the symbolic sacred marriage/
conjunction of opposites, would be my guess.

The behaviour towards the presumed Animus symbol and it toward you, might suggest a difficulty you perhaps have in incorporating certain masculine aspects into your personality, is my 2 cents.

post_text: Hi everyone, so I just listened with a friend to the very famous channel 4 interview and she's very suspicious about the actual validity of the multivariant analysis made on the pay gap between men and women, does anyone of you have the actual study that points out all the factors (80 according to JP) that explain the pay gap? Thanks :) (my excuses for the english errors I've probably made, it's not my native language).
comment_text: You will probably find the direct sources easily from Christina Hoff Sommers, either from her book 'Who Stole Feminism?' or in her videos on the YouTube Channel 'the Factual Feminist'. The videos would probably be better if you're looking for more recent sources.

post_text:
Time is what matters. As time goes by, you and I will be carried inexorably into the mainstream of our period, even though we’re unaware of what it is. And later, when they say that young men in the early Taisho era thought, dressed, talked, in such and such a way, they’ll be talking about you and me. We’ll all be lumped together…. In a few decades, people will see you and the people you despise as one and the same, a single entity.
Yukio Mishima, Spring Snow
comment_text: Yes, it is already happening. The grown grandchildren, some of them, already speak of "what the Boomers think" even though we of this older generation still see the differences in our individual philosophies. While we are alive we may care about these differences. After we are gone it will no longer be our problem what younger generations think and do.

post_text:
Hey all, let's play Archetypal Dream Blu's Clues!
Clue 1. A Dream about a ghost hand lifting me up and pulling me this way and that... which I looked up to mean something like transformation.
Dream 2. Old friends from primary school... which to me means an easier time in life but more specifically a time when I relaxed more, was present more, felt more and in general my brain experienced the stress of life and responsibility less.
Dream 3. Having a fight with my dad when he pulls a police baton on me but I materialise a katana and cut him in half first (he doesn't die btw he just says "Hey I was gonna do that first!" And we go back to being mates)... something along the lines of My Dad to me is Expectation, responsibility, perfection and hard work... a katana is a straight cutting weapon and a police baton of all things is a melee weapon.

So now I gotta sit down in my thinking chair and Think, Think, Think.
Cuz when we use our minds and take a step at a time, we can do anything; that we wanna do!
comment_text:
I had the “ghost hand” dream quite a few years ago. It was made of a black mist type substance and was basically a long arm which came from under the end of my bed. It grabbed my ankle and then proceeded to pull me down onto the floor. I smashed into the dresser which alerted me to the fact that it just be a dream. Since I felt no pain. It then pulled me half under the bed and changed into a cloud that completely covered me. At this point I told myself it was only a dream and closed my eyes. When I opened them I was awake. I had no idea it represented transformation though.

That was the second dream I had that night. The first being a visit from the Old Hag. Which was the most realistic and vivid dream I’ve ever had. She sat on my chest holding my arms down at my wrists and was laughing. There was enough light (from outside) to see her but not her face. He hair was long and wet and I could feel it on my chest. Again, I told myself it was a dream and closed my eyes. When I opened them I was awake.

post_text:
I have had a recurring dream from about age 8 until 40. I have not had it since. The last one was different kind of like an ending, without an ending.
By the time I was 8 I had had many night terror dreams. Crabs, spiders and the like covering my walls, and then something completely different.
I was sitting on the floor with my knees held close to my chest by my arms in a corner with a wall to my right and one behind me. The floor and walls were white and so tall I could not see the top and there was no roof but the walls slowly faded into a pale blue sky, I was definitely outside. There was a third wall about 100 feet or so to my left parallel to the wall on my right. Both of the walls extended beyond the horizon and I was aware of the curvature of the floor, that all produced the effect of sitting on a huge globe in a wide hallway. In the distance, I could barely see, large white blocks like giant marshmallows (I believed them to be hard as stone) were appearing in the hall. The hall was about 5 blocks wide so 20 feet by 20 feet and only filled from my right to left. Each subsequent dream more would appear and over 30 years and a hundred or so dreams the hall slowly filled.
Then when I was about 40. The blocks reached me. The block in front of me was 20feet away. Then each of the 4 to my left (they changed direction on the last row) appeared leaving only just enough room for me to fit. I looked at the two blocks I could see and thought ‘what now’ at which point the blocks disappeared very rapidly in the reverse order that they appeared in. I was never afraid but remember being confused at the end of the last dream.
Haven’t had one in 14 years.
comment_text: I recall having heard stories (or at least one) in the Jewish tradition in which somebody has some kind of "dream" or experience of being judged in the World To Come. In those experiences, white blocks are representative of the good deeds they had performed. Could this be relevant to you?

Hi all,

First time posting, so, please, bear with me. And thank you for taking the time to analyze and offer input.

I was walking down a well worn road in the forest with a preacher I had frequently listened to in my youth.(was formerly very religious) The man was passionately defending the sincerity of his religious convictions in light of adopting more progressive religious views(theistic evolution). We then somehow climbed a boulder and sat on the top. The man tearfully explained the core of his religious convictions: "the light of Christ in him". I assured him that despite our religious disagreements, his passionate faith in Christ was evident. The man then started to slip down the boulder, and I grabbed him. I had a sense that he didn't want to be rescued, and indeed, he eventually fell. I also had a strong sense that my mother was almost comatosely observing the struggle. That added to my motivation to not let the man fall. When he did, my first instinct was to grab help, but, figured to check on him. I check on my mother first, to see how the scene had affected her. She was not there, only a pile of dirty moss. I called and called, but got no answer. Then I woke up.
comment_text: Wow that’s deep. I’m not sure I would feel confident trying to interpret that one as it’s clearly very much related to you as a person and possibly your religious beliefs. I’m curious, have you watched the biblical series of lectures by JP?

comment_text:
Many fungi, especially those associated with forest growth, are symbiotic. The "fly agaric," or amanita muscaria, for example, which is almost never found outside pine forests. Through underground mycelial networks, "mother" trees are able to support their offspring with nutrients and water, and the fungus obtains nutritional resources from the trees in exchange for this help.

Images of trees, of course, are rich with meaning. They are some of our most sacred symbols - Yggdrasil, the Cross, the Axis Mundi, etc.

Perhaps the fungus in this dream is some sort of translator.

So I just woke up ( third shifter) today on my 39th birthday from a dream that feels intensely significant, but I'm left stupefied at what it could mean.
I had a series of dreams that I don't remember but there was a dream series almost like commercials scattered throughout them that stuck out. In the dream series I would look down at my feet, slowly but surely in each dream the two small toes of my left foot got smaller and weaker, my second to last toe slowly but surely shifted out of place until it ultimately was like a loose wart hanging off my big toe. I kicked my foot and it went flying off landing on the ground convulsing. I look back at my toes on my left foot and it looks like I just have three long toes until closer inspection where I see my shriveled little pinky toe was seemingly hiding behind my third toe..
What could this mean?
comment_text: Maybe your foot was falling asleep. Or, maybe you are experiencing loss of nerve function in your extremities due, maybe, to encroaching diabetes. Just some thoughts. You would know more about what is going on in your life.

I believe the significance of this dreams meaning is largely understood through its numerical symbolism.

The three, with the illusive, unseen fourth is a common motif, and maybe related to Jung's observation of the Quarternarian structure of the psyche.

For more, search Jungs work, or Marie-Louise von Franz work for dreams of the Quarternary. The symbol of the illusive fourth relates to the Self. The left, Jung said, relates to the unconscious.

post_text:
Jordan Peterson follows Jung away from Nietzsche and many of us have studied Jung's critique of Nietzsche. So in order to bring some balance to the force, I put the critique back onto Jung from a Nietzschean perspective. Sonu Shamdasani, the editor and one of the translators of Jung's Red Book and The Black Books, said that 'Thus Spoke Philemon' could have been a mimetically conceivable title of Jung's Liber Novus (The Red Book). This illustrates the close affinity of Jung's work with that of Nietzsche's, especially the 'visionary' work in Thus Spoke Zarathustra. So I hope this is both informative and illuminating, as we continue to study these great thinkers that have influenced Dr Peterson's work so heavily throughout his career.

YOUTUBE.COM
Jung's Fear of Nietzsche - A Nietzschean Critique of Jung
comment_text:
Interesting.. I think Jung did understand Nietzsche, while still over-laying his own subjective experience into his interpretation,
which is a valid argument. All discussions of matters of the psyche will be fragmented in this way. Also, all future opinions of those studying this will inevitably be colored with the subjective view of these individuals which, although being totally valid, must also be taken into account. Thanks for the great lecture! :) <3

post_text:
Some help on this would be good. I had a dream last night. I have been studying the Cain and Abel story a lot recently.

3 characters: me, older brother, malevolent murderer person

I am a truck driver. So I was driving down the road and my brother was riding along in the passenger seat. He was trying to distract me and cover my eyes from seeing something as I was driving down the road. The scene transitions into a countryside property in someone’s yard. Me and my brother were running from a being, a person. I could feel a strong malevolent presence in what was chasing me. At this point the person I was running with was my brother but I was never able to make that distinction. So we are running around this pile of split firewood, or a pile of something, and this malevolent force is closing in fast. It’s right behind me. I stop running but I don’t turn around to look at what’s chasing me. I can’t tell if my brother has escaped or is present. Or if he’s the one behind me. I hear a revolver hammer cock back. Bang. I fall down on the ground and my vision goes blurry like tv static. I don’t feel pain. Suddenly like you stand up too fast and the feeling of blood rushing up to you head is what I feel. I mutter some lines like “if there’s any sins I haven’t atoned for please forgive me” but I knew my life had to speak for itself at this point. A few seconds later it all went black and I woke up.
comment_text: You might have pent up guilt that you have been shouldering that you should reconcile with. Judging from the dream, your consciousness buried it. It had to manifest in the dream just so that you can ask forgiveness.

Have had many dreams of falling down the stairs of a theatre. All types of theatres with various types of shows and performances, from movie theatres to massive stadiums.

Last night it was a small drama amphitheatre. I started with a stumble until I decided to voluntarily take myself down instead of falling. I went on stage and the show began, and had to run backstage in embarrassment because I knew none of the lines to the musical performance.

I know falling down stairs is meant to be a bad sign, but why are they always theatres?

Just some thoughts, these dreams seem to be self projection dreams revealing your inner emotional state, these dreams are trying to communicate of how you feel inside, maybe you feel you have to be constantly performing (theater) can't be your true self but still find it hard to put forward an acceptable "performance". Hey Guys happy new year. About to get real vulnerable on y’all and share the most I’ve probably ever shared on here symbols considered. Ha. Okay so
Recently in real life I stayed in a hotel in Miami and last night I had a dream that I was in that same hotel room except I was there with my mother instead of a friend and I realized there was an alligator/crocodile in the room. It was pretty terrifying until I realized if I yelled or bonked him with a pillow he would stand down. This alligator/crocodile may or may not have been wearing an airforce lanyard (?) or stole my airforce lanyard (??)... I’m able to keep him at bay then I eventually get hungry and there are plenty of palm sized apples, the kind you can fresh pick in Maryland and there are also onions, which I was eating like apples (!!!). Eating onions like apples is not something I do personally, but I have a couple of cousins who would when they were kids. I’m about to bring my mom some apples, when I realize, oh god, we’re in my childhood home wtf are we doing here (?) so I ask her if she remembers the alligator/crocodile and she said no and then I said Be careful I think he’s still here. Sure enough, he is, I see him from across the house and I’m not sure if the couch is high enough to protect us, so I decide to strike. I notice he is in my moms room and maybe if I run fast enough I can lock him in. I charge, but I’m too slow and he gets out of the room and I have to scale the hallway, you kno, like when you’re a kid and you climb up door ways by straddling them. So I’m there, suspended in mid air starting to sweat and starting to slip, concerned because at this point I’ve obviously showed fear and now I’m wondering if I can jump on his head..? But what would that do...? I’m touching the ceiling racking my brain for a solution and then get woken up in real life.

I googled it and am not satisfied with what I found so I wanted to ask you. Thanks in advance
comment_text:
I find the best way to find the meaning in a dream is to find a general principle about each thing. For example I had a dream that the brakes were out on my car. My sister asked me the question: what do brakes mean to you? I said they are a safety mechanism to prevent you from crashing and getting hurt. Then she asked what does it mean that they don't work? It means that I am on a path that I cant stop.

So my advice to you is to find out what does an aligator/
crocodile mean to you. Write down as many adjectives as you can about what you think it represents. Then what does it mean to hit something with a pillow. What does it mean to eat an onion instead of an apple? What does your childhood home mean to you? What does it mean to have a crocodile in your childhood home? What does it mean that you are climbing walls? Etc.

I find general interpretations
of dreams are far less helpful than using your own definition and meaning of the elements of the dream to find its meaning. DM me if you want any further assistance. Good luck!

post_text:
So, I believe I had a vision yesterday, and would love some input into what the hell happened.

I was sitting at my desk, finishing work, and thinking about some family related trouble. For some reason, my mind started wandering toward my goals, and what I wanted to achieve. I can be somewhat harsh on myself, with the thought of having wasted too much time being, I'd say, the primary recurring theme. You know, like comparing yourself to others, seeing their success and feeling like you are lagging behind, all that stuff. It's something like imagining what I would be if I had made the best possible decision at every point, almost like the hero in a movie.

Then, out of nowhere, the feeling of letting that ideal go entered my mind. It felt very strange, and so I focused on it. In that moment, the silhouette of Jesus Christ manifested in my mind, and my body started tingling all over. It was immediate and overwhelming. It was only his outline, like a line tracing around his edges. He had his palms open to the sides, and the image was flashing in my mind's eye, something like that. I don't know why I knew that it was Christ, but in that moment I just didn't question it. The feeling told me.

Obviously it's very difficult to describe, but it felt like it was calling me to inhabit a different dream. It wanted me to let go of this torturous comparison with what life would be if I had planned and acted it out right away. There was an intensity and warmth that I can't describe. I felt very happy in that moment.

I don't know how crazy or made up this sounds, but it really did happen. It's also interesting that it happened so close to Christmas. So what do you think?
comment_text: I think you had a spiritual experience and the calling to abandon your self shaming seems very Christlike. God bless you, follow Jesus, and become the version of yourself he wants you to be. 💕

post_text:
Hey, folks.

So, background: I've recently been in contact with an ex-girlfriend from more than twenty years ago. We had a bad ending to our relationship (my fault), but she's forgiven me, and we're friends now. We've been in contact quite frequently. I'm learning another language, signed up for a gym; things are improving. I am fairly certain that if I asked her to, she would move here for me. I'm not sure if that's what I want, or if it's wise, but that's my perception of the situation.

Then, last night, I had this dream:

I was at some kind of archeological dig. The man leading the dig had a daughter, a beautiful woman about my age, and after playing hard to get, she decided she really liked me.

Later in the dream, I met another beautiful woman, also my age, who also really liked me. This made the situation difficult, since I had to decide which one to hurt. It wasn't a pleasant choice. In the end, I chose the second woman.

Now, I associate these women with my anima. What does anyone here think about this? Does this indicate some kind of "split?" Another detail is that the first woman had dark hair, and the second woman had light hair. Normally, I find dark-haired women more attractive, yet I chose the light-haired one. What do you all think? Why would I have to choose to hurt one? Is this related to my recent re-connection?

Later in the dream, I found myself next to a well. A man standing there said that it was pretty cold. Even though it was cold in my room as I was sleeping, in the dream, I suddenly felt hot. I looked down into the well, and saw ice floating in the water there. I drew up the bucket, and doused myself with it, which was very refreshing.

Any ideas? Thanks for reading.
comment_text:
I guess you don't make the decision because you're afraid to lose opportunities with other women (perhaps better to the one you have).
I personally think it's a mind trick...

comment_text:
Do you find it hard to hurt others? Does the idea of hurting someone by rejecting them as a partner cause you to consider changing your actions?

I had a number of girl friends before my wife. Most of them kind of showed interest in me first and I kind of went along with it. Like I was partly interested but then just wanted to get out.

A year or so before I met my wife I went after a girl and then found out something I didn't know that made me think twice. I thought it over and decided to continue so reached out to her. Things puddled along then fizzled out.
A short while later she approached me to start hanging out again.
I immediately knew what I had to do. I had to say no, because the spark had gone. Conceptually I could see something happen but the little plant had withered and it felt like self respect required me to say no.
I did and I know it was necessary. Somehow, in a way I don't understand, it was a necessary preparation of me for my wife.
Amazingly, she understood and had even had similar experiences to me.

I don't know if this is relevant or helpful but I felt to share the whole thing.

✌️

comment_text:
The well is like a well of life which we drink from. The well in your dream is your old relationship that had gone cold, maybe frozen over?
“It was pretty cold”
But suddenly you feel hot.. this is the relationship warming up again after so long a time. Being hot suggests acting quickly but we notice there is still a little ice left in the well just enough to bring your temperature back down to normal. You were hot for her again but when you looked deeply into the well you used that remaining coldness in the relationship to sober your thinking up to bring back your temperature to normal so you can think straight. That small piece of ice that had not melted is your saving grace because it will allow you to think clearly.

comment_text:
The archeological dig. You are a new man by the sounds of it, the gym a new language etc but you go backwards now digging deep to find that lost love that you lost with the new found confidence of your new self. You say you had a bad ending which sealed up the old well and it froze over time. You felt guilty she forgives? You are not sure? It’s normal to want to go back in so to speak and want to fix our mistakes this is our humanness but what is the wise thing to do?
You are friends now so perhaps you need to make a decision before it goes further. On one hand you say you are not sure? One the other hand you feel certain she would come to you, if you asked her?
Should you ask her this is the question?
This is in part why you go digging, looking for an answer and that’s when you saw the ice see comments previous post.
You meet 2 women?
The man leading the dig is obviously you looking at the well the old relationship. His daughter with the dark hair is your old relationship it’s in the dark now after so long a time so it’s hard to figure it out again. She plays hard to get but eventually decided that she likes you, but is that enough?
The second woman is probably yourself with the light hair consciously much more aware and confident of yourself than ever before.
It’s interesting that you chose the light haired woman, this is the new woman in your life Eg the gym the new language etc this is the one you chose.
You have to hurt, that is emotional pain which causes growth, one of these women because they both love you but one is not good for your new growth and would inadvertently stop you growing Eg new language, gym membership etc these speak of a man who is growing and looking after himself physically and spiritually. The dark haired woman who you had to dig deep into your past would potentially throw you off track if you chose her? But the light haired woman being the new you is the one you chose and the right choice?

If she responds well then great, if not then... sadly same scenario. Sonething is gained and sonething is lost. But you will be warm in the cold, so do not fear it.

Oh forks. Yesterday i dreamed About flying a white kite with my crush. I thought i was giving her the flying kite but oh, it was fun that i flew it myself with so much lights on the night sky.

comment_text: When your heart soars, the trapezius muscle of the upper back pops the body open like a kite. This is our skyhook that turns the dead tree of the fallen spine into an antigravity device that holds us healthily upright, like the hood of a cobra rising from its basket. I think your crush is opening your heart. You enjoy flying like this, and though your heart gets tangled with those of the other open souls around, you see the potential of such weightlessness to breathe new life into old bones.

post_text:
Hey everyone, I have a good one that I need some help with.

First part of the dream I enter a large stone building that is shaped sort of like an igloo. The building is completely empty but inside looks like it used to be a place of worship or church. At the back there’s a stairway leading up to what seemed to be a large wood stove or oven, that hasn’t been used in a while. I walked up the stairs to the stove to find that it had been converted to a shower and immediately felt that I needed to wash myself. I begin to take my clothes off and noticed that clothes from other people had been left behind. I also noticed that the showerhead had started to run and everyone else’s clothes were getting wet. I had no place to put my clothes down because there was water everywhere. In the dream I never did end up showering because the dream shifted to what seemed like a second part...

Part two
Standing there with the water still running, I looked over and saw a television with a show playing. In the show there was a father, a mother, and a young adult son who lived out in the wilderness alone, possibly in some sort of post-apocalyptic situation.￼ The son had down syndrome. He had sunglasses that were broken, but his father was able to fix them for him and he was very appreciative to have his sunglasses back. The family was happy that the father was handy enough to fix the things that were broken in the family. But then the dream shifted to the mother. The family found out that she had a life-threatening condition of some kind, something to do with her brain. Possibly a brain injury of some kind. The father was working on a way to fix her, and his solution involved cutting away her consciousness and transplanting it into himself or some other Avatar so that she could continue living in another being. The son was very concerned about this, but the mother assured him that this was the only way for her to continue existing. The morbid piece was that the father would to have to perform the surgery on her with no sedation due to their circumstances, and the process was going to be torturous and agonizing for her. But she insisted they moved forward anyways. I think she died, but I cannot be sure. The dream ended here.

Any ideas? ￼￼￼￼

Background.
My stresses are through the roof these days. I had a relationship over the weekend at the same time my business closed for COVID. My dreams have been very vivid this week.
comment_text:
I think that the first part means that you are revisiting a part of yourseld that you may have left behind. Something perhaps spiritual i think that it ties into your stresses because perhaps you've been contemplating your faith in your circumstances
The empty forgotten igloo could be others who have experienced a similar contempaltion and the shower is a form of healing
Where others have also ventured
The tv might represent a family struggle that is parallel to yours
In that you see may see yourself reflected in his drastic circumstance

post_text:
In interpreting reality, paradox is the eclipse; a superior witness to truth than a one-sided perspective.

When we are on the midst of paradox and experience a dissociative crisis, we are reminded of the limits of human reason.

We have an irreconcilable problem that lies in the hubristic attitude that through intellect alone we can evolve as a species. When, in fact, it is where our intellect falls short which hides the key to the sacred heart; the inner-city of the beloved, the only thing capable of transcending our flaunting barbarianism.

We are more than disenfranchised minds, more than just thinkers. We live in the interstices of opposites in all domains of existence, all the time; and by recognizing this and incorporating this paradigm, we can experience the wholeness of nature's oscillating teaching.

By its very nature the unknowable cannot be expressed nor contained within the punitive boxes and categorizations of logic with any hint of profound clarity; only riddled ambiguity, contradiction, and synchronicity can puncture the psyche and bleed the indescribable nature of the transcendental.
comment_text: First time my cousins saw a black kid was when they were 3 and 2, they were definitely confused, but didn't respond negatively at all. This pic is a pretty funny representation.

post_text:
This goes way beyond simply analyzing archetypal significance of dreams. This is an investigation into precognitive dreams themselves and even branching into the prophetic category.

This could take some time since I’ve had numerous, but the primary reason I’m posting this is to look into the final dream I will describe at the end. Those that precede it are to build the context that dreams that predict the future are something that I’ve become familiar with. Every one of these except the final one were exact play outs down to every discernible fine detail. Only the last description here was symbolically predictive/precognitive. The others were actually exact. When they came to occur years later they followed the dreams to exact details including people I came to meet face to face whom I had no knowledge of as actual people prior to actually meeting them. These were “characters” in my dreams who ended up being actual people who I met years later in the exact circumstances I dreamt of meeting them. One of these dreams was of a night I went ice skating. Im a very skilled skater and I’ve played ice hockey for around 10 or so years. I hadn’t been skating for over 13 years before this day that I invited some friends to go skating. I didn’t expect it to be as crowded as it was, but I have a way of maneuvering through crowds without impeding the paths of others or running into them. Anyway that doesn’t matte to the rink guard who had a problem with my skating style. I ended up getting kicked off because instead of talking to me and letting me know they had rules regarding skating speed when the ice was crowded he would yell at a low volume to slow down. You wouldn’t even necessarily be sure you heard him or what he said and even if you thought you might have heard someone yell slow down it could just be some uptight skater who doesn’t like the idea of you speeding around when they planned for a typical leisurely night of slow skating. I didn’t even realize they had rink guards out and I didn’t hear him except for two times I wondered if maybe I heard some other skater yell “slow down” without even being certain if that’s what I heard. Anyway there was one person there that at the time I dreamt this event I hadn’t even met yet, though it turns out we were already affiliated as facebook friends though we didn’t converse much here and I didn’t even know what he looked like as his profile picture was not of him or his face. Anyway The dream stuck with me in a particular way. In the dream I ended up getting kicked off the ice by a rink guard who looked like a very accurate cross between both Jay and Silent Bob ironically. I even sat at work the next day laughing out loud to myself that the guy in my dream literally looked like an almost exact hybrid of Jay and Silent Bob fuzed into one person so the image stuck with me. There was a little bit of an argument and he was making a big deal about kicking me off for the whole night even though he could have skated up to me at any point especially when he saw me standing on the bench drinking water and taking a break from skating and I observed him staring at me in a strange way. Yet he simply lightly shouted at a volume I could barely notice. When he said he told me to slow down 3 times so I was kicked off for the night I was surprised and tried to get him to understand that I never even knew he asked me to so to me it was the first time and that I agreed not to skate so fast the rest of the night he refused to listen. He seemed to me like someone who wanted to excel as a skater and like he had an underlying personal issue with me so I began to wonder if he was partially jealous of my abilities or something and though I was staying calm and trying to talk things out with him he took on a very aggressive tone. I felt it was unfair as I paid $10 to skate and I was only out there for about 1/3rd the skating time. So I went to get my water bottle and chilled on the bench to see if he would chill out and change his mind as I was explaining to him that he could have just skated over to me and talked to me face to face respectfully instead of yelling and me not even knowing what he said for sure or who even said it. I explained to him that I would have understood and slowed down. He refused to listen so when I got frustrated I inquired that maybe he was jealous. Anyway there were other details. Another rink guard told one of my friends that they couldn’t weigh in on what happened as they were busy fixing a broken door so they didn’t witness what happened and my one friend thought he was saying that I got pissed for getting kicked off the ice so I broke the door. This exact event happened when this night actually happened over 4 years after having the dream. I mean every detail of the night including one of my friends who I did not know at the time of the dream ended up being there exactly as I dreamt it. It was an exact replay of events. I didn’t realize it until after the events transpired as I wouldn’t meet this person for years after the dream so I had forgotten about the dream until the event of the dream actually transpired. At the end of the dream just before I woke up as I was waiting for my friends to finish skating when the public skating session was ending there was a very large heavy set guy in full hockey gear who skated out onto the ice and put a water bottle and some hockey sticks on the bench to get ready for what was either a late night game following public skating or an open hockey session. Anyway he awkwardly skated right at a little girl holding onto the boards to support herself and keep from slipping and falling like he was trying to intimidate her. It was very surreal so I laughed about it as a funny weird dream thing after waking up, but what was even stranger was that this event actually happened years later. It was beyond a vague deja vu sensation. It was exact without question. There are a number of other fine details that were exact, but the basic point is that everything down to my thoughts in the dream were the thoughts I had when the events actually played out. I didn’t have the epiphany that I had dreamt this all before while it was happening, but after the fact I had realization and there was no room for doubt. I could even remember sitting at work over 4 years ago the day after the dream and suddenly smirking and laughing because of the idea that my mind conjured a character that looked like a combination of Jay and Silent Bob. It was even funnier to find out that this guy who kicked me off the ice actually existed and was not simply a character in my dream. I could have had some fun if I realized this and knew what was going to happen before the events took place. If I had however I would have played with the events and had by the very act of remembering and recognizing the dream as precognitive changed the future I had previously predicted. The very act of realizing it would have changed my thoughts about the events which happened to have been predicted exactly in my dream.

Another one was a visit to an aquarium that took the whole night to dream through in exact detail so I won’t even try to elaborate like I did in the ice skating dream. The whole point of detailed elaborations is to emphasize the point that these were not even remotely vague sensations, but definitive factual precognitive events without any doubt. In the aquarium dream I met
a number of people who I would actually meet at the aquarium years later who I did not even know existed as actual people at the time of the dream. I could go into detail though this dream was even more thorough in some ways than the ice skating dream so there’s no point in doing so unless I expect people to be reading for an excessive amount of time. If I can’t explain those details thoroughly then I’m better off putting that criteria aside. I feel I’ve already emphasized well enough that these dreams were exact accounts. Nothing was skipped. There was no unaccounted events in the dream compared to when the events actually took place. I woke up at least 8 times or more that night in the middle of the dream and then went back to sleep picking up in the dream discernibly exactly where I left off each and every time. I think it took the whole night until close to sunrise to complete the dream. I don’t really know if it picked up immediately after falling back asleep or not, but it happened in number of successive stages in exact order. There were 2 others that I recall of events that played out years later exactly as I dreamt them.

Anyway the close I was leading up to here involves a dream that I had over 17 years ago when I was between the years of 10 and 12. This dream unlike the others I described above was not an exact premonition of actual events however. This one was more prophetic and symbolic in the coding of information.
•••(This was a dream that predicted Covid-19...)•••
————————————————————————
In this dream I was separated from a laboratory type room that had thick glass observation windows. On the other side of the glass was a rotting decaying corpse zombie type being that had flesh sloughing off it’s bones. It was looking at me and it started spontaneously combusting itself and ignited itself on fire and spewing smoke. There were these fan/exhaust type vents that were sucking in the smoke and venting them into the room I was in and this innate sense filled my mind that was a kind of innate knowing that it was trying to spread a supposed virus “🦠“😉 of some kind to me. It was clear that the being wanted and expected me to be afraid yet there was no trace of fear experienced in this dream by me. It simply wasn’t a scary feeling dream. It was as if I was expected/supposed to be afraid yet I was innately imbued with a sense that there was no real danger and that it was all a kind of illusion/show. I wasn’t falling for it and then the dream ended and I woke up, but upon waking beginning seemingly at the moment I began to open my eyes I was struck by this deeply innate sense that I already knew what this virus was.. more specifically that I was somehow supposed to know already in a matter of fact way like it should have a name I could call it by, but at the same time like it was a question of “what is that virus?” like it ought to have a name as an answer yet somehow as if it didn’t actually exist yet. The feeling struck me in a deep specific way. Like I was just supposed to know, but if I only had the name that was similar to the feeling of looking for word that communicates something you mean to say, yet it’s just on the tip of your tongue. It was somewhat like that feeling, but quite different also. Anyway I thought about it throughout a portion of that day. I even talked about it with my cousin/friend later that day explaining what I just explained about it here. I really would have to emphasize the significance of this feeling to truly get the point across. It was an evident and poignant feeling that was present before my eyes were even open just as I awoke from the dream. It stuck with me throughout the day. One of the significant details was that this virus was apparently something that I was expected to fear yet that I knew posed no actual threat. This question that was present immediately as I awoke from the dream could be paraphrased as “what is that virus?”. So I went on to forget about the dream. Years and years passed. Over 17 in fact and then in the first months of media coverage of the corona virus ““pandemic”” I had this exact dream as a recurring dream. I was the same age in the dream as I as at the time I had it the very first time. Only this time one detail was changed. That question that I woke with before my eyes had even opened now was replaced with n answer and a name for the virus. This time I awoke practically sleep talking in the moment between sleep and waking thinking to myself “that was the corona virus.” (🦠) It was superimposed within the details of the waking question of the dream from when I was around 11 over 17 years ago where the words “what is that virus?” were previously present. This time I wasn’t filled with a sense of wondering what this oddly specific virus was that I was somehow supposed to know about, but rather the answer and knowing. I then immediately realized the significance regarding the way this dream ended the first time I had experienced it. This is an instance where I can’t quite emphasize enough with words the specificity of the exact tone of encoded awareness, but the way these spaces of waking awareness were superimposed with question/answer information and the way I tried to figure out why this question and notion that I should have a name to call the unknown yet known of dreamt of virus left no doubt as to the significance of the dream when I had an answer in place of a question this time around.
comment_text: It's difficult to find a real dream these days here, most are imaginative figments blown up in some way. ....that said, that is a problem with dreams, that they prefigure events with symbols. The two dreams you have are to calculate with. They don't seem so hectic as in you couldn't change much drastically and they depend on an innate sense of movement that describes something of your intrinsic being relative to other people who try by effort or by embodiment of something which seems savvy but isn't. I suggest because you were the prime factor that that is why you remembered the dream in the first place. Though a good proportion of dreams are precognitive, it's exactly because certain things are to stay immutable that we forget. .... Yes the populace is continuously every new generation prepared for new burdens that could alter the course of humanity .... This is some form of angelic loading prepared from amongst the space races. ....to them more important in their prefiguration of action is the totality of humankind they'll deal with as a trading entity and what disposition we've taken to our molding crisiss'

Dr. Peterson and his daughter having a little lesson from Wim Hof.

Y comenten como les fue.

post_text:
I JUST THOUGHT TJIS MIGHT BE AN INTERESTING TOPIC TO DISCUSS:

Sometimes, excessively happy and cheery people annoy me.

I think my brain subconsciously correlates it with (PS: I'm no judging it to be correct):

Willful blindness, dishonesty, stupidity, and self-absorption.

(one of the above or multiple depending on the specific situation)

Would anyone be willing to share if they experience the same? As well as try to help me understand why I might feel this way?
comment_text:
I know a few of these people. I find when the person is genuinely happy it can be contagious and I truly appreciate being around those people. I find these people are still open to negativity, don't shun it, and won't tell someone who isn't smiling to smile.

Then I notice there are the ones who force it, repress the negative. Their smile is forced and I think humans are pretty good at detecting such disingenuous people. It certainly makes us unconsciously figure there is something wrong there - I agree. But what really boils my potato is that they try to force everyone around then to align to their world view and force you to smile even though they haven't said anything funny yet.

comment_text:
Lol, depends on your view on life...

I am happy most always... because I choose to focus on the successes of the positives and work to fix what I can of the negatives, also I have faith in God and my existence is but a pebbles in the stream

I find people who notice more suffering, hard live, and real misery tend to be more happy.

I find people stuck in down looks on life always seem to have fingers point outwards as to why they are un happy.

I grew up very poor... lucky to have one meal a day poor...
My neighborhood was the kind where when your neighbor get killed or arrested you expected it...

I been shot at and had a gun to my face at the age of 10 while my mother screamed in terror.

I been beaten, hated, attack, assulted, told I am worthless, less than human, trash and more as a child by many people.

I was angry and violent when I was younger... then you see the same pain you had on another person face while you kick their ass.... I broke when I noticed it and ended the cycle and chose happiness and kindness for the sake of the young me who never had it.

comment_text: I think it depends on the person and their values in relation to yours. ie. Some folks are genuinely happy for getting a meal that day. And some folks are genuinely happy for getting that new *insert any material thing here*, despite having countless other expensive *insert said material thing* in their collection. I am happy for the individual that aligns with my values; the other, not so much. Do I judge them for it? Only if they shove it in my face but otherwise I leave them alone. Some people project genuine happiness, others project their shadow under the guise of "happiness".

comment_text:
It's a spectrum, a very broad one, all depending on how deeply integrated and at peace they are with their identities and lives, but in a broad sense, it's not entirely untrue (or narcissistic) of you. I mean, I'm not excessively upbeat all the time either, but I don't feel that way about people who are. I just mean rather than judging you for feeling that way (after all, unlike a narcissist, you're discussing it openly and haven't concluded that your feeling is right simply because it's your feeling), I can see some truth to people projecting overly positive vibes as much as they can in spite of (sometimes because of) their insecurities and dissatisfaction
s *or ignorance/lack of care and depth.

There isn't a rule about it. You only know partly from the feeling that their apparent happiness brings you, with some discernment, and way more importantly from getting to know them over time. Does somebody being happier and more outgoing than you mean they're blind, dishonest, naïve, selfish, or stupid? No, but I realise that innately by asking for input, you know it isn't a general truth, just a feeling. A legitimate one if you don't feel great though.

comment_text: I sympathise, I have had similar feelings. Overtime with life experience and situations I try to approach such people with understanding first. There a lot of negativity around us in the world today with many people sapping our energy because of constant negativity. In the words of Robin Williams "Everyone you meet is fighting a battle you know nothing about". I learned that its better to be around such people than ones who drain my energy with constant negativity and as I age I have cut people out who are constantly down and negative. As an extrovert myself I do get drained everytime I am around people who wallow in sorrow and complain. To give you another good food for thought from another one of my favourite authors Robert Green who wrote the "48 Laws of Power: Law 10: Infection: Avoid the unhappy and unlucky." The world needs more cheery people now more than ever.

post_text:
I JUST THOUGHT TJIS MIGHT BE AN INTERESTING TOPIC TO DISCUSS:

Sometimes, excessively happy and cheery people annoy me.

I think my brain subconsciously correlates it with (PS: I'm no judging it to be correct):

Willful blindness, dishonesty, stupidity, and self-absorption.

(one of the above or multiple depending on the specific situation)

Would anyone be willing to share if they experience the same? As well as try to help me understand why I might feel this way?
comment_text:
I'm one of those excessively happy and cheery people. It's not willful blindness, dishonesty, stupidity, or self-absorption
. Quite the opposite actually. I'm hyper-vigilant of negative emotions, and it's a unconscious coping mechanism that I developed as a child to deal with the volatile emotions of the adults in my life.

I'm aware it isn't healthy to suppress my negative emotions, so I do a lot of self-work to face my true feelings, but unless I'm with someone who I trust completely, they are not going to see that more emotionally honest side of me.

Even if I sense that I'm annoying someone, I won't be able to stop because it's such an ingrained automatic response. People like that will throw me into an autopilot people-pleasing
mode which doesn't turn off until the threat is gone. I realize after the fact that it's stupid and that the people pleasing is probably what's annoying them, but in the moment even the slightest sense of threat triggers the coping mechanism.

More than likely you feel that way for the same reason that I'm excessively happy. Somehow, having that reaction helped keep you safe as a child. You probably had fake people in your life and that kind of happy attitude was a warning sign that something bad would happen, or you`d be disappointed later if you bought into their happy-hype.

post_text:
If any/all of you would like to pen an email to Penguin Publishers, 🐧 📚 here is the email address.

ecustomerservice@penguinrandomhouse.com

Here is a copy of the email I sent today.

I have never written a letter like this before but I have not been personally exposed to a controversy such as this. I urge you, as a responsible member of your community, to judge the decision to publish Dr. Petersons upcoming book purely based on its contents. Please have any of your employees who wish to scrap the project read an advanced copy and challenge them to take issue with the book itself.

It is important to be empathetic, particularly to people who have had a high level of exposure to abuse based on things outside of their control. However, to remove your companies' connection to a man who is a powerful focal point for improving the lives of common people is a mistake.

My life, has been markedly changed by Dr. Peterson's work. I look forward to purchasing this book from you upon its publication.

Best Regards,
Matt

Please have any of your employees who wish to scrap the project read an advanced copy and challenge them to take issue with the book itself.

It is important to be empathetic, particularly to people who have had a high level of exposure to abuse based on things outside of their control. However, to remove your companies' connection to a man who is a powerful focal point for improving the lives of common people is a mistake.

My life, has been markedly changed by Dr. Peterson's work. I look forward to purchasing this book from you upon its publication.

Best Regards,
Matt

post_text:
Archetype-related question from after reading Camille Paglia: I think that for gay men, the unconscious desires are instead to both kill the Father AND sexually possess him. I have less of a clear understanding about lesbians, but perhaps the converse also applies. Does anyone have thoughts or input on this?

This thought occurred to me after realising it may be the relative irrelevance of/indifference towards femininity that actually informs the pronounced emotional relationship often described between gay men and their mothers. Lacking matricidal impulses, he does not identify her as a threat, only as the object of nurturance and compassion. She is an expected comfort, but not an ideal one. He sees a sexual distortion who he applies his own understanding of beauty towards in order to relate with, and in the process, refines. He makes her rotund feminine edges into sharp, aesthetic lines in order to make them as appealing as can be stood to look at by the critical eye. He relates with this feminine form as one of his own creation.

The Culture-Father views this act of feminine refinement as a defiant desecration of nature. Rejected, the gay man instead satisfies himself with sexual indulgence in masculinity elsewhere. He sometimes even finds this in himself, oscillating between narcissistic self-admiration and self-destructive hatred.
comment_text:
There's no unconscious or psychoanalytic dimension to being gay or being a lesbian. People have tried to put Freudian spins on it every which way, but it just leads to pain, because it's not about that at all. That's what so-called "reparative" therapy is: Putting a Freudian spin on sexuality, such as you are trying to do, which has changed exactly zero peoples' orientations while traumatizing a host of others.

Homosexual behavior (the technical term) occurs in many species. It's natural and it's all biological. There's no family orientation or parent-child orientation that creates it. It's genes and the uterine environment.

I've had 3 unsettling dreams lately.

1st: a doctor of questionable professionality made me take an elevator which led me deep down to an underground library. The library was empty, and creepy. There were scattered books and blood stains on the ground. I immediately realized that an insane violent woman lived there. The doctor commented on her absence, saying she must have been scared off. I noticed then that there was another woman that came with us. She looked scared and harmless. I hurries back to the elevator. I was afraid of remaining there. The doctor yelled : you know she is here!

2nd: I was walking in what looked like a supermarket. There were creepy female manequinns with tiny pupils. I knew they were alive and I taunted them by waving my hands in front of them, to see if their eyes would move. After a while they did, and the manequinns directed their blank stares towards me. I think my sister was there too. The manequinns were more inclined to stare at her. That's why I was trying to attract their attention. Even when they stared at me I continued taunting them to provoke some further reaction.

3rd: I was working at the front desk of a store. I met a cute girl there which I tried to speak to. She looked interested. (I think at this point there is a chunk of the dream I forgot, but it was not pleasant and it had to do with some entity that tormented me).
Then a boy comes to the front desk and brings me flowers. I'm worried because I don't want the girl to think I'm homosexual, but unfortunately she sees it and she seems amused. There was my sister too who joked by implying i had a family reunion and they brought me flowers.
Then that girl I liked appeared again and she bought a cd with music, saying she will buy one every month.
Then she paid a d went away. On the tray she left the money on appeared a writing: /what can you offer me? I know I had to sacrifice something so I gave some of the cheapest plastic bags. Then I was cursed and I woke up
