post_text:
Been getting a lot of crazy dreams since February of this year. For months I’ve been contemplating on sharing them in this group, but was hesitant on being judged for whatever reason and hesitant lol. I find the more I filter my body into a healthier state I dream better. I’ll start with this one. It’s short...

I had a meeting today with a friend and classmate on planning our careers in the future. The night before I found myself in my old elementary school waiting to visit my past teachers realizing they all retired. So I walked into the principal office to inquire where everyone went. As soon as I opened the door I seen the back of Jordan Peterson head & got excited hearing his voice knowing it was him. When he turned around he didn’t seem happy to see me he looked repulsed & backed away. As he was walking away I woke up.

There’s many more dreams & experiences I’ll share in the next coming weeks if I feel like it’s safe & relevant to do so. Right now I feel like it’s right to start off with this one considering how well everyone here deconstructs symbolism here lol. Mind you I’ve attended his Capitalism vs Marxism lecture & spent 2017-2018 consuming all his lectures on YouTube. Idk if that helps or if I’m just a bit obsessive 🙄🤦🏽‍♂️. I stopped watching his stuff for a year now considering I got the jist of stuff. Recently bought 12 Rules for Life last month.
comment_text:
Likewise, I listened to JP pretty solidly for years. Turning my interest to those subjects I began recalling dreams.

The theme of returning back to school is a common one in dreams, perhaps in part it relates to the way dreams/the unconscious bring up old experiences to the surface, presumably to reprocess it. It could be an indication of the old age of the things which are now coming up, which I think the unconscious seems to naturally do gradually over time.

I'd guess that here, JP represents an aspect of your unconscious, and his repulsion from you seems to be simply on the basis of confronting it. Perhaps it illustrates the often antagonistic relationship between ego and the unconscious, which dream analysis and shadow work aims to reconcile. I'd say a lot of JPs ideas are related to shadow work.

Perhaps more simply, the dream could be seen to say that JP has been your sole, principal teacher, and one that you have now 'repelled' in a sense, walked away from.

I suspect that JP appears in a lot of 'compensation' dreams, but your dream here doesn't seem to be an example of compensation.

What are your own thoughts on this one?

I wouldn't worry about being judged, dreams are all bizarre. To judge someone on the basis of what they are unconscious of makes little sense.

post_text:
Hello, I would like an interpretation of my dream that occurred last night. It was wacky and weird and I do not know what to make of it.

The first part consists of me riding in a misty morning on an empty lengthy road in between wetlands with leafless trees. Nothing crazy

The second part happens the next day, where my father told me to get to my hometown using his car. For some unknown reason, I am riding above our river that for some reason has multiple bridges that I am passing below me. Few times I fall down to the river (luckily it is not so deep) and I remember that father liked to get me into situations that are not pleasant for the sake of being more manly. I felt scared and used.

Nonetheless, I end up in my hometown next to a mountain (that is not there, we only have a small hill) I climb it up and for some reason, I have a hovering sofa above my shoulders ( It sounds stupid, but it was there) I climb up that hill and at the top, I even climb up our cemetery. and there I meet a nice girl. I strike up a conversation trying to get to know her, but somehow I am failing and becoming anxious. I see myself grinning uncertainly, and I fail to get her contact. She even had a dog and for some reason, I had her pictures with the dog on my phone. Kinda creepy.

It is getting late and I just arrived at my friend's house under a bridge we have in our hometown. I don't know why, but in my dreams, there is a small town there. Yet in reality, there is just a downwards path. I am charging my phone there and she is not around, I feel like I should not be there and the sofa is normally placed in her house. I tried calling her, but she did not answer

Suddenly I am in school with my great friend and we are goofing around. Suddenly I look at the pictures on my phone, where I see me, my friend, and a girl I fell in love last year. I thought it was weird since I deleted all of them and on one photo she seems genuinely sad/happy and I know that I am the reason.

And the last part. Its night and I am next to the cemetery with my cousin whom I admire deeply. He is innocently poking fun at my choices in women. He calls them " Girl with a tattoo, Girl with dreadlocks, now a girl with a dog" After that we look at a star on a grave beyond the cemetery wall. He makes a joke that does not make sense in any way. To which I respond smugly, yeah my brother already did that joke. And suddenly we hear heavy scratching sounds that are approaching us. He says it is a wolf, and that we should run before he sees us, he runs behind the wall of the cemetery, while I try to climb it up (these walls are smaller than me). Yet I fail, I try to run yet the wolf is already there looking at me. The walls change to a fence of our garden and the wolf starts running at me. I feel a sense of dread and fright. And then I wake up.

Weird thing is that I saw a shadow of this wolf running around my room and I tried to find it when I woke up.

Details:
-All of my dreams that are in my hometown start to descend into nightmares and our garden usually holds something negative.

-I was trying to talk to the girl to get over the girl I fell in love with last year

-The girl I was visiting and the friend I was goofing with are constantly with her and even tried to have a romantic relationship with her. So I left them both

I know this sounds stupid, childish and even convoluted. But I would like to know if it even means something. I kinda even feel bad for sharing this since, I am wasting your time with a dream that does not even make sense
comment_text:
It definately is a weird one. To me it seems as if the dream is attempting to communicate to you the absurdity of dwelling on emotional events. The mysty path is one of little clarity, and your wisedom faculty(father)
advises you to go back. When you get back you overview many bridges(relatio
nships) and you find a mountain of effort and a cemetary. The past is dead. And so going back is not quite useful. But the star, guidence indicates a glimmer of hope. The couch represents your comfort zone, and its illustrated as silly, yet there. But the journey however whack, is your journey. If it makes you feel any better. We're all looking for a love that understands us and vice versa... that journey is always a crazy ride. But in the dream there should also be indicators of how you should sync your spirit/dream reality with your actual reality. Maybe go visit a cemetary. Go find that star. Figure out what it means

So I only remember the most disturbing part of the dream, and the rest is still vague, but I’d still appreciate any insight.

I was inside a house with people I knew. Something happened to all those people (not like they were all murdered, but, like they just weren’t there anymore)

I came to the cognitive realization that I had lost everything and walked outside onto the grass where it was sunny and pleasant. There was a male friend who I never fully recognized with me outside but I think it was one of my older brothers.
I then made the decision to end things (this was cognitive and not done out of despair or sadness) so I took a long toothpick and inserted it through the top of my head into my brain. It felt strange but nothing happened.
I then panicked and tried to reverse the decision by pulling the toothpick out(which I knew would harm me). As soon as I pulled it out I got extremely light headed, fell to my knees, and, then onto my face in the grass.

I woke up extremely disturbed still light headed and panicked at what I did in the dream.

post_text:
So I had an unpleasant dream, which is fairly uncommon for me. I was at some kind of ceremony that I had a good amount of contempt for. We were very shoddily acting out a re-enactment of something. I remember having a vague idea of what I was supposed to be doing, but everything was screwed up. My contribution was the furthest off from the ideal, but it everyone else seemed content with the proceedings. Something significant was supposed to happen in the ceremony but a car crash or another kind of emergency outside made everyone focus on that instead.

However, while everyone was busying themselves with that I noticed a small, almost imperceptible scratch on my the end of my ring finger (I cant remember which hand). I started to squeeze it and puss started to come out. It wasn't painful, in fact it was pretty relieving to have it come out. It was kind of off-white or greenish initially, but as I kept squeezing it, eventually it turned into red, kind of like clotted blood. It didn't take long before I got all of the hardened stuff out of my finger and I as I did so I had garnered a fair amount of "eww"s and "yuck"s and "doesnt that hurt?" To which I responded "not really. My body needs to get rid of it."

Having felt I got it all out I looked up again and everything seemed different. The ceremony was apparently forgotten and no one was focused on it anymore. After a little bit of my time my focus went back to my finger where I started to work at it again. I remember feeling like I had got it all out but something was telling me it wasn't resolved. As I pushed an pushed (this was a fair bit more unpleasant), eventually a worm of some sort was forced out.

I have had a few suggestions in real life from people around me suggesting I should do something about a topic I felt I was done working on. Is this dream indicating I should take that seriously?

post_text: Hi ! I was wondering, do you have any idea about what the heart could stand for in a dream ? It's been twice now that I remember a dream in which I dream about my heart. In one of them I have to get my heart changed at the hospital. In both there is something with the heartbeat, it gets real fast. In both I fear the fact that it could stop. comment_text:
It could be a literal warning that you're having heart issues. If you think that's a possibility you should consider getting a check-up.

However, it's more likely that it's metaphorical, and if that's the case you'd have to consider what the heart represents for you. Is it romantic love? Your core self? Your motivation for life? Your future dreams?

Whatever it is, I would interpret it as you being afraid/anxious of making a change that you know is necessary in your life. You're afraid of the change, but you should be more afraid of not changing. You need to slow down and let the change happen.

post_text:
Having a lucid dream is a wonderful experience. Have any of you experienced this? If so do you have anything you do to become aware that you are dreaming?

For example, when I am dreaming I find that I float down stairs very rapidly. So when I come to a set of stairs that I need to descend, I angle my feet just right so I glide down. I don't do this in real life, so when I do it in my dream I become aware that I am not conscious. Here is a video of someone explaining what it kind of looks like:



YOUTUBE.COM
sliding downstairs on your feet | tutorial
comment_text:
Interesting way to slide down stairs. When little we use to use boxes :)
In dreams I usually leap out to grab the guard rail and swing my body around and then reach out for the next guard rail. It's fun.
to become lucid I stay aware during the day and constantly ask if I am dreaming. In a few days I will become aware in the dream and then realize it's a dream.
They say practicing things in your dreams makes it a lot easier to do in waking life. So learning to use dream time consciously is a great way to save time!

post_text:
Got this post from another group and would love to hear some thoughts

Jacob Stephens‎Fans of K.W.M.L. (King, Warrior, Magician, Lover) by R. Moore & D. Gillette
21 October 2020 at 20:33 ·

I see a lot of similarities between the Stoic idea of 'amor fati' as well as 'Rule 12: Pet a cat when you see one' from JBP's book - as expressions of the 'Lover' archetype from King, Warrior, Magician, Lover.

Amor fati - being a sincere love (amor) and appreciation for the fate (fati) which befalls us

'Pet a cat' - being an allegory for taking a moment to focus on the little joys which life sends to us unexpectedly

'Lover archetype' - being the archetype which finds joy in the present moment

Thoughts etc?
comment_text:
Yes, defintely. I have found that the 12 Rules for Life can be rephrased and implemented in a several philosophical and psychological concepts such as daoism, stoicism and existentialism to name a few. This book has come about by combining a lot of information from a very, very, very brought number of different sources. For example the stoic titles of the chapters for 12 Rules for Life could look something like this; and I am quoting a few of the old stoics below. The quotes are numbered in accordence with the chapters of the book:

1. We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more in imagination than in reality. - Seneca

2. How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself? - Epictetus

3. The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best. - Epictetus

4. Curb your desire - don’t set your heart on so many things and you will get what you need. - Epictetus

5. Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms - you’ll be able to use them better when you’re older. - Seneca

6. Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one. - Marcus Aurelius

7. Don’t seek for everything to happen as you wish it would, but rather wish that everything happens as it actually will -then your life will flow well. - Epictetus

8. If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it. - Marcus Aurelius

9. If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid. - Epictitus

10. Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself. - Marcus Aurelius

11. True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing. The greatest blessings of mankind are within us and within our reach. A wise man is content with his lot, whatever it may be, without wishing for what he has not. - Seneca

12. When you arise in the morning, think what a privilege it is to be alive, te breath, to think, to enjoy, to love. - Marcus Aurelius.

And to tie them all together: Happiness and freedom begin with a clear understanding of one principle. Some things are in your control. And some things are not. - Epictetus

Or as the doctor himself said: It's all very well to think the meaning of life is happiness, but what happens when you're unhappy? Happiness is a great side effect. When it comes, accept it gratefully. But it's fleeting and unpredictable. It's not something to aim at – because it's not an aim. And if happiness is the purpose of life, what happens when you're unhappy? Then you're a failure. - Jordan Peterson

post_text:
I had a dream that I went back in time met Eddie veddar (singer of Pearl Jam) when he was 15 (way before he was a famous singer) - like any group of kids we were all hanging out in a parking lot and in coffee shops - I tell him about his life that is about to happen and tell him to look me up in the future I tell him that his first hit song is “alive” second hit is song is called “black” and tell him about Seattle and the grunge scene; that he’ll join a band out there to replace a singer who dies which caused the guitarist to write some of the most touching music of a generation and your deeply disturbing childhood with your dad influences your writing in such an impactful way that the world takes notice. He says he’s been to Seattle before.

I keep getting harassed by a group of dudes aggressively during this night of otherwise seemingly meaningless interactions hanging out. They’re Trying to intimidate me targeting me for some reason. Sticking trash in my pocket. This type of stuff happened to me in high school in real life. In the dream one of them, Mocks sticking a shiv in my neck by surprise and then the dude confronting me says, see what he just did that’s what you’re gonna get if you don’t give me your phone.

Since this is back in time, there were no iPhones, I had an iPhone which no one knew about. It was out of place with everything else occurring. Wierd... like the dream was trying to get rid of my future tech.

Nobody knows about coffee tea and I start a trend pointing out that it’s a cool place to hang and chill so all of a sudden a lot of people are there and it’s still just like a normal occasion type of feeling.

I meet this dude named chip who is actually a guy I knew much later in my life who was in a band, very talented but not famous just local cool guys in a local ska band, in the dream it’s when he’s 15 years old, same age as Eddie Veddar in this dream. I didn’t know him in real life at that age. I have weed and I tell him we’ll hang out. We hit it off like we always did in real life. There’s a band playing that is basic and blah and im hanging out with a whole group at a table
Just kids and Eddie veddar is just one of the guys in our crew obviously not important yet except to me since I knew the future.

I keep talking to him about his life. I tried writing it down for him to keep, but in the dream I can’t seem to get my hand to write letters. He has like a friend/brother who’s not interested wearing a mask like today except in the dream it’s not for Covid it’s just a fashion statement, but Eddie is interested in talking. We keep talking.

I keep getting jumped by this really pissed off group of guys with one dude in it who is very skittish... he’s the one who mocks sticking a shiv in my neck to let me know that could’ve been real and if I don’t confirm, next time it will be real.

I escape through a small service window and That one skittish guy follows me outside where it’s just us so I get a little more brave and start boxing him. Except in the dream I can’t seem to throw an actual punch it’s slow motion no impact. But he compliments my left hook and starts being complimentary in submissive psychopathic way. and then I wake up...shook.
What does this mean?
comment_text:
The dream is what Jungians might likely describe as having a 'compensating' nature; associating with trendy friends, starting your own trends, this whilst being a target for bullies.

Maybe the dream is simply having you turn and face aspects of your unconscious, as you did within the dream.

The confused details in the timeline might simply be about contaminating future with past, old experiences influencing the present being bought to the surface.

Phones, cameras, writing often seem to be difficult in dreams, perhaps in that context they symbolise being impeded, restricted in some way, or an inability to capture/grasp something.

I've got to say, coffee and tea are cool, but they're no ska band. That's an odd detail that catches my attention ☕ why coffee and tea?! And why didn't they know about them, I wonder?

post_text:
I dreamed that Jordan was debating in the heavens hahaha! Jokes aside, I made an artwork of that iconic free speech rally scene and how that one comment about JBP as a goddamned scholar of ancient Athens brought chills to my spine. I thought that most of you here might appreciate this.

To make this post relevant to dreams, I would like to consult about a set of dreams that I'd been having for several nights. To give you a backstory, I'm the oldest of my siblings, I'm still in my 20's, and I've been doing my best to set our house in order starting with my three younger brothers. My youngest brother is now a teenager, now facing teenager dilemmas. I wanted to make sure I didn't bother his "skateboarding" as he was growing up.

So in my dreams he was still that infant boy I knew. I dream I'd carry him, put him to sleep, play with him, protect him, still fascinated in that little bundle of joy. He never grew up in my dreams. I always ponder on it, and it's really been haunting me into thinking I haven't actually accepted that he has grown now. Hopeful for your insights as I wonder if I have to confront this.

EDIT: If you're curious, I have an art page that you can follow.
https://www.facebook.com/AdelCreates

EDIT II: Been getting some requests haha! You can find me on most platforms as @adelcreates
Twitter: https://twitter.com/adelcreates
IG: https://www.instagram.com/adelcreates

Thank you for your support!
comment_text:
I think it's more about forever having the "older sister" role, and it requires retaining the mental image of him as your baby brother. I'm 24, got 4 older sisters, three of witch are in their 30s and nearly 40s. Every now and then when all my siblings come home (9 of us, 11 with parents), we'd bring back old memories and every time they'd say with renewed shock how long it's been since my toddler shenanigans; they still call me by my childhood nickname (wordplays on my name, one meaning "swan" in hebrew, and the other barbarian). It's a bit ambarrasing, since im 24 for god sake, but I'll always be their baby brother.
We're all very connected, I can tell tham anything. the relationship adapted, some aspects naturally, some I had to make clear; the baby in your dream will start talking and walking and you have to let it. He might stray away, but he'll come back if you let him wander without holding his hand at every step.

post_text: Last night was one of the first dreams that i could actually remember having in a long time. I only remember the end though. Apparently i was some kind of undercover agent trying to take down some corrupt billionaire. But towards the end he put a hit on me. And i was actually shot point blank in the back of the head. But survived. The detail of being shot seemed so vivid. Ive never been shot but everything went black quiet and numb. I somehow got my own gun and started hunting these people down while still bleeding from my head. I couldnt find them though. My intuition told me there had to be some kind of secret passage way in the basement of the house i was in. (My grandmothers, house dont ask it was a weird dream lol) I found what looked like a cut out in the wall. But i was too scared to just pull it open. I started tracing it in between the room and found the other side a few doors down. There was an obvious entrance there. So i waited for someone to emerge. The screws in the door all started to slowly rotate out like it was about to open. And right when they fell and hit the ground i woke up. The strange thing for me was that almost all of this was in the first person. I rarely ever have dreams like that. At least that i can remember anyways. Maybe someone can give me an outside perspective on this. Thanks for reading

but I don't quite understand your intuition afterwards... not that it's senseless or meaningless, just out of the grasp of my understanding

comment_text: With all respect. The dream is a part of you and your subconscious which is influenced by your reality. Dreams often can mean things to a person where a 3rd Perspective can not always interpret as well as you can. I've had dreams in this manner as well. It shows your courage and also your mortality. Death in dreams usually can mean your subconscious is saying life changing events may be coming your way and to be guarded as you may have malevolence around you. Never doubt your subconscious as it is more powerful than your consciousness. With that being said it sounds like a great dream adventure you had.

post_text:
This night I dreamt of being my own future incarnation, as a girl.
I was in 2036 and I was aware of my previous incarnation, which would be my current one in waking life. I knew I was a man called Alberto and that in 2020 I died at the entrance of a church because the ceiling collapsed. I was also aware who my family members were, and I knew they reincarnated with me as my new family members. It was a weird sensation not being tied to one identity, but knowing of having had one before that was totally different.

I wonder what it could mean.
comment_text:
It could well mean that you’re Unconscious is suggesting to build a more intimate connection to your Anima in the future.
The church collapsing and your previous death could perhaps signify the collapse of rigid ways of thinking, the parts of you that must ‘die’ which would then precipitate a better connection to your Unconscious and the collective Unconscious. You don’t need to lose all the familiar things in order to grow and the reincarnated family could be an expression of this. Psychological growth is not necessarily the complete abandonment of the old, rather it is retaining what is useful and abandoning what no longer serves us. This is transformation which literally means to change the form of things.

comment_text:
This dream is rich with archetypes. I wonder what you associate with churches. The entrance to a church or temple traditionally represents entering into a holy space, thus stepping out of the mundane world. Psychologically
this could stand for the higher self, as opposed to the every-day identity. Dying upon entering this holy place could mean the old you dying in order to be reborn, entering a higher place. The new you is female, i.e. representing female sides - the anima - not present in you current self-image.

post_text: This will be the first time that I shared a dream of mine officially.... when I was younger I had a nightmare everything was calm and I was at a theme park, I don’t know if I was alone or with a friend, and all of a sudden as I get on a roller coaster… A giant maybe 30 foot tall spider boards the track and proceeds to chase and derail the roller coaster causing it to crash and burn I remember the ride being torn apart and people being eaten and as the spider approached me… I woke up??? What do I make of this?

First of all, there is an element of Anima in this dream. The Anima can show up as a member of the opposite sex or an Animal or creature. The level of danger associated with the creature displays how out of touch with instinct we are.
Second, there is a myth of Anansi a giant spider who is also the trickster Archetype.

post_text:
“The mother is earlier than the son. The feminine has priority, while masculine creativity only appears afterwards as a secondary phenomenon. Woman comes first, but man “becomes.” The prime datum is the earth, the basic maternal substance. Visible creation proceeds from her womb, and it is only then that the sexes are divided into two, only then does the masculine form come into being. Thus, male and female do not appear simultaneously; they are not of the same order.… The female is primary, the male is only what comes out of her. He is part of the visible but ever-changing created world; he exists only in perishable form. Woman exists from everlasting, self-subsistent, immutable; man, evolving, is subject to continual decay. In the realm of the physical, therefore, the masculine principle is of second rank, subordinate to the feminine. Herein lies the prototype and justification of gynocracy; herein is rooted that age-old conception of an immortal mother who unites herself with a mortal father. She is perennially the same, but from the man the generations multiply themselves into infinity. Ever the same Great Mother mates with ever new men.”

The Origins and History of Consciousness
Erich Neumann
comment_text: Man and woman was created with equal value in the image of God. In terms of chronological order, however, man came first. Genesis 2:22 And the rib that the Lord God had taken from the man he made into a woman and brought her to the man. Furthermore, God, the eternal Father, Son and Holy Spirit, the creator of the universe, has chosen to reveal himself in masculine terms (King, Father, Son, Him/He). Men and women are both mortal, but we will recieve eternal consequences our actions in this life. Repent and believe in Jesus.

post_text:
I'd be interested to hear some thoughts on this:

The connection between what Joseph Campbell called "follow you bliss" and what JBP calls "pursue what is meaningful"

This video by LSOO is Part 3 (also shared in the Fans of Joseph Campbell group) and it gave me a lot of thought in terms of the relationship between identity groups and the pursuit of meaning.
Identity in terms of the meaning we pursue and how we pursue that meaning - thus we relate to one another (in real life as well as in stories) yet by pursuing meaning first and discovering our group we find allies - the alternative is to declare a group and from that group derive our meaning and our goals.

In this sense I'm seeing a direct relationship between JBP's advocacy to pursue meaning, and his wariness of group identities.

What do you all think?

YOUTUBE.COM
Stories as Identities: Who Are We Without Them?

Jacob Stephens shared a link to the group: Fans of Joseph Campbell.
7 October 2020 at 19:34 ·

This video by LSOO is Part 3, and it gave me a lot of thought in terms of the relationship between identity groups and the pursuit of meaning.

Identity in terms of the meaning we pursue and how we pursue that meaning - thus we relate to one another (in real life as well as in stories) yet by pursuing meaning first and discovering our group we find allies - the alternative is to declare a group and from that group derive our meaning and our goals.
comment_text: Yeah I agree. Pursuit of meaning comes ultimately from relating to your Self first and foremost and your own individuation. Knowing what you want, what is meaningful to you and owning who you are. Also, with group identity there is a huge element of the shadow involved. Usually, when we have repressed traits, we project them on to others, but rather than own the traits and work with them, or project all of our unwanted traits on to those close to us, people end up joining groups that have ready made scapegoats on whom to project. This allows people to disown the shadow and feel self righteous. The penalty is they lose their individuality and the true meaning, the telos of their own life, which is revealed only by working on and relating to our selves.

post_text:
I'd be interested to hear some thoughts on this:

The connection between what Joseph Campbell called "follow you bliss" and what JBP calls "pursue what is meaningful"

This video by LSOO is Part 3 (also shared in the Fans of Joseph Campbell group) and it gave me a lot of thought in terms of the relationship between identity groups and the pursuit of meaning.
Identity in terms of the meaning we pursue and how we pursue that meaning - thus we relate to one another (in real life as well as in stories) yet by pursuing meaning first and discovering our group we find allies - the alternative is to declare a group and from that group derive our meaning and our goals.

In this sense I'm seeing a direct relationship between JBP's advocacy to pursue meaning, and his wariness of group identities.

What do you all think?

YOUTUBE.COM
Stories as Identities: Who Are We Without Them?

Jacob Stephens shared a link to the group: Fans of Joseph Campbell.
7 October 2020 at 19:34 ·

This video by LSOO is Part 3, and it gave me a lot of thought in terms of the relationship between identity groups and the pursuit of meaning.

Identity in terms of the meaning we pursue and how we pursue that meaning - thus we relate to one another (in real life as well as in stories) yet by pursuing meaning first and discovering our group we find allies - the alternative is to declare a group and from that group derive our meaning and our goals.
comment_text:
I think the phrase "follow your bliss" has the potential of offering a bad life strategy. It would be easy to misinterpret into hedonism, which doesnt typically end well.

I prefer the suggestion that JBP suggests because it takes into account that life has suffering that cant be avoided. So if you have to suffer, you might as well do your utmost to reduce it for yourself and those around you because it's the best bet you have to create as much happiness while at the same time avoided the pain.

I appreciated the video because whether you are religious or not it comes to the same conclusion: be the best possible version of yourself as you can and inspire others to do the same.

post_text:
Haven't shared in a while, had some mild nightmares last night. Some paralysis in and out of being awake just remember gasping out "help, help, help" over and over. I think it's the remnants of grief that come around this time of year when my best friend took his life, I often find myself asthmatic in the days surrounding. Death anniversary was two weeks ago.
No distinct imagery unfortunately but distinct feelings of feeling trapped and suffocating.

Secondary nightmare was being critisized in the gym for being a phony. This was mostly in the context of me being trained by a past mentor that I've lost touch with even though they're only a few miles away.
I'm a personal trainer but out of work on that front, but still going to my fight gym regularly and trying to be helpful. I'm scared of rejection and being socially excluded while also trying to give the advice that has saved me from years of joint pain and inability to do the one reliable activity that improves my mental health that others probably feels similarly.
Distinct feelings of caring about what others think of me and wanting them to "like" me and validate me. Not wanting to feel dumb or feel inadequate but also reconciling that it is necessary for learning.

Maybe that made sense to someone.
comment_text:
Hmm, well this is just my take on the dream based on what you have said, and what I can relate to my personal experience.

I am thinking it relates to what you are working on within - the gym as a place where you work on yourself and it also doubles as your workplace - so it could relate to your workplace but I think with the work mentor it is relating to mentoring yourself, and that you are not being open/honest about yourself in some way.

My experience was very similar - not speaking my mind or sharing my opinion in case I was wrong, it wasn't my place since I know next to nothing.

But over even just these last few years I've almost reversed that completely, ever since, and dream interpretation was a huge influence on that, I stopped being afraid of being wrong. I think it's something like integrating in part the archetype of the fool.

Because now I put forward ideas without fear, and be "vulnerable" which is a wishy washy way of putting it makes it sound weak but I don't think it is. Because over time I have found being wrong is great, especially if you are open minded and listen to others views, not just taking on board what people say but if you understand what they are saying it corrects you a little. You won't grow at all if you are right every single time. Interestingly too, because I have taken on board and accepted idiocy, it makes me more prone to being made out to be stupid, but having that done to me actually has almost no effect. If I'm made out to be stupid it's like "yeah I know, so what..."

I think framing things as opinion is critical to that, if you put your opinion as an unquestionable fact you can't budge, but if you frame it as opinion I have found people respond to it well and correct you without judgement. But if you come with a Sith-like absolute conviction you leave yourself with no room to move, it's like betting your ego on it, and if someone disagrees it becomes a challenge with so much riding on it. If it's an opinion, there's flexibility on both sides, and if you can bend it can be positive for the person correcting you because they get the benefit of correcting/
helping and in my experience generally don't actually judge you, even if they joke about it, and you also benefit from the learning.

I guess the down side is that people looking down their noses on stupid people. That's why characters like Homer Simpson, Peter Griffin, they're so unpopular and not loved, in comparison to the smarter more popular Brian the dog or Lisa Simpson hey.

It's like, people aren't intimidated by people who know more than them and will openly share information with them knowing they will be corrected and made out to be stupid. People love that.

post_text:
Two prominent dreams I had last week.

Dream 1:

I am baking something, some dessert pie. It has three pies within it, different fruits; like blueberry, apple, and something but the focus was on the gaps between where I was using different pastry like cups in triangular shapes to connect the pies into a mega pie, and filling in the space around it. These triangle cups I was filling with some honey type mixture.

The thing was I was doing this outside on the street outside where I grew up that had a parralel storyline at the same time where I was trying to overcome some ghost monster that was living upstairs in my childhood home, and at the same time I had a deadline to get this finished for work.

Dream 2:

Two prominent roller rinks in my city shut down, and people are sad about it.

I however discover an old abandoned facility in a wooded parkland near a river. I purchase this property and start developing the buildings. There is one building I do up for social/general skating, another I start building up as a hockey rink, and then another for skaters with half pipes, rails etc. I then start paving paths between the three buildings so you can go from one area to another without having to take off your skates.
comment_text:
Dream 1 is similar to the fairy Tale Masha and the bear. Masha is out gathering fruit and mushrooms and is captured and forced to live with a bear (your ‘ghost monster’) who refuses to let her leave. She tricks the bear into taking her back to her grandmothers house by baking a bunch of pies. She hides under the pies, unbeknownst to the bear and tricks the bear into taking her back to her grandmothers house. When they arrive, the grandparents dogs smell the bear and chase it off and Masha pops out from underneath the pies.

Dream 2. Is not so obvious in terms of folk lore examples. There is a hint of the ice king who invented skating and sledding but it also has a common thread with the first dream. The first dream, pies are being connected to make a super pie. In the second dream buildings are connected by paving paths between the buildings.
Usually I see buildings as a symbol of the personal unconscious. This is because, like buildings or mazes or labyrinths, the personal unconscious is made up of ‘walls’ of contextualised ideas. Perhaps, I would say there is a thread here of joining things conceptually that might be usually separate distinct ideas. Sometimes over compartmentalis
ation can get in the way of the unconscious. If this is the case it could be a sign to find connecting threads between over compartmentalis
ed ideas. Without knowing you and knowing more it’s hard to offer more detail than that.

comment_text:
Great dreams..
Your first dream was about the 3 pies and filling in the gaps and you bringing the 3 parts of yourself together.
Now again we see another set of 3, that is the 2 prominent roller rinks which are closed and the abandoned facility.
Closed and abandoned.
Roller Rinks themselves have undergone significant change. Starting out as Disco style rinks with disco music and old style wheels on hard floors with fog machines and flashing lights.This fad reached a peak in the 80s, and around 2006 discontinued. In 2020 roller skating began a resurgence
The end of the Disco Era and the advent of inline roller skates hit the roller rink industry hard, with many rinks closing. However, as had happened earlier, most rink owners adapted and survived the economic storm. Roller derby, a professional sport of the 1950s and 1960s once considered virtually dead, has seen a DIY, grassroots rebirth in popularity in the early 21st century with amateur and semi-pro teams forming leagues nationwide. Many rink owners support this activity, along with roller hockey, speed skating, and roller figure skating contests.
So, we see the history and GROWTH of Roller Rinks.
In your dream we notice 2 roller rinks closed and one abandoned! This is not the end but a NEW BEGINNING in your life.
In your dream I see you transitioning between one era, the younger era, and the new more modern era seen so clearly in the history of Roller Rinks.
It’s a time when people are sad because they see an era that has come to an end. But you on the other hand press forward buying up an abandoned facility to develop buildings. This is immense in that it suggests not only your own growth but that of others? Again notice the set of 3 stages..
1/one building is developed for general and social 2/then another building is developed for a Hockey Rink. 3/ then the next is for skaters with half pipes. So we see full integration in your own personal life. Gone are the days of gaps between the pies and gone are the days of disco a Roller Rinks with flashing lights but now we see MATURITY and SPECIALISED skills. Lastly we see again in fin detail a true picture of your growth and maturity as you work and live to your full potential skating with skill and ease between each building because you have again JOINED their pathways.

post_text:
I had a strange occurence few days ago, when i decided to do active imagination.
I found video of guided meditation on Youtube ( https://youtu.be/KZ-saayeXco), where woman instruct you what to do, how to relax and to send an intention, who do you want to meet in your Dream/Hypnosis state.
I wanted to meet my Shadow (i did it during the day, because i was a little afraid).
I put timer of 1 hour, and soon i feel asleep.
And then after 22 minutes i felt a slap on my face, and i woke up immediately teryfied. I cound’t continue, because it was frightening and strange.
I am aware that it could just be a reflex muscle movement, the kind you do with the hand or legs when your falling asleep, but i never before experienced twich in face, and it was genuine feeling of being slaped.

So was it a Shadow, which could be a Trickster, od does something in my Psyche think i need a slap?

YOUTUBE.COM
Meet Your Spirit Guide in a Lucid Dream Meditation for Beginners (Hypnosis)
comment_text: Oh man. I don't even trust myself under the subconscious, too many videos of people under anaesthesia influence got me worried enough about it, because you don't know what you do or say. You did this all by yourself?

post_text:
Hey guys, this is a super length post where I go into depth with 2 lucid dreams.
So 2 weeks ago I got engaged and every night after for a week I had the same dream each night in a slightly different setting. The dream was that a significantly older man was chasing after me and wanted to perform unwanted sexual acts on me. It was quite disturbing.
On Friday night though, as I was running away, I moved into another dream where I was running down a stone cavernous hallway. I'm running away from something but I'm not sure what. I keep coming to wooden doors with ironwork designs on them and unlocking them with my old fashioned, black iron key. From around the right corner, before I run to each door, there is a woman with dark hair and eyes in a pink dress towing a mule on a rope. She walks around the corner before I run down the hallway where each door is so I see her 3 or 4 times as if I'm running down the same hallways again 4 times. I never look to see if she is coming from somewhere so I don't know if there is actually a corridor she's coming from.
Eventually, I run through one of the doors and there was a white field. I hear a voice behind me and it's a futuristic-looking boy of about 18 (picture cyberpunk goggles and dystopian future-looking clothing). He says something and before I can hear it, I realize I'm dreaming, wake up and I ask him, "What are you doing here? Who are you? Why am I having this dream and what and I supposed to learn?" He smiles coyly and says I can only learn that if I promise I'm still dreaming. I say yes and he leads me back around to where I previously saw the next wooden door in the fully white field, but now there is cobblestone and an old town. I've been here before but only during summer when he place looked like a mystical campground. Now it looks dark, cold and snowy. All the people are silhouettes and faceless. The boy leads me around the block and speaks but I can't really hear him. I'm more focused on the silhouette people (if you've seen inception, the people moved in a similar way except they were only shadows). There was also nobody in the houses. As we round the second last corner of the block, I tell the boy I changed my mind and that I want to go through the wooden door instead. He asks if I'm sure and when I say yes, I suddenly become quite cartoonish and dive through the wooden door like a superhero. My brother and I not fly through space as I chose the video game as if we are at a starting screen. I choose a game called SMASH and play as a miniature gorilla with veins all over its body except this character is MY body in the same way that Ready Player One works. I win enough fights that I get chosen as a champion for the last round where I fight against a blue zombie girl who rips my nervous system out of my body with her tongue and my fiance catches me and tells me it's okay and that my real-life body won't be affected, but I was terrified I would be horribly injured in real life.

On Sunday night, I was finally attacked by this older man who chased me except I didn't experience it in the dream, I just knew he had caught me after running away and watched him leave my apartment (this is now the 7th night in a row I've been chased by him but not caught until now. It's worth mentioning that I always know I'm dreaming and try to "wake up" so that I can make him stop chasing me but I'm always unable and he gets too close for comfort so I run away). Anyways, when he leaves, I escape out my apartment balcony by jumping and land safely, feeling guilty for leaving my dog behind. I sprint to catch the bus and when I board it, I begin to question if I am dreaming. I can't think around the fact that the dream took place in my apartment for a moment, but I work around that by considering that the apartment I just saw was unpainted and I recently painted mine, and that I escaped bgy jumping which would be impossible. I suddenly wake up and can't tell if I'm dreaming or really on the bus so I ask the woman in front of me, "excuse me Bonnie, where is this bus going?" Because I knew if she answered then I was obviously dreaming since I could call her anything and have her answer. She said something like, "Oh well, things are going all over the place these days and I can't hardly ever keep track. I just go for the ride." I woke up and told the bus to stop, which it did and all the passengers froze. Next, I pointed to the ground and wanted for my dog to be there and he appeared and listened when I told the dream that he needed to be a good boy (he lay down and smiled). Next, I closed my eyes, told the bus to go to a lavender field on a beach instead, and when I opened my eyes the bus pulled up near a beautiful beach where I stepped off, smelt the sea air and lay in the field to relax. I haven't had the horrible dream of being sexually chased since.

I realize this is super long but I am having more realistic dreams more frequently and wanted to share. I've always had very vivid dreams and I am actively desiring to expand my lucid dreaming capabilities. Just wanting to know what you might think of those 2 dreams, the timing of them and the lucdity itself.

PS: It is worth noting that my first lucid dream occured when I was having a reoccuring dream of being chased and, instead of running, I turned, was attacked by a dark shadow, closed my eyes, and knew that if I opened them I would see myself and be frightened so I wished the shadow away and became lucid.
comment_text:
Wow, that’s a lot, Thank you for sharing.

I Currently don’t have anything other then the evil (man & shadow) is just that, evil.

I know for myself, when I start the change things the dream gets harder to Control and more chaotic.

That might just be me :)
I I get anything about your dream I will share it :)

What are your Intrigues About the dream?

comment_text:
First dream is very much like the tale of blue beard. Very archetypal. The wooden door, the special key are all elements from that fairytale. The older man is your animus as is the younger man blocking the door. The blue zombie girl is fascinating (blue beard reference, also in the blue beard story the young woman uses the special key to go through a secret door where she discovers the dead wives of blue beard! In this case a zombie woman). Also, the young woman’s brother turns up at the end and saves the young woman from Bluebeard.
Blue beard is an archetypal tale of what happens if you don’t trust your instincts when selecting a mate which has no doubt been stimulated from your collective unconscious due to your engagement! Very fascinating that you have these elements in the dream...

On Sunday night, I was finally attacked by this older man who chased me except I didn't experience it in the dream, I just knew he had caught me after running away and watched him leave my apartment (this is now the 7th night in a row I've been chased by him but not caught until now. It's worth mentioning that I always know I'm dreaming and try to "wake up" so that I can make him stop chasing me but I'm always unable and he gets too close for comfort so I run away). Anyways, when he leaves, I escape out my apartment balcony by jumping and land safely, feeling guilty for leaving my dog behind. I sprint to catch the bus and when I board it, I begin to question if I am dreaming. I can't think around the fact that the dream took place in my apartment for a moment, but I work around that by considering that the apartment I just saw was unpainted and I recently painted mine, and that I escaped bgy jumping which would be impossible. I suddenly wake up and can't tell if I'm dreaming or really on the bus so I ask the woman in front of me, "excuse me Bonnie, where is this bus going?" Because I knew if she answered then I was obviously dreaming since I could call her anything and have her answer. She said something like, "Oh well, things are going all over the place these days and I can't hardly ever keep track. I just go for the ride." I woke up and told the bus to stop, which it did and all the passengers froze. Next, I pointed to the ground and wanted for my dog to be there and he appeared and listened when I told the dream that he needed to be a good boy (he lay down and smiled). Next, I closed my eyes, told the bus to go to a lavender field on a beach instead, and when I opened my eyes the bus pulled up near a beautiful beach where I stepped off, smelt the sea air and lay in the field to relax. I haven't had the horrible dream of being sexually chased since.

I realize this is super long but I am having more realistic dreams more frequently and wanted to share. I've always had very vivid dreams and I am actively desiring to expand my lucid dreaming capabilities. Just wanting to know what you might think of those 2 dreams, the timing of them and the lucdity itself.

PS: It is worth noting that my first lucid dream occured when I was having a reoccuring dream of being chased and, instead of running, I turned, was attacked by a dark shadow, closed my eyes, and knew that if I opened them I would see myself and be frightened so I wished the shadow away and became lucid.
comment_text: Second dream is your animus, the relating factor of the psyche which in a woman’s dreams or fantasies is projected on to a male figure. I’d say you aren’t relating well to your instincts at this time. The shadow you saw was the shadow archetype which pops up when the ego is too one sided. This creates a shadow in the unconscious that blocks the relating factor (the animus) from reaching consciousness. The dog is also the animus. It’s appearance at the end of the dream is a positive sign since the animus when it appears as an animal indicates the disconnect from your instincts. If an animal shows up like a poisonous snake it generally means you are dangerously out of touch with instinct. The fact that your dog showed up and was pleasant to you is a sign you are better connected to your animus and so better at relating to your inner instincts and the outer world. Perhaps you have been wondering about the partner you are getting engaged to and I’d hazard a guess (obviously I don’t know either of you) but that perhaps you should trust your instincts about him. Look at him in a balanced way. See both positives and negatives. When you balance your perception of your partner you will get a clearer hit on your instincts. Sounds like by the end of the dream your better connected to your animus. This occurs when we confront the shadow...

post_text:
Hey guys, this is a super length post where I go into depth with 2 lucid dreams.
So 2 weeks ago I got engaged and every night after for a week I had the same dream each night in a slightly different setting. The dream was that a significantly older man was chasing after me and wanted to perform unwanted sexual acts on me. It was quite disturbing.
On Friday night though, as I was running away, I moved into another dream where I was running down a stone cavernous hallway. I'm running away from something but I'm not sure what. I keep coming to wooden doors with ironwork designs on them and unlocking them with my old fashioned, black iron key. From around the right corner, before I run to each door, there is a woman with dark hair and eyes in a pink dress towing a mule on a rope. She walks around the corner before I run down the hallway where each door is so I see her 3 or 4 times as if I'm running down the same hallways again 4 times. I never look to see if she is coming from somewhere so I don't know if there is actually a corridor she's coming from.
Eventually, I run through one of the doors and there was a white field. I hear a voice behind me and it's a futuristic-looking boy of about 18 (picture cyberpunk goggles and dystopian future-looking clothing). He says something and before I can hear it, I realize I'm dreaming, wake up and I ask him, "What are you doing here? Who are you? Why am I having this dream and what and I supposed to learn?" He smiles coyly and says I can only learn that if I promise I'm still dreaming. I say yes and he leads me back around to where I previously saw the next wooden door in the fully white field, but now there is cobblestone and an old town. I've been here before but only during summer when he place looked like a mystical campground. Now it looks dark, cold and snowy. All the people are silhouettes and faceless. The boy leads me around the block and speaks but I can't really hear him. I'm more focused on the silhouette people (if you've seen inception, the people moved in a similar way except they were only shadows). There was also nobody in the houses. As we round the second last corner of the block, I tell the boy I changed my mind and that I want to go through the wooden door instead. He asks if I'm sure and when I say yes, I suddenly become quite cartoonish and dive through the wooden door like a superhero. My brother and I not fly through space as I chose the video game as if we are at a starting screen. I choose a game called SMASH and play as a miniature gorilla with veins all over its body except this character is MY body in the same way that Ready Player One works. I win enough fights that I get chosen as a champion for the last round where I fight against a blue zombie girl who rips my nervous system out of my body with her tongue and my fiance catches me and tells me it's okay and that my real-life body won't be affected, but I was terrified I would be horribly injured in real life.

It's worth mentioning that I always know I'm dreaming and try to "wake up" so that I can make him stop chasing me but I'm always unable and he gets too close for comfort so I run away). Anyways, when he leaves, I escape out my apartment balcony by jumping and land safely, feeling guilty for leaving my dog behind. I sprint to catch the bus and when I board it, I begin to question if I am dreaming. I can't think around the fact that the dream took place in my apartment for a moment, but I work around that by considering that the apartment I just saw was unpainted and I recently painted mine, and that I escaped bgy jumping which would be impossible. I suddenly wake up and can't tell if I'm dreaming or really on the bus so I ask the woman in front of me, "excuse me Bonnie, where is this bus going?" Because I knew if she answered then I was obviously dreaming since I could call her anything and have her answer. She said something like, "Oh well, things are going all over the place these days and I can't hardly ever keep track. I just go for the ride." I woke up and told the bus to stop, which it did and all the passengers froze. Next, I pointed to the ground and wanted for my dog to be there and he appeared and listened when I told the dream that he needed to be a good boy (he lay down and smiled). Next, I closed my eyes, told the bus to go to a lavender field on a beach instead, and when I opened my eyes the bus pulled up near a beautiful beach where I stepped off, smelt the sea air and lay in the field to relax. I haven't had the horrible dream of being sexually chased since.

I realize this is super long but I am having more realistic dreams more frequently and wanted to share. I've always had very vivid dreams and I am actively desiring to expand my lucid dreaming capabilities. Just wanting to know what you might think of those 2 dreams, the timing of them and the lucdity itself.

PS: It is worth noting that my first lucid dream occured when I was having a reoccuring dream of being chased and, instead of running, I turned, was attacked by a dark shadow, closed my eyes, and knew that if I opened them I would see myself and be frightened so I wished the shadow away and became lucid.
comment_text: By the way, this archetypal stuff coming up in a dream isn’t necessarily a bad thing or a warning. You might be nervous or apprehensive and that’s what maybe clouding your instincts. He could be the perfect partner. Let go of fear and trust your instincts. If you instinctively think he’s the one go for it! The fact your fiancé saves you at the end of the first dream is a good sign 👍

comment_text:
Sorry I haven't been very active lately but I live for dreams like this pretty much.

My take on it is the older man represents wisdom I think, and the forced sexual acts and running from it is something along the lines of the refusal to accept some horrible truth , something you are not comfortable with which would be why the unwanted sexual act is used as a symbol.

I think this is then symbolised as a cyclic thing that you keep being forced toward something repeatedly over and over but refuse to confront, preferring to intellectually close the door on it. But it doesn't go away, it just comes back again and again.

I'm not sure what that would be, but I would think it relates to the donkey/mule/
ass being led by the soulless zombie chick all dressed up in a very feminine pink dress... Interesting because it shifts from the old masculine man to this image... I'm trying to wrap my head around that...

Then steam punk guy, might be around future stuff somehow, tries to make you confront this but you can't bring yourself to do it. You go back to the old cycle rather than learn what you don't want to.

Anyhow out of time maybe I look at the bus dream in a couple hours.

So I totally overlooked the game sequence in previous comment. So I'm thinking this is an inner conflict you are fighting between the masculine side and feminine side. post_text:
“Even if, juristically speaking, we were not accessories to the crime, we are always, thanks to our human nature, potential criminals. In reality we merely lacked a suitable opportunity to be drawn into the infernal mêlée. None of us stands outside humanity’s black collective shadow. Whether the crime occurred many generations back or happens today, it remains the symptom of a disposition that is always and everywhere present—and one would therefore do well to possess some “imagination for evil,” for only the fool can permanently disregard the conditions of his own nature. In fact, this negligence is the best means of making him an instrument of evil.

Harmlessness and naïveté are as little helpful as it would be for a cholera patient and those in his vicinity to remain unconscious of the contagiousness of the disease.On the contrary, they lead to projection of the unrecognized evil into the “other.” This strengthens the opponent’s position in the most effective way, because the projection carries the fear which we involuntarily and secretly feel for our own evil over to the other side and considerably increases the formidableness of his threat. What is even worse, our lack of insight deprives us of the capacity to deal with evil.
....
It would be an insufferable thought that we had to take personal responsibility for so much guiltiness. We therefore prefer to localize the evil in individual criminals or groups of criminals, while washing our hands in innocence and ignoring the general proclivity to evil.”
The Undiscovered Self [1957, 2010]
Carl Jung
CW 10, paragraph 572/573

media1.tenor.co
comment_text:
The Apostle Paul shows very clearly how we ought to overcome evil.
Romans 12:21
New International Version
Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
Paul goes on to say that we cannot overcome evil by willpower alone. He says that evil is overcome through Jesus who himself overcame evil. therefore we can rely on him.
Romans 7:24-25
New King James Version
24 O wretched man that I am! Who will deliver me (A)from this body of death? 25 (B)I thank God—through Jesus Christ our Lord!

Is it possible to be an individual with strength but humility, and understanding that everyone has the power to do harm, and rightfully resent those who don't recognize that, and hurt everyone around them, or willfully go hurt someone for pleasure? Or is everyone in the same boat of guiltiness?

Whether the crime occurred many generations back or happens today, it remains the symptom of a disposition that is always and everywhere present—and one would therefore do well to possess some “imagination for evil,” for only the fool can permanently disregard the conditions of his own nature. In fact, this negligence is the best means of making him an instrument of evil.

Harmlessness and naïveté are as little helpful as it would be for a cholera patient and those in his vicinity to remain unconscious of the contagiousness of the disease.On the contrary, they lead to projection of the unrecognized evil into the “other.” This strengthens the opponent’s position in the most effective way, because the projection carries the fear which we involuntarily and secretly feel for our own evil over to the other side and considerably increases the formidableness of his threat. What is even worse, our lack of insight deprives us of the capacity to deal with evil.
....
It would be an insufferable thought that we had to take personal responsibility for so much guiltiness. We therefore prefer to localize the evil in individual criminals or groups of criminals, while washing our hands in innocence and ignoring the general proclivity to evil.”
The Undiscovered Self [1957, 2010]
Carl Jung
CW 10, paragraph 572/573

post_text:
I often get nightmares and most of them never really bothered me but this one did so I’m sharing this in the interest of getting some insights from you guys.

I had a dream that I was smoking a cigarette, walking by a busy and narrow street. This place looks like a favela, although much cleaner and the ambiance was happy and full of energy. Unlike the slums where I used to live where it smells piss and dead rats. It was the first time I have dreamed of such a place.

I was about to cross the street when I noticed the people started running out of this man’s way. This guy was riding a scooter. He was wearing a denim cap, green long sleeve shirt, light wash pants and a pair of slippers. On his back was a sheath with a long and heavy machete with blood on it. He also had a gun but I can’t recall if it was a shotgun or a rifle. I felt something very evil and sinister as he went past me.

Then I went to this share house, upstairs where I was supposed to be living: talked to my housemates and did some other things I couldn’t recall, but I’m pretty sure those parts were fun that I forgot about the guy in the green shirt.

I climbed the staircase and opened the door at the end and there I was on the rooftop smoking another cigarette. This share house was relatively taller than most buildings that I could watch the neighbors through their windows, the street market and the people walking around. It felt very calm.

Then this woman busted out of the door - also wearing a green shirt - shaking and crying, begging for help. This woman was bleeding all over and I could see one of her eyes sticking out of her face with a huge open wound on her temple showing her cracked skull. I asked her what happened and she said “he’s here”. Then I remembered the man with a green shirt.

Then the mood of that dream turned into something out of a horror movie. The sky turned blood red. The people around were shouting “watch out! Lock your doors!”, warning the others including me. The commotion kept getting closer and closer; the kind of noise you would hear from people screaming in terror. Then I heard loud thuds inside the share house and the footsteps on the staircase. I realized that he was after the woman.

I shouted at the neighbors to call the cops. I locked the door on the rooftop from the outside with just a slide lock using a concrete nail as the barrel bolt. That way it could buy us some time at least.

I grabbed her and we jumped and ran on the roof of other houses and shacks. Then I woke up.

Any thoughts?
comment_text:
This is a dream about your shadow and the Anima plain and simple. The shadow is the part of the psyche that compensates for one sidedness in the ego. For example if you become too self righteous in some area your shadow becomes darker in compensation. In dreams it shows up for a man as a male ‘other’ or a dark and sinister place. In the case of this dream it is both.
The Woman is the Anima. The anima is the relating factor of the psyche and it helps us relate to both our inner world and outer world. It shows up in a man’s dreams or fantasies as a woman or animal. It is usually projected onto a woman since one of its roles is to help in relating to a mate for the continuation of the species which is a vital role. It is usually misinterpreted as an inner woman. It’s not. It’s an aspect of the male psyche that gets projected onto a woman.
Now, the interesting part. When we go inward to our collective Unconscious, the first thing we usually encounter is our shadow. Like I said, when the ego becomes too one sided, the shadow activates as a compensatory mechanism to bring the psyche back into homeostasis. While this self regulation is happening, we lose the connection with our relating factor, the Anima (for a woman Animus). When we lose touch with our Anima, when it is clouded over by the shadow, we lose touch with our deeper instinctive self and it’s impulses. This manifests an internal psychological pressure which may come in the form of anxiety or anger. It’s kind of an instinct ‘wounding’. Another interesting thought is the wound on the eye of the Anima. It’s the dreams way of showing you that while the shadow is active, it is not able to perform its task of looking inward or outward to full capacity.

post_text:
I always have strange dreams but because this one from last night is still
Lurking in my brain I thought I’d drop it here.
I can’t remember the whole dream but the specific part I do remember is that I was in my childhood home. I walked into the living room and my Grandfather (who is passed) was standing looking out the window with his arms crossed.
I went to the window to see what he was looking at because there was a strange glow coming from outside. I stood beside my Grandfather, who didn’t say a word. Or move for that matter. It was snowing, but the snow was almost shaped like a curved peanut in the shell and it was cascading down, heavily, in a back and forth motion that would resemble a feather floating down. I was a bit anxious about it and I heard my Mother angrily tell me— from somewhere in the background that it was just snow and that I was being ridiculous.

I tried telling her that it wasn’t normal, she wouldn’t look. I looked up at the sky and the clouds were huge and heavy and oddly close to the ground. That’s actually when my Grandfather spoke and told me that it was because there was a lack of some crucial element in the atmosphere, that something as wrong.
And then I woke up.

I’m not sure if it means anything but just wanted to get it out of my head
comment_text:
Dreams with passed loved ones are always weird for me. They never really speak to me or acknowledge me in my dreams.

Maybe you’re feeling uneasy in your current life because of something that seems obviously off, but there’s a part of you (maybe who learned from your mother) that believes you’re overreacting and that if you just ignore it, it’s not that big of a deal. And then the part of you (maybe who learned from your grandfather) that believes this strange weather is truly indicative of something going wrong, since he can see it too.

Maybe it’s a reminder that when you come across something that is obviously incorrect, it is better to take action to see what it’s about and what needs to be done with it. Maybe it’s a reminder to trust your instinct, because you know deep down when something is bad.

post_text:
I had a dream a while ago that I’m still wondering about.

I was exploring a cave with a very high ceiling. I was trying to go deeper in the cave, when I got stuck on this giant lake in the cave. There were a couple of small rocky platforms for me to jump across with stalagmites to hide behind. The reason I had to hide behind them was because, sitting in the middle of the lake, there was a giant, skinny old man (I could see the outlines of his ribs) with a long, thin, grey beard. His eyes were closed shut, but it was as if they were open, and any time I crossed his field of vision (maybe while jumping platforms), he would raise his fists and splash the water so hard that it would create great waves and try to carry me away, and I’d have to wait for the water to be still again.

There was a story in my dream that went along with this giant old man. He suffered a great tragedy and hid in the cave many years ago. The lake was made of all his tears from crying. He cried for years and years, until he finally stopped crying and just sat there in the middle of this lake, immovable unil he attempted to drown anyone who tried to pass through by splashing the Great Lake.

I have tried and tried to figure out some reasoning behind this dream, but I’m at a loss. What do y’all think?
comment_text:
I could say lots about this but probably wouldn't make things much clearer.. If unclear of the archetypal aspect, I'd encourage you to search this group and read the handful of dreams about caves from over the last few years. Including dreams of caves with lakes in them, to help delineate the transpersonal theme, from the personal aspects of your dream.

I think reading Jung, and/or broad reading of dreams is the only way to come to any understanding of dreams, but no understanding will come without being able to correlate one's own experiences, so comparing our dreams to others, and noting the timing, is v helpful imo.

post_text:
Hello.
I had a dream about being rejected by the girl Im obsessed over.
In the dream I was swimming in a pool at a beautiful resort. I called my crush on the phone, and she didn't seem interested to talk to me much. She hung up.
I raised my eyes and I saw her by the pool, taking pictures. I swim to her and I try some small talk. Im really happy to see her. I say something like "you know what. I really like what I see now". In the dream she was pretty although she wore more makeup than her real life version.
She pretty much dismissed what I told her and she started to say the cleaning guy she saw earlier was cute.
This was like a slap in the face for me, and I woke up shortly after.

Now some context... This girl is a colleague of mine. I thought she had some interest in me, but lately I'm experiencing serious doubts about that, which drives me nuts.

Is my subconscious trying to torture me or something?
comment_text:
The message I would take pivots on the makeup. To me it's suggesting you are seeing some ideal version of her that is not the real her. Like you are psychologically
smoothing out her blemishes, but character blemishes not necessarily physical.

In my experience people don't like being on the receiving end of this sort of attention.

post_text: This is only a short one, and for context I have been working at a computer store since 2018, and I love/'make' music. It would have been some sort of street food vendor that I was working at with this other semi-faceless, thin built young guy about my age, sort of just off the kerb facing the road, and it might have even been New York City, or the US somewhere (which is weird because I live in Australia). The cooker we were using was weirdly one of those double turntables that DJs use, and we were somehow cooking scrambled eggs in big piles on top of it, and deciding what sort of herbs to put in the food. Once again, for context, once a while ago I was actually making scrambled eggs in real life, and decided to add oregano to it or something, and it ended up tasting terrible. Anyway, onto the weirder part of the dream. For some reason, I was tasked with sourcing the herbs, and for some other weird reason, they would be found only in boxes of computer monitors, specifically Acer brand ones of 2017 manufacturing year. And also, as I was searching through the boxes I think, the 'representation' of the number 2017 kept changing from 2007 and back again, and once to 2020, and beyond all of this, I can't remember much of the dream. So as you can see, I sort of recognise the three bigger and more memorable random sort of 'connections' to my life in reality, but the connection among them is just not clear.
comment_text:
Pretty complex. Curious about the US - as an Aussie I have had dreams about the US being significant as a play on words of "United States" as in two states coming together to find balance. So here I could see something similar; the turntable where music can come together and be "mixed"; the cooking of scrambled eggs where different food elements are brought together and mixed.

But that said you are also getting the herbs from monitor boxes. So maybe it is about getting a mixed view from different sources to get a balanced view of the current events in the world?

For some reason, I was tasked with sourcing the herbs, and for some other weird reason, they would be found only in boxes of computer monitors, specifically Acer brand ones of 2017 manufacturing year. And also, as I was searching through the boxes I think, the 'representation' of the number 2017 kept changing from 2007 and back again, and once to 2020, and beyond all of this, I can't remember much of the dream. So as you can see, I sort of recognise the three bigger and more memorable random sort of 'connections' to my life in reality, but the connection among them is just not clear.

post_text: This is only a short one, and for context I have been working at a computer store since 2018, and I love/'make' music. It would have been some sort of street food vendor that I was working at with this other semi-faceless, thin built young guy about my age, sort of just off the kerb facing the road, and it might have even been New York City, or the US somewhere (which is weird because I live in Australia). The cooker we were using was weirdly one of those double turntables that DJs use, and we were somehow cooking scrambled eggs in big piles on top of it, and deciding what sort of herbs to put in the food. Once again, for context, once a while ago I was actually making scrambled eggs in real life, and decided to add oregano to it or something, and it ended up tasting terrible. Anyway, onto the weirder part of the dream. For some reason, I was tasked with sourcing the herbs, and for some other weird reason, they would be found only in boxes of computer monitors, specifically Acer brand ones of 2017 manufacturing year. And also, as I was searching through the boxes I think, the 'representation' of the number 2017 kept changing from 2007 and back again, and once to 2020, and beyond all of this, I can't remember much of the dream. So as you can see, I sort of recognise the three bigger and more memorable random sort of 'connections' to my life in reality, but the connection among them is just not clear.
