post_text: I am together with a middle aged woman, an older man, and a younger woman. It appears that either myself, or the older man, looks exactly like Jordan Peterson and is a psychologist. We are fully dressed but laying on a double bed. Suddenly I realize that I am being subjected to a complicated deception. Everything they say is calculated to hide the fact that I have been kidnapped. The man almost immediately realize that I now know. He gets up and escape. I knock out the older woman by banging her head on the bedpost. As I do this I am struck by admiration for the genius she has displayed throughout the deception. The younger women does not feature in the rest of the dream. I hunt the man through a quiet suburban area until I am stopped by a police officer, who refuses to listen to my explanations that I am already working with the police, as a psychologist. It is only when the police officers I have contacted start arriving at the villa where I was being held that he releases me, but by then it is to late, and the criminal has escaped. I walk back to the nearby city centre. Walking aimlessly through the streets of the city, until go down below the street, into a concrete tunnel. The floor of the tunnel consists of cobblestones over which a stream of water flows. This is the Wash, the underground river, and this is London. I wake up thinking that while the culture and entertainment available in London is unsurpassed, this remains undoubtedly the worst place in the world to live.
comment_text:
Oh cool - waking up to self deception from your intellect (JP) and how the underground currents of feelings are feeding your perception of the outside world to something that you want it to be, that feels good (good entertainment),
rather than seeing it for what it actually is (worst place to be).

Like Neo waking up in the matrix I think. Have you been "red pilled" somehow?

I walk back to the nearby city centre. Walking aimlessly through the streets of the city, until go down below the street, into a concrete tunnel. I wake up thinking that while the culture and entertainment available in London is unsurpassed, this remains undoubtedly the worst place in the world to live.
comment_text:
This has an extremely similar, presumably archetypal motif to a hypnogogic vision I had a while back, which might help to share..

In a brief vision before falling asleep, I saw my dad and I were drifting down a river, grassy banks on either side, floating towards, a semi-circular arched bridge, water leaving a small gap at the top, as we neared the bridge, only a small gap of air left between the waters surface and the bottom of the bridge, I slipped underneath, my dad hit his forehead on the bridge and was knocked unconscious by it.

So the themes of being aware/
conscious/
unaware/
unconscious/
becoming aware - the transition between states of awareness - and the tunnel through which water flows seem to go together in both of these two experiences.

In your dream the water was low in the tunnel, in mine it was high, and I was up to my neck in it, which imo is primarily due to the two experiences happening at different times, ie the level of water, specifically, seems to coincide w/the point in time, and it's the detail around it that contains the more personal aspects, and what it might say about you. In other words, the high or low water in itself doesn't tell you about you as a person as distinct from others at this time.

Recalling dreams is always a case of 'becoming aware' or 'becoming conscious of what was previously only perceived unconsciously',
which is also the theme of your dream. You have fascinating dreams.

On a point of interest, your dream also has a symbol in it which is the opposite of a more well known dream motif, namely of being naked in public places, like in Genesis, whereras you noted you were dressed in bed, the opposite. Again, that detail is due to the point in time.

post_text: Not really looking for a break down of the meaning of this dream (not opposed to it if you want to) it’s just the most vivid dream I’ve ever had and kinda crazy so I figured I’d share it. I was 17-18 so about 15-16 years ago. One of my best friends and I were walking on a plato along the ocean the plato was orangish redish like the Grand Canyon colorful flowers beautiful clear sky the ocean was calm and crystal clear you could easily see all the coral and tropical fish even though the table of the plato was a good way above the water, basically imagin the most beautiful ocean seen you possibly could. So my friend and I are walking smoking a joint and talking “can’t remember a thing about the conversation” anyway I decide I’m jumping off the plato and tell my buddy he agrees it’s the right thing to do so we jump. It was as amazing as I thought it would be everything was so pretty. Then a dolphin swam close to us and let us pet it I decided I’m riding this damn thing so I grab it’s top fin and away we go he took me all over showing me all the beautiful things it was great I was having such a good time after a while I thought man I’m hogging the dolphin Marky needs to do this too so we go back to my friend and I let him have a turn. That’s when it went down I guess the dolphin didn’t like my buddy cause he started ramming him knocking him out of the water and there’s nothing I can do I have no weapon and you can’t fight a dolphin in water with no weapon and win so I’m terrified my buddies limp body just getting thrashed and nothing I can do about it then I woke up. So it went from probably the best dream I’ve ever had directly into one of the scariest dreams I’ve ever had.
comment_text: It sounds something like you had great peace and clarity, almost like you were attune with the world around you. Both you and your friend took a plunge into the ‘underworld.’ You thrived in it, and when you encountered a beast of the underworld, you conquered and subjugated it by riding it, possibly an integration with the shadow (dolphins can be both quite compassionate and quite sadistic creatures). However, you’re friend had no such luck. Perhaps your dream is worried that your friend might not be able to weather the chaos to come. I know that sounds bleak, but I hope it’s helpful
